analyzed: atha candra gati viśeṣāt iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that this is due to a special motion of the moon, that is not so.

analyzed: nakṣatra ardhasya sakalasya vā hrāsa vṛddhī bhavataḥ
translated: The waning or waxing is of half a constellation or of a whole constellation.

analyzed: na nakṣatra dvayasya  śukla ādau punar māse vaiśākha paurṇamāsyām
translated: Not of two constellations.

analyzed: vyatītāyām vaiśākhasya eva amāvāsyā bhaviṣyati
translated: But if the month begins with the bright fortnight, then on the full moon of Vaiśākha having passed, the new moon of Vaiśākha itself will occur.

original: tataḥ kṛṣṇapakṣapratipatprabhṛtyanurādhādiṣu gaṇyamānāsu rohiṇyā amāvāsyāyāḥ ca yogaḥ saṃbhavati /
analyzed: tatas kṛṣṇapakṣa pratipad prabhṛti anurādhā ādiṣu gaṇyamānāsu rohiṇyāḥ amāvāsyāyāḥ ca yogaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: Then, starting from the first day of the dark fortnight, when the lunar mansions Anurādhā and so on are counted, a conjunction with Rohiṇī is possible on the new moon day.

analyzed: anyat ca
translated: And furthermore:

analyzed: saḥ aparapakṣe apa oṣadhīḥ praviśati  iti
translated: He enters the plants in the dark fortnight.

analyzed: śatapathaḥ evam paṭhyate
translated: This is what is read.

analyzed: tatra aparapakṣaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ na śuklaḥ
translated: There, the dark fortnight is the dark half, not the bright half.

analyzed: anyat ca smārta vacanam
translated: And there is another statement of Smṛti:

original: aparapakṣe śrāddham kurvīta ūrdhvam vā caturthyāḥ /
analyzed: aparapakṣe śrāddham kurvīta ūrdhvam vā caturthyāḥ
translated: One should perform the śrāddha in the dark fortnight, or after the fourth day.

analyzed: iti atra kṛṣṇa ādi māsa tvāt pūrvapakṣaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ
translated: Here, because the month begins with the dark half, the dark half is the first half.

analyzed: aparaḥ śuklaḥ
translated: The other is the bright half.

original: aparatvāt śuklapakṣasya śuklapakṣe eva śrāddhavidhiḥ prāpnoti na kṛṣṇe /
analyzed: aparatvāt śuklapakṣasya śuklapakṣe eva śrāddha vidhiḥ prāpnoti na kṛṣṇe
translated: Because the bright half is the latter, the rule for the śrāddha applies only to the bright half, not to the dark half.

analyzed: iṣyate ca śukle tare
translated: And it is desired in the bright half.

analyzed: tasmāt śuklādiḥ māsaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, the month begins with the bright half.

original: tataḥ yugavarṣamāsadivasāḥ samam pravṛttāḥ tu caitraśuklādeḥ iti /
analyzed: tatas yuga varṣa māsa divasāḥ samam pravṛttāḥ tu caitra śukla ādeḥ iti
translated: Then the yuga, years, months, and days began together from the bright half of Caitra.

analyzed: atra utprekṣita pūrvapakṣaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: Here, the previous view should be seen as imagined.

original: yugādīnām caitraśuklāditaḥ pravṛttitvāt kālasya ādimattāprasaṅgaḥ iti āha kālaḥ ayam anādyantaḥ /
analyzed: yuga ādīnām caitra śukla āditaḥ pravṛtti tvāt kālasya ādimat tā prasaṅgaḥ iti āha kālaḥ ayam anādyantaḥ
translated: And because the yuga and so on begin from the bright half of Caitra, there is the consequence that time has a beginning. Therefore it is said: This time is without beginning or end.

analyzed: ayam kālaḥ asmābhiḥ yugādiḥ abhihitaḥ
translated: This is the beginning of the yuga that we have stated.

analyzed: caitra śukla ādeḥ pravṛttaḥ iti
translated: It has commenced from the bright fortnight of Caitra.

original: na asya antaḥ na asya ādiḥ /
analyzed: na asya antaḥ na asya ādiḥ
translated: It has no end and no beginning.

analyzed: vyavahāra artham ādiḥ antaḥ ca parikalpitaḥ
translated: For the sake of convention, an end and a beginning are imagined.

original: yadi kālasya ādiḥ syāt tataḥ kim syāt /🔽āha saṃsārasya ādimattā prāpnoti /
analyzed: yadi kālasya ādiḥ syāt tatas kim syāt  āha saṃsārasya ādimat tā prāpnoti
translated: If there were a beginning of time, what would happen?🔽He says: The beginninglessness of saṃsāra would follow.

analyzed: iṣyate ca anādiḥ saṃsāraḥ iti
translated: And saṃsāra is accepted as beginningless.

original: tasmāt yuktam kālaḥ ayam anādyantaḥ iti /
analyzed: tasmāt yuktam kālaḥ ayam anādyantaḥ iti
translated: Therefore it is correct to say that time has no beginning or end.

original: katham punar asya ādiḥ vyavahārārtham parikalpitaḥ iti āha grahabhaiḥ anumīyate kṣetre /
analyzed: katham punar asya ādiḥ vyavahāra artham parikalpitaḥ iti āha grahabhaiḥ anumīyate kṣetre
translated: How then is its beginning imagined for the sake of convention? He says: The beginning and end are inferred from the planets and stars.

analyzed: grahāḥ ca bhāni ca grahabhāni
translated: The planets and stars are the graha-bhāni.

original: taiḥ grahabhaiḥ anumīyate ādiḥ antaḥ ca /
analyzed: taiḥ grahabhaiḥ anumīyate ādiḥ antaḥ ca
translated: From those graha-bhāni, the beginning and end are inferred.

original: māṅ māne pāṇinīyadhātupāṭhaḥ iti ayam dhātuḥ dhūmāt agnyanumānam iti atra māne vartate /
analyzed: māk māne pāṇinīya dhātu pāṭhaḥ iti ayam dhātuḥ dhūmāt agni anumānam iti atra māne vartate
translated: The root mā in the sense of measuring, as in the Pāṇinian Dhatupāṭha, occurs here in the sense of inferring, as in fire is inferred from smoke.

original: atra punar grahabhaiḥ anumīyate iti mānārthaḥ eva /
analyzed: atra punar grahabhaiḥ anumīyate iti mānārthaḥ eva
translated: But here again, in inferred from the graha-bhāni, it is used in the sense of measuring.

analyzed: vrīhi ādi rāśayaḥ prastha ādibhiḥ anumīyante
translated: Piles of rice etc. are inferred from prastha etc.

analyzed: kuṅkuma ādayaḥ vā pala ādibhiḥ
translated: Or saffron etc. from pala etc.

analyzed: evam grahabhaiḥ iti
translated: In the same way, from the graha-bhāni.

analyzed: yadā sarve eva grahāḥ yugapad
translated: When all the planets are simultaneously

original: mīnameṣasandhau kṣitisaṃyuktāḥ tadā yugasya ādiḥ iti /
analyzed: mīna meṣa sandhau kṣiti saṃyuktāḥ tadā yugasya ādiḥ iti
translated: in conjunction with the earth at the conjunction of Pisces and Aries, then that is the beginning of the yuga.

analyzed: kaḥ bhuvaḥ grahasya ca yogaḥ
translated: What is the conjunction of the earth and the planet?

analyzed: dvayoḥ atyanta viprakṛṣṭayoḥ
translated: Of the two that are extremely distant from each other.

analyzed: na eṣaḥ doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: mukhyasya yogasya asaṃbhavāt gauṇaḥ yogaḥ parigṛhyate /🔽yatra bhūlagnaḥ iva grahaḥ lakṣyate sa bhūgrahayoḥ yogaḥ /
analyzed: mukhyasya yogasya asaṃbhavāt gauṇaḥ yogaḥ parigṛhyate  yatra bhūlagnaḥ iva grahaḥ lakṣyate sa bhūgrahayoḥ yogaḥ
translated: Because the primary conjunction is impossible, the secondary conjunction is accepted.🔽Where the planet appears as if it is on the earth, that is the conjunction of the earth and the planet.

original: sa ca udayāstamayayoḥ saṃbhavati iti udayāstamayayoḥ vā parigṛhyate /
analyzed: sa ca udaya astamayayoḥ saṃbhavati iti udaya astamayayoḥ vā parigṛhyate
translated: And that is possible at sunrise and sunset, so it is accepted at sunrise and sunset.

original: anye punar anyathā vyāvarṇayanti grahabhaiḥ anumīyate iti /
analyzed: anye punar anyathā vyāvarṇayanti grahabhaiḥ anumīyate iti
translated: Others describe it differently, saying it is inferred by the planets and stars.

original: grahaiḥ ca nakṣatraiḥ ca kālasya ādiḥ antaḥ ca parikalpyate / tat yathā
analyzed: grahaiḥ ca nakṣatraiḥ ca kālasya ādiḥ antaḥ ca parikalpyate tat yathā
translated: The beginning and end of time are imagined by the planets and stars. For example:

analyzed: udeti yasmin nakṣatre pravāsa upagataḥ aṅgirāḥ
translated: In which constellation did Angiras set out on his journey when he rose?

original: tasmāt saṃvatsaraḥ māsāt bārhaspatyaḥ pragaṇyatām // iti /
analyzed: tasmāt saṃvatsaraḥ māsāt bārhaspatyaḥ pragaṇyatām iti
translated: From that, let the year be calculated as one month of Brihaspati.

analyzed: bṛhaspati cāra vaśāt kālasya ādiḥ parikalpitaḥ
translated: The beginning of time is imagined based on the motion of Brihaspati.

original: loke ca evam vaktāraḥ bhavanti svātau udite prasthāsyāmahe udayaḥ iti /
analyzed: loke ca evam vaktāraḥ bhavanti svātau udite prasthāsyāmahe udayaḥ iti
translated: And people speak like this: When Svaty rises, we will set out at sunrise.

analyzed: śukre astam gate prasthitaḥ iti
translated: When Venus has set, he has departed.

original: adya kṛttikāsu madhyasthitāsu dārukaḥ gataḥ iti ādi /
analyzed: adya kṛttikāsu madhyasthitāsu dārukaḥ gataḥ iti ādi
translated: Today, when the Krittikas are in the middle, Daruka has gone, and so on.

analyzed: kṣetre
translated: In the field.

analyzed: kṣetram bha golaḥ
translated: The field is the celestial globe.

analyzed: tasmin bha gole
translated: In that celestial globe.

analyzed: nakṣatra graha cāra vaśāt ādiḥ antaḥ ca parikalpitaḥ  /
translated: The beginning and end are imagined based on the motion of the lunar mansions and planets.

analyzed: grahāṇām sama gati tvam
translated: The equal motion of the planets

analyzed: grahāṇām sama gati pratipādanāya āha
translated: To explain the equal motion of the planets, it is said:

analyzed: ṣaṣṭyā sūrya abdānām prapūrayanti grahāḥ bha pariṇāham
translated: The planets fill the circumference of the sun in sixty solar years.

analyzed: divyena nabhaḥparidhim samam bhramantaḥ sva kakṣyāsu
translated: Moving in their own orbits, they revolve around the celestial sphere equally.

original: ṣaṣṭyā sūryābdānām ādityavarṣāṇām ṣaṣṭyā grahāḥ nakṣatrakakṣyām prapūrayanti /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭyā sūryābdānām ādityavarṣāṇām ṣaṣṭyā grahāḥ nakṣatrakakṣyām prapūrayanti
translated: In sixty solar years, the planets fill the lunar mansion orbit.

original: nakṣatrakakṣyātulyāni yojanāni svāsu svāsu kakṣyāsu gacchanti iti arthaḥ /
analyzed: nakṣatra kakṣyā tulyāni yojanāni svāsu svāsu kakṣyāsu gacchanti iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they travel in their own orbits as many yojanas as there are in the lunar mansion orbit.

original: kiyadyojanāni punar nakṣatrakakṣyāyām grahāḥ sūryābdānām ṣaṣṭyā pūrayanti /
analyzed: kiyat yojanāni punar nakṣatra kakṣyāyām grahāḥ sūrya abdānām ṣaṣṭyā pūrayanti
translated: But how many yojanas do the planets fill in the lunar mansion orbit in sixty solar years?

analyzed: ucyate vasu viyat ambara ākāśa rasa yama tri śaila candrāḥ
translated: It is said: The numbers of the Vasus, Visvedevas, Ambaras, Akasas, Rasas, Yamas, the three mountains, and the moon.

analyzed: na etat asmābhiḥ nakṣatrakakṣyāpramāṇam dṛṣṭam
translated: We have not seen this measure of the lunar mansion orbit.

original: kim tarhi / kā eṣā pratipāditā iti /
analyzed: kim tarhi kā eṣā pratipāditā iti
translated: What then? What has been taught?

analyzed: ucyate bhavāṃśe arkaḥ gītikā iti
translated: It is said: In the part of existence, the sun is the song.

analyzed: atra katham
translated: Here, how?

original: punar etena eva nakṣatrakakṣyātulyāni yojanāni gacchanti iti ucyate /
analyzed: punar etena eva nakṣatrakakṣyā tulyāni yojanāni gacchanti iti ucyate
translated: Again, it is said that they travel the same number of yojanas as the ecliptic.

original: yadi khyughṛtulyaiḥ arkavarṣaiḥ svānsvān bhagaṇān grahāḥ bhuñjante tadā ṣaṣṭyā sūryābdaiḥ kiyantaḥ iti /
analyzed: yadi arka varṣaiḥ svān svān bhagaṇān grahāḥ bhuñjante tadā ṣaṣṭyā sūrya abdaiḥ kiyantaḥ iti
translated: If the planets enjoy their own bhaganas with solar years equal to khyuga, then how many with sixty solar years?

analyzed: ṣaṣṭibhāgena api ṣaṣṭyā ekaḥ
translated: With a sixty-part, with sixty one.

original: punar ṣaṣṭibhāgena eteṣām khyughṛtulyānām arkavarṣāṇām dvāsaptatisahasrāṇi /
analyzed: punar ṣaṣṭibhāgena eteṣām khyughṛtulyānām arkavarṣāṇām dvāsaptatisahasrāṇi
translated: Again, with a sixty-part, of those solar years equal to khyuga, seventy-two thousand.

original: evam yathābhāgena avinaṣṭarāśayaḥ sthāpyāḥ /🔽tataḥ punar api yadi ekena bhagaṇena pratisvakakṣyā labhyate tadā ṣaṣṭyabdabhogena kā iti sarvagrahebhyaḥ nakṣatrakakṣyā
analyzed: evam yathābhāgena avinaṣṭa rāśayaḥ sthāpyāḥ  tatas punar api yadi ekena bhagaṇena pratisva kakṣyā labhyate tadā ṣaṣṭi abda bhogena kā iti sarva grahebhyaḥ nakṣatra kakṣyā
translated: Thus, the undamaged signs should be placed according to their parts.

analyzed: labhyate  divyena nabhaḥparidhim
translated: Then again, if the ecliptic of each is obtained with one bhagana, then how many with the enjoyment of sixty years? The ecliptic of the nakshatras is obtained from all the planets.🔽With the divine, the celestial sphere.

analyzed: divi bhavam divyam
translated: What exists in the sky is divine.

analyzed: yugam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is yuga.

analyzed: katham punar divya śabdena yugam abhidhīyate
translated: But how is the yuga denoted by the word divine?

original: yasmāt divi sañcaratām grahāṇām ekatra yogaḥ bhavati /
analyzed: yasmāt divi sañcaratām grahāṇām ekatra yogaḥ bhavati
translated: Because there is a conjunction of the planets moving in the sky in one place.

original: ataḥ divyam yugam uktam tena divyena nabhaḥparidhim /
analyzed: ataḥ divyam yugam uktam tena divyena nabhaḥparidhim
translated: Therefore, the divine yuga is mentioned. By that divine [yuga], the celestial sphere.

analyzed: nabhasaḥ paridhiḥ nabhaḥparidhiḥ
translated: The celestial sphere is the celestial sphere.

analyzed: ākāśakakṣyā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is the celestial equator.

analyzed: katham idam ucyate
translated: How is this said?

original: nanu ca viyat aparimitayojanapramāṇam iti śrūyate /
analyzed: nanu ca viyat aparimita yojana pramāṇam iti śrūyate
translated: But is it not heard that the sky has an immeasurable number of yojanas?

analyzed: tasya parimita yojana pramāṇam katham kakṣyā bhavet
translated: How can its limited number of yojanas be a celestial equator?

analyzed: ucyate viyat asmākam yāvat
translated: It is said that the sky for us is as far as
the sun's rays illuminate.

original: ataḥ param ākāśam aprameyam iti /🔽atra khakakṣyābhidhānena etat pratipādayati /
analyzed: atas param ākāśam aprameyam iti  atra kha kakṣyā abhidhānena etat pratipādayati
translated: Beyond that, the sky is immeasurable.🔽Here, by mentioning the celestial equator, this is taught.

analyzed: iyat pramāṇam viyat arka marīcayaḥ prāpnuvanti iti
translated: The sun's rays reach this much of the sky.

analyzed: samam bhramantaḥ
translated: They revolve equally.

analyzed: tulyayā gatyā bhramantaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is they revolve with an equal speed.

original: yāvanti yojanāni svakakṣyāyām śaśī saṃcarati tāvanti eva yojanāni ārkiḥ api svakakṣyāyām sañcarati /
analyzed: yāvanti yojanāni svakakṣyāyām śaśī saṃcarati tāvanti eva yojanāni ārkiḥ api svakakṣyāyām sañcarati
translated: As many yojanas as the moon moves in its own orbit, that many yojanas the sun also moves in its own orbit.

original: tat yathā yadi ekena bhagaṇena svakakṣyā labhyate tadā yugabhagaṇaiḥ kim iti khakakṣyā labhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā yadi ekena bhagaṇena svakakṣyā labhyate tadā yuga bhagaṇaiḥ kim iti khakakṣyā labhyate
translated: For example, if its own orbit is obtained by one bhagana, then by how many yuga bhaganas is the celestial equator obtained?

original: athavā ṣaṣṭyabdabhogena nakṣatrakakṣyā labhyate svaiḥ yugabhagaṇaiḥ kim iti khakakṣyā labhyate /
analyzed: athavā ṣaṣṭi abda bhogena nakṣatra kakṣyā labhyate svaiḥ yuga bhagaṇaiḥ kim iti kha kakṣyā labhyate
translated: Or, the orbit of the stars is obtained by the enjoyment of sixty years, why is the orbit of the planets not obtained by their own yuga-bhaganas?

analyzed: evam yojana gatena grahāḥ tulya gatayaḥ
translated: Thus, the planets have equal motions in yojanas.

analyzed: kakṣyātaḥ grahāṇām madhyamānayanam yadi
translated: If the mean motion of the planets from the orbit is

original: yugabhūdinaiḥ sarve eva svāsu kakṣyāsu samagatyā bhramantaḥ khakakṣyātulyāni yojanāni prayānti /
analyzed: yuga bhū dinaiḥ sarve eva svāsu kakṣyāsu sama gatyā bhramantaḥ kha kakṣyā tulyāni yojanāni prayānti
translated: all of them, moving with equal motion in their own orbits, travel yojanas equal to the orbit of the sky in yuga-days.

original: ekena ahnā kiyanti iti sarvagrahāṇām yojanagatā dinabhuktiḥ labhyate iti /
analyzed: ekena ahnā kiyanti iti sarva grahāṇām yojana gatā dina bhuktiḥ labhyate iti
translated: How many [yojanas] in one day? The daily motion in yojanas of all the planets is obtained.

original: khakakṣyāyām bhūdinaiḥ bhāge hṛte yojanagatā grahāṇām dinabhuktiḥ labhyate /
analyzed: kha kakṣyāyām bhū dinaiḥ bhāge hṛte yojana gatā grahāṇām dina bhuktiḥ labhyate
translated: The daily motion in yojanas of the planets is obtained by dividing the [motion] in the orbit of the sky by the number of days.

original: tayā trairāśikam bhaṅktvā madhyamagrahāḥ ānīyante yadi svakakṣyāyojanaiḥ bhagaṇaḥ labhyate tadā gatiyojanaiḥ kim iti āhnikī bhuktiḥ labhyate /
analyzed: tayā trairāśikam bhaṅktvā madhyamagrahāḥ ānīyante yadi sva kakṣyā yojanaiḥ bhagaṇaḥ labhyate tadā gati yojanaiḥ kim iti āhnikī bhuktiḥ labhyate
translated: By solving the equation in terms of three [unknown] quantities with that [daily motion], the mean planets are obtained. If the bhagana is obtained in yojanas of their own orbits, then how many [yojanas] in the daily motion in the motion [of the planets]?

original: tataḥ punar api yadi ekena ahnā bhuktiḥ labhyate ahargaṇena
analyzed: tatas punar api yadi ekena ahnā bhuktiḥ labhyate ahargaṇena
translated: Then again, if the motion is obtained in one day, then in a number of days

original: kim iti / atra ekaḥ pūrvatrairāśike guṇakāraḥ /
analyzed: kim iti atra ekaḥ pūrva trairāśike guṇakāraḥ
translated: how many [yojanas]? Here, one is the multiplicand in the previous equation in terms of three [unknown] quantities.

analyzed: apare bhāgahāraḥ
translated: The other is the divisor.

original: ataḥ guṇakārabhāgahārayoḥ tulyatvāt naṣṭayoḥ ahargaṇasya dinagatiyojanāni guṇakāraḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: atas guṇakāra bhāgahārayoḥ tulya tvāt naṣṭayoḥ ahargaṇasya dina gati yojanāni guṇakāraḥ sthitaḥ
translated: Therefore, since the multiplier and divisor are equal, when the lost [multiplier and divisor] are gone, the multiplier of the day-count in terms of the motion of the day is established.

analyzed: sva kakṣyā yojanāni bhāgahāraḥ
translated: The own-orbit yojanas are the divisor.

analyzed: labdhiḥ bhagaṇa ādayaḥ uktam ca
translated: The result is the bhaganas, etc. And it is said:

original: ambarakakṣyā bhūdinahṛtā phalam tatra yojanāni teṣu /🔽gatāhasaṃguṇiteṣu svagrahakakṣyāptabhagaṇādyam //
analyzed: ambara kakṣyā bhū dina hṛtā phalam tatra yojanāni teṣu  gata aha saṃguṇiteṣu sva graha kakṣyā āpta bhagaṇa ādyam
translated: The result of the earth-day division of the sky-orbit is yojanas there.🔽The bhaganas, etc. are obtained when multiplied by the passed days and divided by the own-orbit.

original: iti / athavā khakakṣyāhargaṇasaṃvarge svakakṣyābhūdinasaṃvargahṛte bhagaṇādayaḥ bhavanti // //
analyzed: iti athavā kha kakṣyā ahargaṇa saṃvarge sva kakṣyā bhū dina saṃvarga hṛte bhagaṇa ādayaḥ bhavanti  /
translated: Or, the bhaganas, etc. are obtained when the sum of the sky-orbit and day-count is divided by the sum of the own-orbit and earth-day.

analyzed: grahāṇām sama gati tvena kakṣyā vyavasthā
translated: The arrangement of the orbits of the planets due to their equal motion

analyzed: sama gatyā pravṛtta graha kakṣyā vyavasthā pradarśana artham āha
translated: In order to show the arrangement of the orbits of the planets moving with equal motion, it is said:

original: maṇḍalam alpam adhastāt kālena alpena pūrayati candraḥ /
analyzed: maṇḍalam alpam adhastāt kālena alpena pūrayati candraḥ
translated: The moon fills the small circle below in a short time.

original: upariṣṭāt sarveṣām mahat ca mahatā śanaiḥ cārī // //
analyzed: upariṣṭāt sarveṣām mahat ca mahatā śanaiḥ cārī  /
translated: Above all, the large one slowly with a large [time].

analyzed: maṇḍalam alpam adhastāt
translated: The small circle below.

original: sarveṣām adhaḥ vyavasthitam maṇḍalam alpam alpena kālena pūrayati candramāḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣām adhas vyavasthitam maṇḍalam alpam alpena kālena pūrayati candramāḥ
translated: The moon fills the small circle located below all in a short time.

original: adhastāt iti anena eva maṇḍalasya alpatvasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: adhastāt iti anena eva maṇḍalasya alpatva siddhiḥ
translated: By the word 'below', the smallness of the circle is established.

analyzed: alpam iti etat na vaktavyam
translated: This 'small' should not be stated.

original: katham adhastāt iti etāvati ucyamāne maṇḍalasya alpatvam gamyate /
analyzed: katham adhastāt iti etāvati ucyamāne maṇḍalasya alpatvam gamyate
translated: How is the smallness of the circle understood when only 'below' is said?

analyzed: ucyate upari upari kakṣyāḥ vyavasthitāḥ
translated: It is said that the orbits are arranged one above the other.

original: tāsām upari upari vyavasthitānām adhaḥ yā vyavasthitā sā sarvatanīyasī /
analyzed: tāsām upari upari vyavasthitānām adhas yā vyavasthitā sā sarvatanīyasī
translated: Among those arranged one above the other, the one below is the smallest.

analyzed: tasmāt adhastāt induḥ syāt
translated: Therefore, the moon should be below.

analyzed: na etat asti
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: bhānām adhas śanais cara kālakriyā
translated: The time of death is below the shining ones and Saturn.

original: iti atra kakṣyāṇām upari upari vyavasthitim vakṣyati /
analyzed: iti atra kakṣyāṇām upari upari vyavasthitim vakṣyati
translated: Here, he will speak of the arrangement of the orbits one above the other.

original: nanu ca anye bruvate sarveṣām upari candramasaḥ kakṣyā iti /
analyzed: nanu ca anye bruvate sarveṣām upari candramasaḥ kakṣyā iti
translated: But others say that the orbit of the moon is above all.

analyzed: tat ayuktam
translated: That is incorrect.

original: sarveṣām grahāṇām adhaḥ candrakakṣyā iti āha /
analyzed: sarveṣām grahāṇām adhas candrakakṣyā iti āha
translated: He says that the orbit of the moon is below all the planets.

original: yadi upari syāt tadā candrasya grahanakṣatrabhede sphuṭakalaṅkahariṇe grahanakṣatratārāḥ dṛśyeran /
analyzed: yadi upari syāt tadā candrasya graha nakṣatra bhede sphuṭa kalaṅka hariṇe graha nakṣatra tārāḥ dṛśyeran
translated: If it were above, then in the clear distinction of planets and stars from the moon, the planets, stars and constellations would be seen in the clear spot on the moon.

original: sūryavaśāt yadi upari candraḥ syāt tadā sūryeṇa ārāt vyavasthitena sadā candramasoḥ api svasya ārāt bhāgam akhaṇḍam dṛśyeta /
analyzed: sūryavaśāt yadi upari candraḥ syāt tadā sūryeṇa ārāt vyavasthitena sadā candramasoḥ api svasya ārāt bhāgam akhaṇḍam dṛśyeta
translated: If the moon were above the sun, then the moon's own part, which is far away from the sun, would always be seen complete by the sun situated far away.

analyzed: uparisthitaḥ na upalakṣyate
translated: But it is not seen above.

analyzed: tasmāt sarveṣām
translated: Therefore, all

analyzed: adhas candramāḥ
translated: the moon is below.

original: anye punar sugatamatāvalambinaḥ sūryācandramasoḥ ekām kakṣyām ācakṣate 🔽ardhena meroḥ candrārkau pañcāśatsaikayojanau /
analyzed: anye punar sugata mata avalambinaḥ sūryācandramasoḥ ekām kakṣyām ācakṣate  ardhena meroḥ candra arkau pañcāśat sa eka yojanau
translated: Others, however, who follow the teachings of the Sugata, say that the sun and moon have one orbit.🔽The sun and moon are fifty-one yojanas from half of Meru.

original: ardharātraḥ astagamanam madhyāhnaḥ udayaḥ sakṛt // iti //
analyzed: ardharātraḥ astagamanam madhyāhnaḥ udayaḥ sakṛt iti
translated: Midnight, sunset, noon, and sunrise occur simultaneously.

original: na evam yujyate /🔽yadi pañcāśat yojanāni candraḥ /
analyzed: na evam yujyate  yadi pañcāśat yojanāni candraḥ
translated: This is not reasonable.

original: ekapañcāśat yojanāni sūryaḥ tadā kim iti sūryaḥ na mahān upalabhyate /
analyzed: ekapañcāśat yojanāni sūryaḥ tadā kim iti sūryaḥ na mahān upalabhyate
translated: If the moon is fifty yojanas and the sun fifty-one yojanas, then why is the sun not seen as larger?

original: tulyau etau ardhoditau ardhāstamitau paurṇamāsyām lakṣyete /
analyzed: tulyau etau ardha uditau ardha astamitau paurṇamāsyām lakṣyete
translated: These two, half-risen and half-set, are seen equally on the full moon night.

original: atha vidūratvāt arkaḥ na mahān upalakṣyate iti cet na /
analyzed: atha vidūra tvāt arkaḥ na mahān upalakṣyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the sun is not seen as large because it is far away, that is not so.

analyzed: tarhi mandarārdhe sūryācandramasoḥ dūrībhūtaḥ arkaḥ
translated: Then the sun, which is far away from half of Mandara, is the sun and moon.

original: anyat ca tulyakakṣyāvyavasthitatvāt sūryācandramasoḥ sūryagrahaṇam na eva syāt /
analyzed: anyat ca tulya kakṣyā vyavasthita tvāt sūryācandramasoḥ sūrya grahaṇam na eva syāt
translated: Moreover, since the sun and moon are located in the same orbit, there would never be a solar eclipse.

original: na ca candramasam muktvā anyaḥ rāhuḥ asti yena savitā chādyate /
analyzed: na ca candramasam muktvā anyaḥ rāhuḥ asti yena savitā chādyate
translated: And apart from the moon, there is no other Rāhu by whom the sun is covered.

analyzed: yadi api adhas candraḥ
translated: Even if the moon were below,

original: syāt tathā api mahattvāt sūryabimbasya na eva arkaḥ sakalaḥ chādyate /
analyzed: syāt tathā api mahattvāt sūryabimbasya na eva arkaḥ sakalaḥ chādyate
translated: still, because of the sun's greater size, the entire sun is not covered.

original: na eva arkaḥ candreṇa chādyate iti cet tat api uttaratra vyākhyāsyate /🔽kālena alpena pūrayati candraḥ /
analyzed: na eva arkaḥ candreṇa chādyate iti ced tat api uttaratra vyākhyāsyate  kālena alpena pūrayati candraḥ
translated: If it is argued that the sun is not covered by the moon, that will be explained later.🔽The moon fills up in a short time.

analyzed: alpena stokena kālena pūrayati
translated: In a short, small amount of time, it fills up.

original: kim / tat alpam maṇḍalam adhaḥ vyavasthitam /
analyzed: kim tat alpam maṇḍalam adhas vyavasthitam
translated: What? That small disc is located below.

original: upariṣṭāt sarveṣām maṇḍalānām mahat maṇḍalam mahatā kālena śanaiḥ caraḥ pūrayati /
analyzed: upariṣṭāt sarveṣām maṇḍalānām mahat maṇḍalam mahatā kālena śanaiḥ caraḥ pūrayati
translated: The large disc, above all the discs, is filled up slowly by a large amount of time.

analyzed: etau alpa mahat kakṣyā maṇḍala parimāṇau grahau uddiṣṭau
translated: These two planets, with small and large orbital diameters, have been mentioned.

analyzed: anyeṣām ca maṇḍalāni svabuddhyā vijñeyāni
translated: The diameters of the others should be understood by one's own intellect.

original: tat yathā candramāḥ divasasaṅkhyayā saptaviṃśatyā sārdhaikayā maṇḍalam gacchati /
analyzed: tat yathā candramāḥ divasa saṅkhyayā saptaviṃśatyā sārdhaikayā maṇḍalam gacchati
translated: For example, the moon moves through one and twenty-nine days.

original: budhaśukraravayaḥ kiñcit ūnena varṣeṇa /🔽bhaumaḥ kiñcit ūnena🔽varṣadvayena /
analyzed: budha śukra ravayaḥ kiñcid ūnena varṣeṇa  bhaumaḥ kiñcid ūnena  varṣa dvayena
translated: [The periods of] Mercury, Venus, and the Sun are slightly less than a year.🔽[The period of] Mars is slightly less than two years.

original: guruḥ tu varṣaiḥ dvādaśabhiḥ kiñcit ūnaiḥ /
analyzed: guruḥ tu varṣaiḥ dvādaśabhiḥ kiñcid ūnaiḥ
translated: [The period of] Jupiter is slightly less than twelve years.

original: śanaiścaraḥ tu triṃśatā varṣaiḥ kiñcit ūnaiḥ iti /
analyzed: śanaiścaraḥ tu triṃśatā varṣaiḥ kiñcid ūnaiḥ iti
translated: [The period of] Saturn is slightly less than thirty years.

original: evam ete bhinnakakṣyāsthāḥ yojanagatena tulyagatayaḥ grahāḥ vyākhyātāḥ /
analyzed: evam ete bhinna kakṣyā sthāḥ yojana gatena tulya gatayaḥ grahāḥ vyākhyātāḥ
translated: Thus, the planets, occupying different orbits, are explained to have equal motions in terms of yojanas.

original: atha yadi tulyakakṣyāsthāḥ yojanagatena tulyagatayaḥ eva syuḥ tadā eteṣām yugādeḥ saṃpravṛttānām na kadācit viyogaḥ syāt /
analyzed: atha yadi tulyakakṣyāsthāḥ yojanagatena tulyagatayaḥ eva syuḥ tadā eteṣām yugādeḥ saṃpravṛttānām na kadācid viyogaḥ syāt
translated: Now, if they were to have equal motions in terms of yojanas while occupying the same orbit, then these [planets], having commenced from the beginning of the yuga, would never be separated [from each other].

original: atha yadi yojanagatena ete bhinnagatayaḥ syuḥ tadā eteṣām bhuktiliptānayane yojanaiḥ yathāsvam prasiddhabhuktiliptāḥ na āgaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: atha yadi yojana gatena ete bhinna gatayaḥ syuḥ tadā eteṣām bhukti liptā nayane yojanaiḥ yathāsvam prasiddha bhukti liptāḥ na āgaccheyuḥ
translated: If, on the other hand, they were to have different motions in terms of yojanas, then the well-known motions of these [planets] in terms of yojanas would not be obtained in the calculation of their traversed and remaining [parts].

original: tasmāt bhinnakakṣyāsthāḥ api grahāḥ yojanagatena tulyagatayaḥ eva iti // //
analyzed: tasmāt bhinnakakṣyā sthāḥ api grahāḥ yojanagatena tulya gatayaḥ eva iti  /
translated: Therefore, even though the planets occupy different orbits, they have equal motions in terms of yojanas.

analyzed: bhinna kakṣyāsu rāśi ādīnām alpa mahat tvam
translated: The smallness and greatness of signs etc. in different orbits

original: kakṣyāṇām alpamahattvāt rāśibhāgaliptāḥ bahvyaḥ alpāḥ iti sandehaḥ tannivṛttyartham āha
analyzed: kakṣyāṇām alpa mahā tvāt rāśi bhāga liptāḥ bahvyaḥ alpāḥ iti sandehaḥ tad nivṛtti artham āha
translated: Due to the smallness and greatness of the orbits, there is doubt that there are many small [signs] and few large [signs]. To remove that doubt, it is said:

original: alpe hi maṇḍale alpāḥ mahati mahāntaḥ ca rāśayaḥ jñeyāḥ /
analyzed: alpe hi maṇḍale alpāḥ mahati mahāntaḥ ca rāśayaḥ jñeyāḥ
translated: For in a small circle, the [lunar] mansions are small, and in a large circle, they are large.

original: aṃśāḥ kalāḥ tathā evam vibhāgatulyāḥ svakakṣyāsu // //
analyzed: aṃśāḥ kalāḥ tathā evam vibhāga tulyāḥ sva kakṣyāsu
translated: The parts and degrees are to be known in the same way, according to their divisions in their own orbits.

original: alpe maṇḍale alpāḥ rāśayaḥ mahati maṇḍale mahāntaḥ /
analyzed: alpe maṇḍale alpāḥ rāśayaḥ mahati maṇḍale mahāntaḥ
translated: In a small circle, the [lunar] mansions are small, in a large circle, they are large.

analyzed: evam aṃśāḥ kalāḥ ca
translated: In the same way, the parts and degrees.

analyzed: kevalam tu vibhāgena sadṛśāḥ
translated: Only they are equal in their divisions.

original: tat yathā alpe mahati ca maṇḍale maṇḍaladvādaśabhāgaḥ rāśiḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā alpe mahati ca maṇḍale maṇḍala dvādaśa bhāgaḥ rāśiḥ
translated: For example, in a small and large circle, a twelfth part of the circle is a [lunar] mansion.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭi śata traya bhāgaḥ bhāgaḥ  kha kha ṣaṣ ghana bhāgaḥ liptāḥ iti
translated: A three hundred and sixty part is a part.🔽A one thousand four hundred and forty part is a degree.

analyzed: svāsu svāsu kakṣyāsu jyotiścakrasya tulya tvāt
translated: This is because the orbits of the planets are equal in their own orbits.
The order of the planets' positions in their orbits.

analyzed: kakṣyāṇām upari adhas avasthiti krama parijñānāya āha
translated: In order to know the order of the planets' positions above and below the orbits, he says:

analyzed: bhānām adhas śanaiścara sura guru bhauma arka śukra budha candrāḥ
translated: Below the planets are Saturn, Rahu, Jupiter, Mars, the Sun, Venus, Mercury, and the Moon.

original: eṣām adhaḥ ca bhūmiḥ medhībhūtā khamadhyasthā // //
analyzed: eṣām adhas ca bhūmiḥ medhībhūtā khamadhyasthā  /
translated: Below them is the earth, which is the lowest, situated in the middle of space.

analyzed: bhāni jyotīṃṣi  aśvinī ādīni
translated: The planets are the luminous bodies.🔽They are the lunar mansions beginning with Āśvinī.

analyzed: teṣām adhas śanaiścaraḥ
translated: Below them is Saturn.

analyzed: tasya api adhas bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: Below him is Jupiter.

analyzed: tatas aṅgārakaḥ iti ādi
translated: Below him is Mars, and so on.

analyzed: eṣām adhas ca bhūmiḥ
translated: Below these is the earth.🔽The earth is below these constellations and so on.

analyzed: eṣām nakṣatra ādīnām bhūḥ adhas  medhībhūtā
translated: They are like a foundation.

original: atra bhūtaśabdaḥ bahuṣu artheṣu vartamānaḥ iva arthe pratipattavyaḥ /🔽medhī iva sthitā /
analyzed: atra bhūtaśabdaḥ bahuṣu artheṣu vartamānaḥ iva arthe pratipattavyaḥ  medhī iva sthitā
translated: Here the word bhūta should be understood in the sense of many.

analyzed: kha madhya sthā
translated: They are situated like a foundation.🔽They are situated in the middle of space.

original: kham ākāśam tasya madhyam khamadhyam /🔽tasmin sthitā khamadhyasthā /
analyzed: kham ākāśam tasya madhyam khamadhyam  tasmin sthitā kha madhya sthā
translated: The middle of space is the middle of the sky.🔽They are situated in that, they are situated in the middle of space.

original: eṣām adhaḥ ca bhūmiḥ iti /🔽atra ucyate yadā dṛśye
analyzed: eṣām adhas ca bhūmiḥ iti  atra ucyate yadā dṛśye
translated: Below these is the earth.🔽Here it is said: When the planets and stars are seen

analyzed: cakra ardhe graha nakṣatrāṇi
translated: in half a circle,

analyzed: tadā teṣām adhas bhūmiḥ
translated: then the earth is below them.

original: yadā ataḥ anyeṣu grahanakṣatrāṇi smararipusutahibukasahajadhaneṣu vartante tadā katham adhaḥ bhūḥ /
analyzed: yadā atas anyeṣu graha nakṣatrāṇi smara ripu suta hibuka sahaja dhaneṣu vartante tadā katham adhas bhūḥ
translated: When the planets and stars are elsewhere, in the houses of Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Saturn, the Ascendant, the 2nd house, the 7th house, then how is the earth below?

analyzed: yat uta upari syāt
translated: It would be above.

analyzed: na evam vijñāyate
translated: It is not understood in this way.

analyzed: yasmāt sarveṣām asmad ādīnām bhūḥ adhas
translated: Because for all of us, the earth is below.

analyzed: upari ca ākāśaḥ
translated: And above is space.

original: tasmāt sarvadā grahāḥ upari / bhūḥ adhaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt sarvadā grahāḥ upari bhūḥ adhas
translated: Therefore, the planets are always above, the earth below.

analyzed: vakṣyati ca
translated: And it will be said:

analyzed: yadvat kadamba puṣpa granthaḥ pracitaḥ samantataḥ kusumaiḥ
translated: Just as a bud of the kadamba flower is covered all around with flowers,

original: tadvat hi sarvasattvaiḥ jalajaiḥ sthalajaiḥ ca bhūgolaḥ // iti /
analyzed: tadvat hi sarvasattvaiḥ jala jaiḥ sthala jaiḥ ca bhūgolaḥ iti
translated: In the same way, the earth-globe is [surrounded] by all beings, both aquatic and terrestrial.

analyzed: gola
translated: [The earth] is a globe.

analyzed: anye tu imām kalpanām dūra vipratipannām
translated: Others, however, consider this conception to be a great error.

analyzed: bhagaṇa śanaiḥcara bṛhaspati kuja ravi sita budha niśākarān upari upari vyavasthitān tulya gatikān manyante
translated: They think that the sun, Saturn, Jupiter, Mars, Venus, Mercury, and the moon are arranged one above the other, moving at the same speed.

original: tat yathā yāvat alpamaṇḍalam bhāni bhramanti /
analyzed: tat yathā yāvat alpa maṇḍalam bhāni bhramanti
translated: That is, as long as the planets move in a small circle,

original: tāvat mahānti maṇḍalāni śanaiścarādayaḥ na śaknuvanti pūrayitum iti pṛṣṭhataḥ lakṣyante /
analyzed: tāvat mahānti maṇḍalāni śanaiścara ādayaḥ na śaknuvanti pūrayitum iti pṛṣṭhataḥ lakṣyante
translated: the large circles of Saturn and so on cannot fill it, so they appear behind.

analyzed: yathā kakṣyā maṇḍala krameṇa iti
translated: According to the order of the orbital circles.

original: atra parihāraḥ prāk pradarśitaḥ yadi upari syāt tadā candrasya grahanakṣatrabhede sphuṭakalaṅkahariṇe grahanakṣatratārāḥ🔽kṛśyeran pṛ iti ādinā granthena /
analyzed: atra parihāraḥ prāk pradarśitaḥ yadi upari syāt tadā candrasya graha nakṣatra bhede sphuṭa kalaṅka hariṇe graha nakṣatra tārāḥ  kṛśyeran pṛ iti ādinā granthena
translated: Here the answer has been shown before: If it were above, then the planets, stars, and the moon would be eclipsed by the clear spot on the moon. And so on, with that text.

analyzed: anye manyante tulya kakṣyā sthāḥ eva bhagaṇa śanaiścara bṛhaspati kuja ravi sita budha niśākarāḥ
translated: Others think that the sun, Saturn, Jupiter, Mars, Venus, Mercury, and the moon are indeed in the same orbit,

analyzed: kintu yathākrameṇa śīghra gatayaḥ
translated: but they move at different speeds according to their order.

original: ataḥ drutagatibhiḥ nakṣatraiḥ īṣamandagatiḥ īṣat jīyate /
analyzed: atas drutagatibhiḥ nakṣatraiḥ īṣamandagatiḥ īṣat jīyate
translated: Therefore, a planet with a faster motion is slightly defeated by a constellation with a slightly slower motion.

analyzed: ati manda gatiḥ tu dūrāt iti
translated: But one with a very slow motion is far away.

analyzed: īṣat manda gati tvāt śanaiścaraḥ iṣat jīyate
translated: Because of having a slightly slower motion, Saturn is slightly defeated.

analyzed: ati manda gati tvāt candramāḥ dūram iti
translated: And because of having a very slow motion, the Moon is far away.

original: atra api yadi prāṅmukhāḥ grahādayaḥ tadā prāṅmukhaiḥ drutagatibhiḥ nakṣatraiḥ jīyamānaḥ aśvinyām dṛṣṭaḥ revatyām upalakṣyeta /
analyzed: atra api yadi prāc mukhāḥ graha ādayaḥ tadā prāc mukhaiḥ drutagatibhiḥ nakṣatraiḥ jīyamānaḥ aśvinyām dṛṣṭaḥ revatyām upalakṣyeta
translated: Here too, if the planets etc. are facing east, then one seen in Ashvini, being defeated by constellations with a faster motion facing east, would be observed in Revati.

analyzed: na bharaṇyām vakra kāle
translated: Not in Bharani.

original: api ca / pratilomagatitvāt aśvinyām dṛṣṭaḥ bharaṇyām eva upalakṣyeta /
analyzed: api ca pratilomagati tvāt aśvinyām dṛṣṭaḥ bharaṇyām eva upalakṣyeta
translated: Even at the time of retrograde motion, because of moving in the opposite direction, one seen in Ashvini would be observed in Bharani itself.

analyzed: atha ete graha ādayaḥ apara abhimukhāḥ kalpyante
translated: Now, if these planets etc. are imagined to be facing west,

original: tathā api vakrakāle aśvinyām dṛṣṭaḥ pratilomagatitvāt bharaṇyām upalakṣyeta /🔽tulyakakṣyāvyavasthitānām ca lambanaviśeṣaḥ na syāt /
analyzed: tathā api vakrakāle aśvinyām dṛṣṭaḥ pratilomagati tvāt bharaṇyām upalakṣyeta  tulya kakṣyā vyavasthitānām ca lambana viśeṣaḥ na syāt
translated: then too, because of moving in the opposite direction, one seen in Ashvini at the time of retrograde motion would be observed in Bharani.🔽And there would be no difference in the declinations of those situated in the same orbit.

analyzed: anyat ca anyonya bimba chādanam na syāt
translated: And there would be no mutual eclipse of the orbs.

original: grahoparāgaḥ api ca tulyakakṣyāvyavasthitatvāt na yujyate /
analyzed: graha uparāgaḥ api ca tulya kakṣyā vyavasthita tvāt na yujyate
translated: And an eclipse of a planet is not possible because of being situated in the same orbit.

original: tasmāt bhānām adhaḥ śanaiścaraḥ iti ādi suṣṭhu uktam // //
analyzed: tasmāt bhānām adhas śanaiścaraḥ iti ādi suṣṭhu uktam  /
translated: Therefore, it is well said that Saturn is below the luminaries, and so on.

analyzed: kāla horā ādinā adhipati jñānam
translated: Knowledge of the rulers by the hour of the day, etc.

analyzed: āha
translated: To show the rulers by the hour of the day, etc., he says:

original: sapta ete horeśāḥ śanaiścarādyāḥ yathākramam śīghrāḥ /
analyzed: sapta ete horeśāḥ śanaiścara ādyāḥ yathākramam śīghrāḥ
translated: These seven are the rulers of the hours, beginning with Saturn, in order, they are swift.

analyzed: śīghrakramāt caturthāḥ bhavanti sūrya udayāt dinapāḥ
translated: And from the swift order, they become the day rulers four hours after sunrise.

original: ete grahāḥ śanaiścarādayaḥ tulyagatayaḥ api santaḥ yathākrameṇa śīghrāḥ lakṣyante /
analyzed: ete grahāḥ śanaiścara ādayaḥ tulya gatayaḥ api santaḥ yathākrameṇa śīghrāḥ lakṣyante
translated: These planets, beginning with Saturn, although having equal motions, are seen to be swift in order.

analyzed: maṇḍalānām yathākrameṇa alpatvāt
translated: Because the circles are small in order.

analyzed: te eva horeśāḥ yathākrameṇa
translated: Those very same are the rulers of the hours, in order.

original: tat yathā śanaiścarasya kālahorāyām nivṛttāyām bṛhaspateḥ kālahorā /
analyzed: tat yathā śanaiścarasya kālahorāyām nivṛttāyām bṛhaspateḥ kālahorā
translated: For example, when Saturn's hour has passed, Jupiter's hour is [next].

analyzed: tatas aṅgārakasya  tatas raveḥ iti ādi
translated: Then Mars',🔽then the sun's, and so on.

original: evam sūryodayāt prabhṛti yāvat sūryasya ardhāstamayaḥ iti dvādaśa kālahorāḥ /
analyzed: evam sūrya udayāt prabhṛti yāvat sūryasya ardhāstamayaḥ iti dvādaśa kālahorāḥ
translated: Thus, from sunrise up to half-sunset, there are twelve hours.

original: tataḥ ca ardhāstamayāt ardhodayaḥ iti punar dvādaśa /
analyzed: tatas ca ardhāstamayāt ardhodayaḥ iti punar dvādaśa
translated: And then, from half-sunset to half-sunrise, there are another twelve.

original: evam ahorātre caturviṃśatikālahorāḥ /🔽kālahorā hi nāma lagnarāśeḥ
analyzed: evam ahar rātre caturviṃśati kāla horāḥ  kālahorāḥ hi nāma lagna rāśeḥ
translated: Thus, in a day and night, there are twenty-four hours.

analyzed: ardha udayasya kālaḥ
translated: For an hour is the time of half-sunrise of the ascendant sign.

original: sā ca divase divase divasādhipātaḥ prabhṛti pratipattavyā /
analyzed: sā ca divase divase divasa adhipātaḥ prabhṛti pratipattavyā
translated: And that [period] should be calculated from the day-lord onwards, day by day.

analyzed: uktam ca sphujidhvajayavaneśvareṇa
translated: And it has been said by Sphujiddhvajaya

analyzed: āditya śukra indu ja candra saura jīva avaneyāḥ syuḥ ahar niśāsu
translated: [The planets] Sun, Venus, Moon, Mercury, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn are [the day-lords] in the day and night.

original: horeśvarāḥ taddivasādhipādikrameṇa tāḥ tatra caturguṇāḥ ṣaṭ //
analyzed: horā īśvarāḥ tad divasa adhipa ādi krameṇa tāḥ tatra caturguṇāḥ ṣaṭ
translated: The lords of the horoscopy are those [planets], in the order of the day-lord, etc., multiplied by four in that [calculation].

original: evam divasādhipāt sūryodayāt gaṇyamānāt uttaradivasasya adhipāt eva ardhodayāt śīghrakramāt caturthaḥ /
analyzed: evam divasādhipāt sūrya udayāt gaṇyamānāt uttara divasasya adhipāt eva ardhodayāt śīghrakramāt caturthaḥ
translated: Thus, the fourth [planet] is counted from the day-lord, from sunrise, from the rising of the next day-lord, from half-rise, and in the order of swift motion.

original: yaḥ śīghrakramaḥ abhihitaḥ bhānām adhaḥ śanaiścaraḥ iti ādi tasmāt caturthaḥ divasādhipatiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ śīghrakramaḥ abhihitaḥ bhānām adhas śanaiścaraḥ iti ādi tasmāt caturthaḥ divasādhipatiḥ
translated: The fourth [planet] is the day-lord, who is said to be below the swift-moving planets, Saturn and so on.

original: tat yathā śanaiścarāt caturthaḥ sūryaḥ divasādhipatiḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā śanaiścarāt caturthaḥ sūryaḥ divasādhipatiḥ
translated: For example, the fourth from Saturn is the Sun, the day-lord.

original: sūryāt somaḥ caturthaḥ /🔽somāt aṅgārakaḥ iti ādi /
analyzed: sūryāt somaḥ caturthaḥ  somāt aṅgārakaḥ iti ādi
translated: The fourth from the Sun is the Moon.🔽The fourth from the Moon is Mars, and so on.

original: evam anena krameṇa māsādhipāḥ abdādhipāḥ ca avagantavyāḥ /
analyzed: evam anena krameṇa māsa adhipāḥ abda adhipāḥ ca avagantavyāḥ
translated: In this way, the month-lords and year-lords should be understood.

original: katham / māsasya varṣasya ca yaḥ prathamadivase adhipaḥ sa māsādhipaḥ varṣādhipaḥ ca
analyzed: katham māsasya varṣasya ca yaḥ prathamadivase adhipaḥ sa māsādhipaḥ varṣādhipaḥ ca
translated: How? The one who is the lord of the first day of the month or year is the month-lord and year-lord.
The day-lords are from sunrise.

analyzed: sūryasya udayaḥ sūrya udayaḥ
translated: The rising of the sun is sunrise.

original: yadi api śeṣeṇa uktaḥ sūryodayaśeṣeṇa ardhodayaḥ pratipattavyaḥ /
analyzed: yadi api śeṣeṇa uktaḥ sūrya udaya śeṣeṇa ardha udayaḥ pratipattavyaḥ
translated: Even though it is stated by the remainder, the half-rise should be understood by the remainder of sunrise.

original: kutaḥ / idam bimbāvayavābhidhāne api tadavayavapramāṇasya mānakālāvadhāraṇāśakyatvāt ardhodayasya ca vyaktalakṣaṇatvāt suparicchedanayā ardhodayaḥ
analyzed: kutas idam bimba avayava abhidhāne api tad avayava pramāṇasya māna kāla avadhāraṇa aśakya tvāt ardha udayasya ca vyakta lakṣaṇa tvāt su paricchedanayā ardha udayaḥ  /
translated: Why? Because even when mentioning the parts of the orb, it is impossible to determine the measure and time of those parts, and because the half-rise has a clear definition, the half-rise is accepted

analyzed: āśriyate
translated: by the method of very precise determination.

original: athavā anirdiṣṭeṣu vastuṣu madhyamapratipatteḥ ardhodayāt ārabhya punar ardhodayaḥ iti /
analyzed: athavā anirdiṣṭeṣu vastubhiḥ madhyama pratipatteḥ ardha udayāt ārabhya punar ardha udayaḥ iti
translated: Or else, because of the understanding of the middle in unspecified things, the half-rise is taken as the beginning again of the half-rise.

analyzed: atra kecid ardha astamayāt vāra pravṛttim manyante
translated: Here some think that the occurrence of the day begins from half-sunset.

analyzed: tat ca ayuktam
translated: And that is not correct.

analyzed: yasmāt uktam
translated: Because it is said:

analyzed: āsīt idam tamobhūtam aprajñātam alakṣaṇam
translated: This was enveloped in darkness, unknown, without characteristics,

analyzed: apratarkyam avijñeyam prasuptam iva sarvatas
translated: inconceivable, unknowable, as if asleep everywhere.

analyzed: manusmṛtiḥ
translated: The Smṛti of Manu.

analyzed: atra janapada jyotiḥ cakra abhāvāt na vāra ādi vyavahāraḥ sañjātaḥ
translated: Here, because there are no countries or celestial globes, the practice of days and so on has not arisen.

original: yadā protpannaḥ sahasrakiraṇaḥ tadā prabhṛti vārādivyavahāraḥ sañjātaḥ iti /
analyzed: yadā protpannaḥ sahasrakiraṇaḥ tadā prabhṛti vāra ādi vyavahāraḥ sañjātaḥ iti
translated: When the thousand-rayed one arose, then the practice of days and so on has arisen.

original: ataḥ suṣṭhu uktam sūryodayāt dinapāḥ iti // //
analyzed: atas suṣṭhu uktam sūrya udayāt dinapāḥ iti  /
translated: Therefore it is well said that the days are from sunrise.
The determination of the motion of the planets by the method of the counter-circles

original: ete grahāḥ kasmin maṇḍale bhramanti iti na jñāyate ataḥ tannirūpaṇāya āha
analyzed: ete grahāḥ kasmin maṇḍale bhramanti iti na jñāyate atas tad nirūpaṇāya āha
translated: It is not known in which circle these planets revolve, therefore, to determine that, it is said

analyzed: kakṣyā pratimaṇḍala gāḥ bhramanti sarve grahāḥ sva cāreṇa
translated: All the planets revolve in their own motion along the counter-circles of the ecliptic.

original: mandoccāt anulomam pratilomam ca eva śīghhroccāt // //
analyzed: manda uccāt anulomam pratilomam ca eva śīghra uccāt  /
translated: In the forward direction from the mean distance, and in the reverse direction from the true distance.

analyzed: kakṣyāyāḥ pratimaṇḍalam kakṣyā pratimaṇḍalam
translated: The counter-circle of the ecliptic is the counter-circle of the ecliptic.

analyzed: tat gacchanti iti kakṣyā pratimaṇḍala gāḥ
translated: They go along that, therefore they go along the counter-circles of the ecliptic.

original: athavā kakṣyā ca pratimaṇḍalam ca kakṣyāpratimaṇḍale /
analyzed: athavā kakṣyā ca pratimaṇḍalam ca kakṣyā pratimaṇḍale
translated: Or else, the ecliptic and the counter-circle are the counter-circles of the ecliptic.

analyzed: te gacchanti iti kakṣyā pratimaṇḍala gāḥ
translated: They go along that, therefore they go along the counter-circles of the ecliptic.

analyzed: atra kakṣyāgāḥ madhyamāḥ grahāḥ
translated: Here, the middle planets go along the ecliptic.

analyzed: sphuṭāḥ pratimaṇḍala gāḥ
translated: The true ones go along the counter-circles.

original: athavā kakṣyāpratimaṇḍalayoḥ yatra sampātaḥ sa kakṣyāpratimaṇḍalaśabdena ucyate /
analyzed: athavā kakṣyā pratimaṇḍalayoḥ yatra sampātaḥ sa kakṣyā pratimaṇḍala śabdena ucyate
translated: Or else, where there is a conjunction of the ecliptic and the counter-circle, that is called the counter-circle of the ecliptic.

analyzed: tam gacchanti iti kakṣyā pratimaṇḍala gāḥ
translated: They go along that, therefore they go along the counter-circles of the ecliptic.

analyzed: atra aneka tvāt vigraha yogasya
translated: Here, because there are many ways of compounding words,

analyzed: katamaḥ vigrahaḥ parigṛhyate iti sandehe
translated: Which of the two [types of] configurations is accepted?

original: ucyate kakṣyā ca pratimaṇḍalam ca kakṣyāpratimaṇḍale /
analyzed: ucyate kakṣyā ca pratimaṇḍalam ca kakṣyā pratimaṇḍale
translated: It is said: The belt [orbits] and the counter-circle [orbits]. The belt and counter-circle [orbits] are the belt and counter-circle [orbits].

analyzed: te gacchanti iti kakṣyā pratimaṇḍala gāḥ
translated: They go, therefore they are in the belt and counter-circle [orbits].

analyzed: iti ayam parigṛhyate
translated: This is what is accepted.

original: katham / iṣṭatvāt śeṣavigrahārthavācakatvāt ca atra iṣyate /
analyzed: katham iṣṭa tvāt śeṣa vigraha artha vācaka tvāt ca atra iṣyate
translated: How? Because it is desired, and because it expresses the meaning of the remaining configuration, it is desired here.

analyzed: kakṣyā gāḥ madhyamāḥ grahāḥ yasmāt tulya bhuktayaḥ
translated: The middle planets are in the belt [orbits], because they have equal motions.

analyzed: prati maṇḍala gāḥ sphuṭa grahāḥ yatas sa sadṛśa bhuktayaḥ
translated: The clear planets are in the counter-circle [orbits], because they have similar motions.

analyzed: atha ke te madhyamāḥ
translated: Now, what are those middle [planets]?

analyzed: ke vā sphuṭāḥ grahāḥ
translated: Or what are the clear planets?

original: nanu ca ekaḥ eva sūryaḥ /🔽ekaḥ eva candramāḥ /
analyzed: nanu ca ekaḥ eva sūryaḥ  ekaḥ eva candramāḥ
translated: Isn't there only one sun?🔽And only one moon?

analyzed: ekaḥ eva aṅgārakaḥ iti ādi
translated: And only one Mars, and so on?

analyzed: madhyama sphuṭa tāyām parigṛhyamāṇāyām graha dvayam prāpnoti
translated: If the middle and clear [planets] are accepted, then there would be two planets.

original: na evam vijñāyate madhyamaḥ grahaḥ sphuṭaḥ grahaḥ iti /
analyzed: na evam vijñāyate madhyamaḥ grahaḥ sphuṭaḥ grahaḥ iti
translated: It is not understood in this way that the middle planet is the clear planet.

analyzed: katham tarhi  madhyamagraha śabdena madhyamagrahasya graha gatiḥ abhidhīyate
translated: Then how is it?🔽By the word middle planet, the motion of the middle planet is expressed.

analyzed: sphuṭa graha śabdena ca sphuṭa graha gatiḥ iti
translated: And by the word clear planet, the motion of the clear planet is expressed.

original: tat yathā kaścit sāṃvatsaram pṛcchati kaḥ savitā iti /
analyzed: tat yathā kaścid sāṃvatsaram pṛcchati kaḥ savitā iti
translated: For example, someone asks about the sun: Who is the sun?

analyzed: sa tasmai āha rāśiḥ
translated: He says to him: A mass,

original: ekaḥ pañcadaśa bhāgāḥ triṃśat liptāḥ iti /
analyzed: ekaḥ pañcadaśa bhāgāḥ triṃśat liptāḥ iti
translated: one part, fifteen parts, thirty lipta.

original: tatra yaḥ paripṛcchati yaḥ ca ācaṣṭe tayoḥ ubhayoḥ abhiprāyadvayaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: tatra yaḥ paripṛcchati yaḥ ca ācaṣṭe tayoḥ ubhayoḥ abhiprāya dvaya prasaṅgaḥ
translated: There, for both the one who asks and the one who explains, two intentions are implied.

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: yā madhyamā gatiḥ sā sphuṭagatisādhanasya upāyaḥ /
analyzed: yā madhyamā gatiḥ sā sphuṭa gati sādhanasya upāyaḥ
translated: The middle motion is the means for accomplishing the clear motion.

original: anyathā aniyatatvāt sphuṭagatiḥ aśakyā syāt vijñātum /
analyzed: anyathā aniyata tvāt sphuṭa gatiḥ aśakyā syāt vijñātum
translated: Otherwise, because of the uncertainty, the clear motion would be impossible to know.

original: evam eva ca madhyamagrahaḥ pratimaṇḍalaparijñānārtham parikalpitaḥ /
analyzed: evam eva ca madhyama grahaḥ prati maṇḍala parijñāna artham parikalpitaḥ
translated: And just like this, the middle planet is imagined for the purpose of knowing the counter-circle.

original: yat asya grahasya vyāsārdhatulyam bhūtārāgrahavivaram sa tasmāt pradeśāt prabhṛti kakṣyāmaṇḍalasya upari adhaḥ vā avatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: yat asya grahasya vyāsa ardha tulyam bhū tārā graha vivaram sa tasmāt pradeśāt prabhṛti kakṣyā maṇḍalasya upari adhas vā avatiṣṭhate
translated: The distance between the true planet and the planet, equal to the semi-diameter of that planet, is from that point onwards that the planet remains above or below the circular path.

analyzed: atha kaḥ asau ayam pradeśaḥ
translated: Now, what is this point?

original: ucyate yadā tṛtīye karmaṇi dvitīye pade mandoccakendram rāśitrayam dvau bhāgau pañcāśat liptāḥ /
analyzed: ucyate yadā tṛtīye karmaṇi dvitīye pade mandoccakendram rāśi trayam dvau bhāgau pañcāśat liptāḥ
translated: It is said: When in the third action, in the second step, the center of the slow ascending node is three signs, two parts, fifty lipta,

analyzed: tadā bṛhaspateḥ manda ucca karṇaḥ vyāsa ardha tulyaḥ
translated: then Jupiter's slow ascending node is equal to the semi-diameter.

original: caturthe karmaṇi yadā śīghroccakendram rāśitrayam pañcabhāgāḥ viṃśatiḥ ca kalā /
analyzed: caturthe karmaṇi yadā śīghra ucca kendram rāśi trayam pañca bhāgāḥ viṃśatiḥ ca kalā
translated: In the fourth operation, when the sum of the degrees of the mean longitude of the sun and the degrees of the sum of the degrees of the mean longitudes of the five planets is 180, then the sum of the degrees of the mean longitude of the sun and the degrees of the sum of the mean longitudes of the five planets is 180.

analyzed: tadā vyāsa ardha tulyaḥ śīghra ucca karṇaḥ  atra vyāsa ardha tulyam bhū tārā graha vivaram
translated: Then the radius of the circle of the sun's mean motion is equal to the radius of the circle of the earth's motion.🔽Here, the distance between the earth and the sun is equal to the radius of the circle of the earth's motion.

original: asmāt pradeśāt prabhṛti bhūtārāgrahavivaram pratidinam apacīyate /
analyzed: asmāt pradeśāt prabhṛti bhū tārā graha vivaram pratidinam apacīyate
translated: From this point on, the distance between the earth and the sun decreases day by day.

analyzed: anayā yuktyā śeṣāṇām api grahāṇām
translated: By this method, the distance between the earth and the sun for the remaining planets

analyzed: vyāsa ardha tulyam bhū tārā graha vivaram ūhyam
translated: can be inferred to be equal to the radius of the circle of the earth's motion.

original: bhramanti sarve grahāḥ svacāreṇa iti etat nigadavyākhyānam eva /
analyzed: bhramanti sarve grahāḥ sva cāreṇa iti etat nigada vyākhyānam eva
translated: All the planets move in their own courses - this is explained by the words themselves.

analyzed: manda uccāt anulomam
translated: [The planets] move in the direct [motion] from the slow [motion] nodes.

analyzed: manda uccāt iti hetau pañcamī
translated: The fifth case is used for the reason.

original: tena mandoccāt hetoḥ anulomam iti vyākhyāyate /
analyzed: tena manda uccāt hetoḥ anulomam iti vyākhyāyate
translated: Therefore, it is explained that [the planets] move in the direct [motion] from the slow [motion] nodes.

analyzed: yasmāt na manda ucce vakra parijñānam
translated: Because the retrograde motion is not known at the slow [motion] nodes.

original: pratilomam ca eva śīghroccāt /🔽śīghroccāt hetoḥ pratilomam /
analyzed: pratilomam ca eva śīghra uccāt  śīghra uccāt hetoḥ pratilomam
translated: And [the planets] move in the retrograde [motion] from the fast [motion] nodes.🔽From the fast [motion] nodes, [the planets] move in the retrograde [motion].

analyzed: yasmāt śīghra ucce vakra parijñānam
translated: Because the retrograde motion is known at the fast [motion] nodes.

analyzed: katham punar śīghra ucce vakra parijñānam
translated: How is the retrograde motion known at the fast [motion] nodes?

original: ucyate yadā śīghroccakendram dvitīyapade tadā sarve grahāḥ vakriṇaḥ bhavanti /
analyzed: ucyate yadā śīghra uccaka indram dvitīya pade tadā sarve grahāḥ vakriṇaḥ bhavanti
translated: It is said: When the center of the swift orbit is in the second place, then all the planets have retrograde motion.

analyzed: yadā ca tṛtīya pade śīghra uccaka indram
translated: And when the center of the swift orbit is in the third place,

original: tadā anuvakragatayaḥ / uktam ca 🔽grahonaśīghragraheṣu kṛtaṣaḍvasuṣu kramāt /
analyzed: tadā anuvakragatayaḥ uktam ca  graha ūna śīghra graheṣu kṛta ṣaṣ vasuṣu kramāt
translated: then they have direct motion. And it is said:

original: bhavet vakrātivakrā ca tathā anukuṭilā gatiḥ //
analyzed: bhavet vakrā ativakrā ca tathā anukuṭilā gatiḥ
translated: The planet, in the six swift planets, has a retrograde, very retrograde, and likewise a crooked motion, in order.

original: iti / sūkṣmataraḥ ca ayam vidhiḥ iti /🔽ucyate yadā adyatanāt grahāt śvastanaḥ grahaḥ tulyaḥ bhavati tadā vakraprārambhaḥ /
analyzed: iti sūkṣmataraḥ ca ayam vidhiḥ iti  ucyate yadā adyatanāt grahāt śvastanaḥ grahaḥ tulyaḥ bhavati tadā vakraprārambhaḥ
translated: Thus. And this method is more subtle.🔽It is said: When the planet of tomorrow is equal to the planet of today, then the retrograde motion begins.

original: athavā hyastanāt grahāt adyatanaḥ grahaḥ tulyaḥ tadā api vakraprārambhaḥ /
analyzed: athavā hyastanāt grahāt adyatanaḥ grahaḥ tulyaḥ tadā api vakraprārambhaḥ
translated: Or, if the planet of today is equal to the planet of yesterday, then also the retrograde motion begins.

original: yadā adyatanāt tṛtīyapade śvastanaḥ grahaḥ adhikaḥ tadā vakrasya nivṛttiḥ /
analyzed: yadā adyatanāt tṛtīyapade śvastanaḥ grahaḥ adhikaḥ tadā vakrasya nivṛttiḥ
translated: When the planet of tomorrow is greater than the planet of today in the third place, then the retrograde motion ceases.

original: athavā hyastanāt grahāt adyatanaḥ grahaḥ adhikaḥ tṛtīyapade tadā api vakrasya nivṛttiḥ /
analyzed: athavā hyastanāt grahāt adyatanaḥ grahaḥ adhikaḥ tṛtīyapade tadā api vakrasya nivṛttiḥ
translated: Or, if the planet of today is greater than the planet of yesterday in the third place, then also the retrograde motion ceases.

original: yadā grahaḥ bahvīḥ liptāḥ nivartate tadā ativakragatiḥ /
analyzed: yadā grahaḥ bahvīḥ liptāḥ nivartate tadā ativakragatiḥ
translated: When the planet turns back after many degrees, then it has a very retrograde motion.

original: katham punar idam vidhānam śīghroccāt eva gaṇakaḥ prajānate /
analyzed: katham punar idam vidhānam śīghroccāt eva gaṇakaḥ prajānate
translated: How then does the mathematician know this method only from the quick orbit,

analyzed: na punar manda uccāt iti
translated: but not from the slow orbit?

original: ucyate yasmāt sūryavaśāt grahāṇām udayāstamayavakrānuvakrāḥ gatayaḥ /
analyzed: ucyate yasmāt sūrya vaśāt grahāṇām udaya astamaya vakra anuvakrāḥ gatayaḥ
translated: It is said because the movements of the planets, their rising, setting, retrogradation and direct motion, are due to the sun.

original: yadi evam atra katham budhaśukrayoḥ anyat śīghroccam /
analyzed: yadi evam atra katham budha śukrayoḥ anyat śīghra uccam
translated: If that is so, then why do Mercury and Venus have a different quick orbit here?

analyzed: madhyaḥ sūryaḥ
translated: The sun is in the middle.

original: atra api sūryavaśāt eva tayoḥ udayāstamayaparijñānam /
analyzed: atra api sūrya vaśāt eva tayoḥ udaya astamaya parijñānam
translated: Here too, their rising and setting are known only due to the sun.

analyzed: vakragatiḥ tu eka tvāt upāya antareṇa vijñāyate
translated: But their retrograde motion is known by another means because of their unity.

original: athavā uccanīcamadhyamaparidhiḥ iti evamādisphuṭagatisādhanopāyabhūtānām ca upāyānām na eva niyamoktiḥ
analyzed: athavā ucca nīca madhyama paridhiḥ iti evamādi sphuṭa gati sādhana upāya bhūtānām ca upāyānām na eva niyama uktiḥ
translated: Or, there is no rule stated for the means that are the basis for calculating the true motion, such as the high, low and middle orbits, and so on.

original: vā vidyate / kevalam tu upeyasādhakāḥ upāyāḥ /
analyzed: vā vidyate kevalam tu upeya sādhakāḥ upāyāḥ
translated: But the means are only the means for accomplishing the goal.

analyzed: tasmāt iyam sarvā prakriyā asatyā
translated: Therefore, all this procedure is false,

analyzed: yayā grahāṇām sphuṭa gatiḥ sādhyate
translated: by which the true motion of the planets is accomplished.

original: evam ca paramārthajijñāsubhiḥ asatyopāyena satyam pratipadyate /
analyzed: evam ca parama artha jijñāsubhiḥ asatya upāyena satyam pratipadyate
translated: And thus, those who seek the ultimate truth attain the truth by a false means.

original: tathā hi bhiṣajaḥ hi utpalanālādiṣu vadhādīni abhyasyante /
analyzed: tathā hi bhiṣajaḥ hi utpala nāla ādiṣu vadha ādīni abhyasyante
translated: For example, doctors practice killing and so on on lotus stalks and such.

analyzed: nāpitāḥ piṭhara ādiṣu muṇḍana ādīni
translated: Barbers in pots etc. shave etc.

analyzed: yajña śāstra vidaḥ śuṣkeṣṭyāḥ yajña ādīni
translated: Those who know the sacrificial scriptures in dry sacrificial formulas know sacrifices etc.

analyzed: śābdikāḥ prakṛti pratyaya vikāra āgama varṇa lopa vyatyaya ādibhiḥ śabdān pratijānate
translated: Linguists know words by the modification of roots and affixes, by the addition of prefixes, by the elision of letters, by the transposition of letters, etc.

analyzed: evam atra api
translated: In the same way, here also

analyzed: madhyama manda ucca śīghra ucca tad paridhi jyā kāṣṭha bhujā koṭi karṇa ādi vyavahāreṇa sāṃvatsarāḥ grahāṇām sphuṭa gatim pratijānate
translated: astronomers know the true motion of the planets by the convention of the middle, slow, high, high speed, the sine of the circumference, the chord, the radius, the hypotenuse, etc.

original: tasmāt upāyeṣu asatyeṣu satyapratipādanapareṣu na codyam asti /
analyzed: tasmāt upāyeṣu asatyeṣu satya pratipādana pareṣu na codyam asti
translated: Therefore, when the means are false, but are devoted to conveying the truth, there is no objection.

original: atha kim artham ime grahāḥ pratidinam bhrāmyanti /
analyzed: atha kim artham ime grahāḥ pratidinam bhrāmyanti
translated: Now, why do these planets revolve every day?

original: atha ca loke kaścit bhraman kāraṇena bhramati /
analyzed: atha ca loke kaścid bhraman kāraṇena bhramati
translated: And yet, in the world, someone who is revolving revolves with a cause.

original: anyat ca na evaṃvidhaḥ kaścit dṛśyate anavaratagatiḥ yathā ime tārāgrahāḥ bhramanti iti dṛṣṭāntatvena udāharaṇabhūtaḥ iti /
analyzed: anyat ca na evaṃvidhaḥ kaścid dṛśyate anavaratagatiḥ yathā ime tārāgrahāḥ bhramanti iti dṛṣṭānta tvena udāharaṇa bhūtaḥ iti
translated: And another is not seen to be of such a kind, with uninterrupted motion, as these stars and planets revolve. Thus, he is an example as an illustration.

original: ucyate sarvādau kila bhagavān prajāpatiḥ grahān uktavān yat bhavantaḥ meṣādigaṇeṣu prajānām śubhāśubhaphalāya bhrāmyata iti /
analyzed: ucyate sarva ādau kila bhagavān prajāpatiḥ grahān uktavān yat bhavantaḥ meṣa ādi gaṇeṣu prajānām śubha aśubha phalāya bhrāmyata iti
translated: It is said that in the beginning, the Blessed Lord Prajapati told the planets, You should revolve among the groups beginning with Aries for the good and bad results of the people.

original: uktam ca sphujidhvajayavaneśvareṇa 🔽prajāḥ sisṛkṣuḥ kila viśvadhātā
analyzed: uktam ca sphujidhvajayavaneśvareṇa  prajāḥ sisṛkṣuḥ kila viśva dhātā
translated: And it has been said by Sphujiddhvajaya-vanesvara:🔽It is said that the creator of the universe, desiring to create beings,

analyzed: prajāpatiḥ prāc vratam ācacāra
translated: performed a vow in the beginning as Prajapati.

analyzed: sa dvādaśa aṅga prabhavam sva deham
translated: Having created his own body consisting of twelve parts,

analyzed: sṛṣṭvā āditaḥ vai bhagaṇam sasarja
translated: he first created the Bhagana.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ sa meṣa ādi gaṇān prajajñe
translated: From them he produced the groups beginning with Aries,

analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca tad bheda vikalpataḥ anyān
translated: and from them, by the division of those, others.

analyzed: atas bhavargasya vibhuḥ praṇetā
translated: Therefore, the lord, the author of the Bhavarga,
has the lordship over the creation and destruction of beings. Thus it begins.

analyzed: athavā śabdena artha anumānam kriyate
translated: Or, by the word or an inference of meaning is made.

original: śrūyante ca śabdāḥ ye ca apare atra gativācakāḥ /
analyzed: śrūyante ca śabdāḥ ye ca apare atra gati vācakāḥ
translated: And the words that are other denotative of motion are heard here.

original: tat yathā pathaḥ ṣkan aṣṭādhyāyī /🔽iti vartamāne panthaḥ ṇa nityam aṣṭādhyāyī /
analyzed: tat yathā pathaḥ ṣkan aṣṭādhyāyī  iti vartamāne panthaḥ ṇa nityam aṣṭādhyāyī
translated: For example, path is the aphorism of the Ashta.🔽In the present path is always the aphorism of the Ashta.

original: iti anena nityam panthānam gacchati iti asmin arthe pānthaḥ iti ayam śabdaḥ /
analyzed: iti anena nityam panthānam gacchati iti asmin arthe pānthaḥ iti ayam śabdaḥ
translated: By this, the word pantha is always used in the sense of he goes on the path.

original: atra loke na kaścit adhvānam anavaratam gacchan dṛśyate /
analyzed: atra loke na kaścid adhvānam anavaratam gacchan dṛśyate
translated: In this world, no one is seen to constantly travel on a road.

analyzed: tasmāt amī eva grahāḥ pānthāḥ
translated: Therefore, these planets themselves are the travelers.

original: na ca ayam śabdaḥ asatsvārtheṣu śaśaviṣāṇakūrmaromavandhyāputraśabdavat pravṛttaḥ / tasmāt
analyzed: na ca ayam śabdaḥ asat svārtheṣu śaśaviṣāṇa kūrma roma vandhyā putra śabda vat pravṛttaḥ tasmāt
translated: And this word is not used for non-existent objects like the words 'hare's horn', 'tortoise's hair', 'barren woman's son'. Therefore,

original: suṣṭhu ucyate śabdena arthānumānam pānthāḥ grahāḥ iti /
analyzed: suṣṭhu ucyate śabdena artha anumānam pānthāḥ grahāḥ iti
translated: it is well said that the meaning is inferred from the word, like the planets for travelers.

original: athavā ayam aparaḥ prakāraḥ /🔽mandoccāt anulomam pratilomam ca eva śīghroccāt /
analyzed: athavā ayam aparaḥ prakāraḥ  manda uccāt anulomam pratilomam ca eva śīghra uccāt
translated: Or, this is another method:🔽[The motion is] direct from the slow-moving apogee and retrograde from the fast-moving apogee.

original: mandoccāt yataḥ mandoccakendrāt pratimaṇḍalavidhānena ānītam phalam pratyaham upacīyate /
translated: From the slow-moving apogee, the result brought by the method of the counter-circle decreases day by day.

original: kva / anyasya aśrutatvāt mandocce eva /🔽tasmāt mandoccāt anulomam /
analyzed: kva anyasya aśruta tvāt manda ucce eva  tasmāt manda uccāt anulomam
translated: Where? In the slow-moving apogee itself, because another [apogee] is not heard of.🔽Therefore, [the motion is] direct from the slow-moving apogee.

analyzed: pratilomam ca eva śīghra uccāt
translated: And retrograde from the fast-moving apogee.

original: yasmāt pratimaṇḍalavidhānena ānītam phalam sarvadā apacīyate /
analyzed: yasmāt prati maṇḍala vidhānena ānītam phalam sarvadā apacīyate
translated: Because the result brought by the method of the counter-circle always decreases.

analyzed: kutas anyasya a śṛuta tvāt śīghra uccāt eva
translated: From where? From the fast-moving apogee itself, because another [apogee] is not heard of.

original: tasmāt pratilomam ca eva śīghroccāt iti // //
analyzed: tasmāt pratilomam ca eva śīghra uccāt iti  /
translated: Therefore, [the motion is] retrograde from the fast-moving apogee.

analyzed: prati maṇḍala vidhānam
translated: The Method of the Counter-Circle

analyzed: sphuṭāḥ pratimaṇḍale bhramanti iti uktam
translated: It has been said that the bright [planets] move in counter-circles.

analyzed: atas tad jñāpanāya āha
translated: Therefore, to make that known, he says:

original: kakṣyāmaṇḍalatulyam svam svam pratimaṇḍalam bhavati eṣām /
analyzed: kakṣyā maṇḍala tulyam svam svam pratimaṇḍalam bhavati eṣām
translated: Each one has its own counter-circle equal to the ecliptic.

analyzed: prati maṇḍalasya madhyam ghana bhū madhyāt atikrāntam  /
translated: The center of the respective circle is beyond the center of the dense earth.

analyzed: kakṣyā maṇḍala tulyam
translated: Equal to the ecliptic circle.

analyzed: kakṣyā maṇḍalena tulyam kakṣyā maṇḍala tulyam
translated: Equal to the ecliptic circle is equal to the ecliptic circle.

analyzed: kakṣyā maṇḍala pramāṇam cakram gītikā
translated: The moon's zodiacal circle is of the same size as the ecliptic circle. This is the song.

analyzed: iti etasmin sūtre vyākhyātam
translated: This has been explained in this sutra.

original: svam svam pratimaṇḍalam ātmīyam ātmīyam pratimaṇḍalam / bhavati /
analyzed: svam svam pratimaṇḍalam ātmīyam ātmīyam pratimaṇḍalam bhavati
translated: Each of these planets has its own respective circle.

analyzed: eṣām grahāṇām  pratimaṇḍalasya madhyam
translated: Of these planets.🔽The center of the respective circle.

original: yat madhyam kendram tat ghanabhūmadhyāt atikrāntam /
analyzed: yat madhyam kendram tat ghana bhū madhyāt atikrāntam
translated: The center which is the midpoint is beyond the center of the dense earth.

analyzed: ghanāḥ ca asau bhūḥ ca ghanabhūḥ
translated: And it is dense, and it is earth, so it is dense earth.

analyzed: tasyāḥ ghanabhuvaḥ madhyam ghanabhūmadhyam
translated: The center of that dense earth is the center of the dense earth.

analyzed: tasmāt ghana bhū madhyāt
translated: From that center of the dense earth.

analyzed: atikrāntam nirgatam uparisthitam iti arthaḥ
translated: It is beyond, it has gone out, it is situated above - this is the meaning.

original: tat yathā yāvat pramāṇaparikalpitam ṣaṣṭiśatatrayāṃśāvacchinnam kakṣyāmaṇḍalam pūrvāparam ūrdhvam vinyasya /

translated: Just as, having placed the ecliptic circle, which is imagined to be of such a size, divided into 360 parts, east-west, above,

original: tādṛś eva anyat maṇḍalam upari adhaḥ kakṣyāmaṇḍalāt vakṣyamāṇena antareṇa pūrvāparayoḥ diśoḥ yatra sampātaḥ tatra yat badhyate gole tatpratimaṇḍalam
analyzed: tādṛś eva anyat maṇḍalam upari adhas kakṣyā maṇḍalāt vakṣyamāṇena antareṇa pūrva aparayoḥ diśoḥ yatra sampātaḥ tatra yat badhyate gole tat pratimaṇḍalam  /
translated: Another circle of the same kind, above and below the belt circle, is the counter-circle, where it is intersected by the east-west line, as will be described later, on the globe.

analyzed: nāma
translated: This is the name of the counter-circle.

analyzed: evam ete kakṣyā pratimaṇḍale vyākhyāte  /
translated: Thus the belt and counter-circles have been explained.
The method of indicating the motion of the planets by the rule of latitude and longitude.

analyzed: kakṣyā pratimaṇḍala antara pratipādana artham āha  prati maṇḍala bhū vivaram vyāsa ardham sva ucca nīca vṛttasya
translated: To indicate the difference between the counter-circle and the belt, it is said:🔽The distance between the counter-circle and the earth is the semi-diameter of the high and low circles.

original: vṛttaparidhau grahāḥ te madhyamacārāt bhramanti evam // //
analyzed: vṛttaparidhau grahāḥ te madhyamacārāt bhramanti evam  /
translated: The planets move on the circumference of the circle in this way, from the middle course.

original: pratimaṇḍalasya bhūmaṇḍalasya ca vivaram pratimaṇḍalabhūvivaram /🔽vyāsārdham svoccanīcavṛttasya /
analyzed: pratimaṇḍalasya bhū maṇḍalasya ca vivaram pratimaṇḍala bhū vivaram  vyāsārdham sva ucca nīca vṛttasya
translated: The distance between the counter-circle and the earth is the distance between the counter-circle and the earth.🔽The semi-diameter of the high and low circles.

analyzed: uccavṛttam nīcavṛttam ca uccanīcavṛttam
translated: The high circle and the low circle are the high and low circles.

original: svasya uccanīcavṛttam svoccanīcavṛttam /🔽tasya svoccanīcavṛttasya vyāsārdham pratimaṇḍalabhūvivaram /
analyzed: svasya ucca nīca vṛttam sva ucca nīca vṛttam  tasya sva ucca nīca vṛttasya vyāsa ardham prati maṇḍala bhū vivaram
translated: The high and low circles of itself are the high and low circles of itself.🔽The semi-diameter of that high and low circle is the distance between the counter-circle and the earth.

original: tat yathā jhārdhāni mandavṛttam iti adhikṛtya śaśinaḥ cha gītikā /
analyzed: tat yathā mandavṛttam iti adhikṛtya śaśinaḥ cha gītikā
translated: For example, the semi-diameter of the slow circle, with reference to the moon, is 10.

analyzed: iti sapta śaśinaḥ jha ardhāni ucca nīcca vṛttam
translated: Thus, the seven lunar mansions are the high and low orbits of the moon.

original: sārdhaikatriṃśadbhāgapramāṇam iti arthaḥ /🔽yasya yat vyāsārdham tat trairāśikagaṇitena
analyzed: sārdha ekatriṃśat bhāga pramāṇam iti arthaḥ  yasya yat vyāsa ardham tat trairāśikagaṇitena
translated: The meaning is that the measure is one-and-a-half times thirty-one parts.

original: siddham / yadi caturadhikam śatam aṣṭaguṇam gaṇita /
analyzed: siddham yadi caturadhikam śatam aṣṭaguṇam gaṇita
translated: By the rule of three, the diameter of the one whose diameter is known is obtained. If the diameter is one hundred and eight times,

analyzed: iti evamādeḥ paridheḥ ayuta tulyam vyāsa ardham labhyate tadā sārdha ekatriṃśat bhāga pramāṇasya paridheḥ kim iti labdham bhāgāḥ pañca
translated: then the diameter of the one whose diameter is equal to ten thousand of such circumferences is obtained. Then, what is the diameter of the circumference whose measure is one-and-a-half times thirty-one parts? The obtained parts are five.

analyzed: liptā ca ardha adhikena ekā
translated: And the finger-breadths are one and a half.

analyzed: sūryasya api trīṇi jha ardhāni manda vṛttam
translated: The three lunar mansions are the slow orbit of the sun.

analyzed: sārdha trayodaśa bhāga pramāṇam
translated: The measure is one-and-a-half times thirteen parts.

original: tasya ca trairāśikena svavṛttaviṣkambhārdham labdham bhāgadvayam /
analyzed: tasya ca trairāśikena sva vṛtta viṣkambha ardham labdham bhāga dvayam
translated: And by the rule of three, the diameter of its own orbit is obtained as two parts.

analyzed: ardha adhikena nava liptāḥ  athavā yadi ṣaṣṭi śata traya bhāga mita paridheḥ vasu tri kṛta vahni liptā mitam
translated: And the finger-breadths are nine and a half.🔽Or, if the diameter is obtained as ten thousand and eight hundred and sixty finger-breadths of the circumference measured by three hundred and sixty parts,

translated: then what is the obtained diameter of the high and low orbits of the moon? The high and low diameter of the moon is obtained as three hundred and fifty finger-breadths.

analyzed: evam sūryasya api śatam ekonatriṃśaduttaram sārdham
translated: In the same way, the sun has one less than a hundred and thirty-nine and a half [paraloxas].

analyzed: tatra bhāga pramāṇena liptā pramāṇena vā kakṣyā pratimaṇḍala madhya antaram parikalpyam
translated: There, the distance between the center and the circumference of the ecliptic should be imagined by the measure of a part or by the measure of a lipta.

analyzed: evam sūryācandramasoḥ
translated: In the same way, for the sun and the moon.

original: anyathā anyeṣām samaviṣamavṛttamandoccaśīghroccabhedena anekapratimaṇḍalaprasaṅgabhayāt uttaratra vakṣyati bhūtārāgrahavivaram kālakriyā /
analyzed: anyathā anyeṣām sama viṣama vṛtta manda ucca śīghra ucca bhedena aneka pratimaṇḍala prasaṅga bhayāt uttaratra vakṣyati bhū tārā graha vivaram kālakriyā
translated: Otherwise, for the others, there would be the fear of many ecliptic circles due to the difference in the slow and fast ascensions of the even and uneven circles, so he will say later: The difference between the true and the ecliptic longitudes is the correction for the time.

analyzed: iti  vṛtta paridhiḥ
translated: Thus.🔽The ecliptic circle

analyzed: kakṣyā maṇḍalam
translated: is the zodiac.

analyzed: tasmin vṛttaparidhau madhyamacāram grahāḥ bhramanti
translated: The planets move in the middle path in that circular zodiac.

original: pratimaṇḍaleṣu sphuṭacāram bhramanti iti arthāt avasīyate // //
analyzed: pratimaṇḍaleṣu sphuṭa cāram bhramanti iti arthāt avasīyate  /
translated: It is understood that they move in the apparent path in the ecliptic circles.

analyzed: nīca ucca vṛtta paridhau graha gatiḥ
translated: The motion of the planets in the circular zodiac of ascensions and descents

original: grahabhuktyānayanavakrānuvakraparijñānāya āha 🔽yaḥ śīghragatiḥ svoccāt pratilomagatiḥ svavṛttakakṣyāyām /🔽anulomagatiḥ vṛtte mandagatiḥ yaḥ grahaḥ bhavati // //
analyzed: āha  yaḥ śīghra gatiḥ sva uccāt pratiloma gatiḥ sva vṛtta kakṣyāyām  anulomagatiḥ vṛtte mandagatiḥ yaḥ grahaḥ bhavati  /
translated: In order to calculate the planetary equations and to know the direct and retrograde motions, he says:🔽The planet that moves quickly in the opposite direction from its highest point in its own circle,🔽the planet that moves slowly in the same direction in the circle, becomes.

analyzed: śīghrā gatiḥ yasya tat śīgrahgatiḥ
translated: The one whose motion is quick is the planet with quick motion.

original: śīghragatiḥ ca tat svoccam ca śīghragatiḥ svoccam /🔽śīghratatiḥsvoccāt yaḥ pratilomagatiḥ śīghragatiḥ /
analyzed: śīghragatiḥ ca tat svoccam ca śīghragatiḥ svoccam  yaḥ pratiloma gatiḥ śīghra gatiḥ
translated: And [the planet] is in its own exaltation, and [its] motion is direct, [the planet] is in its own exaltation.🔽[The planet] is in its own exaltation, and [its] motion is retrograde, [the planet] is in its own exaltation.

analyzed: sva ucca śabdena sva śīghra ucca bhuktiḥ parigṛhyate
translated: By the word exaltation the own exaltation distance is meant.

analyzed: sā yadi śīghra ucca bhuktiḥ sva kendra anta jyā sādhita sphuṭa madhyama bhukteḥ na patati
translated: If that [distance] does not fall from the true mean distance accomplished by the sine of its own center-to-vertex [distance],

original: tadā sā eva sphuṭamadhyamā bhuktiḥ svakendrāntajyāsādhitā svaśīghroccabhukteḥ pratilomena pātyate /
