translated: then that very true mean distance, accomplished by the sine of its own center-to-vertex [distance], is cast in the opposite direction of the own exaltation distance.

analyzed: tadā śīghra gatiḥ sva ucca gatiḥ iti ucyate
translated: Then it is said that [the planet] is in its own exaltation motion.

analyzed: pratiloma śabdena ca viparīta pātita śeṣa liptāḥ  parigṛhyante
translated: And by the word opposite the remaining degrees cast in the opposite direction are meant.

analyzed: evam ayam vigrahārthaḥ niṣpannaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus this meaning of the compound is completed.

original: pratilomā gatiḥ yasya saḥ pratilomagatiḥ iti /
analyzed: pratilomā gatiḥ yasya saḥ pratilomagatiḥ iti
translated: [The planet] whose motion is opposite is in opposite motion.

original: āditaḥ eva etat bhuktyānayanam prati vakṣyate /
analyzed: āditaḥ eva etat bhuktyānayanam prati vakṣyate
translated: This method of determining the [planet's] distance will be explained later.

original: tat yathā mandoccakendrāntajyām krameṇa utkrameṇa vā niṣpannām svamadhyamabhuktiliptābhiḥ guṇayet /
analyzed: tat yathā manda ucca kendra anta jyām krameṇa utkrameṇa vā niṣpannām sva madhyama bhukti liptābhiḥ guṇayet
translated: [The astronomer] should multiply the sine of the center-to-vertex [distance] of the slow [planet] in order or in reverse by the degrees of its own mean distance.

original: punar ca tat kālapratidhinā guṇitasya aṣṭādaśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ bhāgalabdham kendrapadavaśāt🔽ardhīkṛtya grahamadhyamabhuktiliptāsu prakṣipya viśodhya vā svaśīghroccabhuktiliptābhiḥ śodhayet /
analyzed: punar ca tat kāla pratidhinā guṇitasya aṣṭādaśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ bhāga labdham kendra pada vaśāt  ardhīkṛtya graha madhyama bhukti liptāsu prakṣipya viśodhya vā sva śīghra ucca bhukti liptābhiḥ śodhayet
translated: Again, the result of dividing the product of that [value] by the time multiplied by 18,000 by the arc of the center [of the circle]🔽is halved and added to or subtracted from the degrees of the mean motion of the planets.

analyzed: śeṣam sva śīghra uccaka indra anta jyā krama utkrama jyā guṇam tat kāla śīghra ucca paridhinā guṇayet
translated: The remainder is multiplied by the sine of the arc of the center of the [planet's] own motion in an oblique circle, in direct or retrograde order, by the circumference of the [planet's] own motion in an oblique circle at that time.

original: bhāgaḥ aṣṭādaśabhiḥ🔽sahasraiḥ / labdham vyāsārdhagatam svakarṇena vibhajet /
analyzed: bhāgaḥ aṣṭādaśabhiḥ  sahasraiḥ labdham vyāsa ardha gatam sva karṇena vibhajet
translated: The quotient is divided by 18,000.🔽The result, when multiplied by the radius, is divided by its own chord.

analyzed: kṣipet
translated: Half of the result is added to or subtracted from the degrees of the mean motion of the planets, according to the arc of the center [of the circle].

analyzed: viśodhayet vā
translated: It is to be corrected.

original: tataḥ tam kṣiptaviśodhitaśeṣam gṛhītvā tṛtīyakarma mandoccakendrāntajyākramotkramajyām tat kālaparidhiguṇam aṣṭādaśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ vibhajet
analyzed: tatas tam kṣipta viśodhita śeṣam gṛhītvā tṛtīya karma manda uccaka indra anta jyā krama utkrama jyām tat kāla paridhi guṇam aṣṭādaśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ vibhajet
translated: Then, taking that added or subtracted remainder, the third operation is to divide the sine of the arc of the center of the slow motion, in direct or retrograde order, multiplied by the circumference at that time, by 18,000.

original: labdham samastam eva grahamadhyamabhuktiliptāsu mandakendrapadavaśāt kṣipet /
analyzed: labdham samastam eva graha madhyama bhukti liptāsu mandakendra pada vaśāt kṣipet
translated: The entire result is added to or subtracted from the degrees of the mean motion of the planets, according to the arc of the center of the slow motion.

analyzed: viśodhayet vā
translated: It is to be corrected.

analyzed: kṣiptam viśodhita śiṣṭam vā sphuṭa madhyama bhukti liptāḥ avinaṣṭāḥ
translated: Cast off, purified, or remaining, smeared with the enjoyment of the clear middle, not destroyed,

analyzed: tāḥ sva śīghra ucca bhukti liptābhyaḥ viśodhayet
translated: [The mean motion] subtracted, or the remainder after correction, multiplied by the mean distance, divided by the degrees of the mean motion, will be the correction to the mean distance.🔽The remainder should be added to the degrees of the mean distance.

original: śeṣam gṛhītvā caturthakarma śīghroccakendrāntajyākramotkramajyām tat kālaparidhiguṇam aṣṭādaśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ vibhajet /🔽labdham vyāsārdhaguṇam karṇena vibhajet /
analyzed: śeṣam gṛhītvā caturthakarma śīghra ucca kendra anta jyā krama utkrama jyām tat kāla paridhi guṇam aṣṭādaśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ vibhajet  labdham vyāsa ardha guṇam karṇena vibhajet
translated: Taking the remainder and dividing it by 18,000 times the sine of the arc of the ecliptic for that time, multiplied by the sine of the difference of the ascensions of the meridian of the sun and the ascendent, [one obtains] the sine of the arc of the ecliptic in the order of the ascensions of the meridian.🔽Multiplying the result by the semi-diameter of the earth, and dividing by the sine of the arc of the ecliptic, [one obtains] the semi-diameter of the earth.

original: tatra yad avāptam tat yadi kṣepyam sphuṭamadhyamabhuktiliptāsu kṣipet /
analyzed: tatra yat avāptam tat yadi kṣepyam sphuṭa madhyama bhukti liptāsu kṣipet
translated: If the result is to be subtracted, it should be subtracted from the degrees of the mean motion.

original: niṣpannā grahasya sphuṭabhuktiḥ /🔽atha viśodhyam sad yadi sphuṭamadhyamabhuktitaḥ na patati tadā pratilomagatiḥ grahaḥ sphuṭamadhyamabhuktiliptāḥ eva viparītam
analyzed: niṣpannā grahasya sphuṭa bhuktiḥ  atha viśodhyam sat yadi sphuṭa madhyama bhuktitaḥ na patati tadā pratiloma gatiḥ grahaḥ sphuṭa madhyama bhukti liptāḥ eva viparītam
translated: The true motion of the planet is then complete.

analyzed: śodhyāḥ śeṣam vakrabhogaḥ
translated: If the result is to be added, and it does not fall within the degrees of the mean motion, then the planet is in retrograde motion. The degrees of the mean motion should be subtracted from the degrees of the true motion, and the remainder is the amount of retrogradation.

analyzed: asmin arthe iyam kārikā
translated: In this matter, there is this verse:

analyzed: yaḥ śīghra gatiḥ sva uccāt pratiloma gatiḥ sva vṛtta kakṣyāyām
translated: The planet moving swiftly from its exaltation, in retrograde motion in its own orbit, moves in retrograde motion.

analyzed: pratiloma gatiḥ vakra gatiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that retrograde motion is motion in the opposite direction.

analyzed: anuloma gatiḥ vṛtte
translated: In the circle, it moves in the forward direction.

analyzed: asau anulomagatiḥ bhavati
translated: That is, it moves in the forward direction.

original: yadā śīghroccāt śīghroccakendrāntajyāniṣpannā liptāḥ sphuṭamadhyamabhuktiliptābhyaḥ viśuddhāḥ /
analyzed: yadā śīghra uccāt śīghra ucca kendra anta jyā niṣpannāḥ liptāḥ sphuṭa madhyama bhukti liptābhyaḥ viśuddhāḥ
translated: When the degrees obtained from the arc of the meridian of the mean motion are subtracted from the degrees of the true mean motion,

analyzed: tadā asau grahaḥ anuvakrī
translated: then that planet is retrograde.

analyzed: tatra ca viśeṣa liptāḥ anuloma śabda vācyāḥ
translated: And there, the special degrees are called direct.

original: tataḥ arthāt ayam vigrahaḥ avasitaḥ anulomā gatiḥ yasya sa anulomagatiḥ iti /
analyzed: tatas arthāt ayam vigrahaḥ avasitaḥ anulomā gatiḥ yasya sa anulomagatiḥ iti
translated: From that, the analysis is completed: He whose motion is direct is one whose motion is direct.

original: sa ca alpam gaccahati iti mandagatiḥ abhidhīyate // //
analyzed: sa ca alpam iti mandagatiḥ abhidhīyate  /
translated: And he is said to move slowly because he moves little.

analyzed: nīca ucca vṛtta bhramaṇa prakāra antaram
translated: Another method of motion on the ecliptic and the meridian

analyzed: grahāṇām sphuṭīkaraṇa prakāra antaram āha
translated: He states another method of making the planets true:

analyzed: anuloma gāni mandāt śīghrāt pratiloma gāni vṛttāni

The planet in the middle of its own circle at the ascendant of the ecliptic is the middle [planet].

analyzed: anulomam gacchati iti anulomagatiḥ
translated: He moves in the direct [direction], therefore he has direct motion.

analyzed: tat uktam mandāt

analyzed: ukta manda ucca avadheḥ madhyamāt iti
translated: It is stated as from the middle [motion] of the slow [motion] and the high [motion].

original: tat atra api śīghroccāvadheḥ madhyamāt iti etat ekaprakrameṇa bhavitavyam /
analyzed: tat atra api śīghra ucca avadheḥ madhyamāt iti etat eka prakrameṇa bhavitavyam

analyzed: na iti āha śīghrāt pratiloma gatiḥ pratiloma avadheḥ

analyzed: śīghra uccasya pratiloma gatīni viparīta gatīni yāni vṛttāni paridhayaḥ

original: atra vṛttasya ekadeśe vṛttaśabdopacārāt paridhayaḥ ca iti /
analyzed: atra vṛttasya eka deśe vṛtta śabda upacārāt paridhayaḥ ca iti

analyzed: yathā manda śīghra kendrayoḥ tad jyā kāṣṭhe dhanūṃṣi

analyzed: ataḥ tāni dhanūṃṣi mandakendrāt jātāni krameṇa

analyzed: śīghrakendrāt jātāni utkrameṇa upacīyante

original: ataḥ anulomagāni mandāt śīghrāt pratilomagāni vṛttāni /

translated: Therefore, the retrograde motions are from the slow [node], and the direct motions are from the swift [node].

analyzed: katham punar vṛttāni manda śīghra kendrayoḥ tad jyā dhanūṃṣi krama utkrama gatīni

analyzed: gateḥ avasthā vācaka tvāt yathā
translated: Because motion expresses a state, just as

analyzed: gatiḥ asti iti bhūtānām sukumārāyate manaḥ
translated: There is motion - the minds of beings become tender.

analyzed: anastvaniśam eva ūḍham dhuram vahati gauḥ iva

analyzed: tathā
translated: Similarly,

analyzed: dānam bhogaḥ nāśaḥ tisraḥ gatayaḥ bhavanti vittasya

analyzed: yaḥ na dadāti na bhuṅkte tasya tṛtīyā gatiḥ bhavati

Bhartṛhari.

analyzed: nītiśatakam
translated: The Hundred on Policy.

analyzed: tasmāt yāni eva jyā dhanūṃṣi tāni eva pratiloma anuloma gatīni

analyzed: śīghra ucca jyā dhanūṃṣi śīghra uccāt apacīyante

analyzed: kutas etat sampradāya avicchedāt

analyzed: atha vyākhyānataḥ viśeṣa pratipattiḥ

analyzed: na hi sandehāt alakṣaṇam aṣṭādhyāyī

analyzed: śivasūtram

analyzed: pātañjala mahābhāṣyam iti

analyzed: athavā manda ucca śīghra ucca śravaṇāt manda ucca śīghra uccayoḥ eva pratipattiḥ

analyzed: anyasya aśruta tvāt ca

The method of making the planets clear by the method of the counter-circle

original: ayam āryāsūtrārthaḥ yathā ghaṭate tathā karmaṇā pratipādayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: ayam āryā sūtra arthaḥ yathā ghaṭate tathā karmaṇā pratipādayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will explain by action how the meaning of this Ārya Sūtra fits together.

analyzed: iṣṭāt grahāt tat mandoccam viśodhayet
translated: From the desired planet, one should subtract its slow-moving ascendant.

original: śeṣam rāśyādikam mandoccāt pravṛttam tat kakṣyāmaṇḍalotpannam iti pratimaṇḍale kriyate /
analyzed: śeṣam rāśi ādikam manda uccāt pravṛttam tat kakṣyā maṇḍala utpannam iti pratimaṇḍale kriyate

analyzed: yasmāt pratimaṇḍale sphuṭa grahaḥ bhramati
translated: Because the clear planet moves in the counter-circle.

original: tena tasmāt mandoccāt ārabhya yat kāṣṭham tat mahati maṇḍale alpam bhavati /
analyzed: tena tasmāt manda uccāt ārabhya yat kāṣṭham tat mahati maṇḍale alpam bhavati

analyzed: mahati mahāntaḥ ca rāśayaḥ jñeyāḥ
translated: And the large figures should be known as large.

original: aṃśāḥ kalāḥ tathā evam kālakriyā / iti /
analyzed: aṃśāḥ kalāḥ tathā evam kālakriyā iti
translated: The parts and the kalas are similarly the time-units.

original: alpe pratimaṇḍale tat eva kāṣṭham bahutaram
analyzed: alpe pratimaṇḍale tat eva kāṣṭham bahutaram
translated: In a small circle, that same arc is much larger

analyzed: bhavati māna alpa tvāt
translated: because of the smallness of the measure.

original: vrīhyādayaḥ mahatā mānaviśeṣeṇa pramīyamānāḥ prasthādisaṅkhyayā alpāḥ bhavanti /
analyzed: vrīhi ādayaḥ mahatā māna viśeṣeṇa pramīyamānāḥ prastha ādi saṅkhyayā alpāḥ bhavanti

original: te eva alpena mānaviśeṣeṇa mīyamānāḥ prasthādiśaṅkhyayā bahavaḥ bhavanti evam atra api /
analyzed: te eva alpena māna viśeṣeṇa mīyamānāḥ prastha ādi śaṅkhyayā bahavaḥ bhavanti evam atra api
translated: Those same [grains], when measured with a small measure, become many in number by prastha and so on. It is the same here also.

original: katham punar tat kāṣṭham kakṣyāmaṇḍalotpannam pratimaṇḍale pramīyate /
analyzed: katham punar tat kāṣṭham kakṣyā maṇḍala utpannam pratimaṇḍale pramīyate
translated: But how is that arc, produced in the circle of the ecliptic, measured in the circle of the meridian?

original: ucyate tat kāṣṭhasya padāni vyatītāni pratyākalayya vartamānapadasya bhujākoṭijyayā karma idam kriyate pratimaṇḍalasya madhyam ghanabhūmadhyāt
analyzed: ucyate tat kāṣṭhasya padāni vyatītāni pratyākalayya vartamānapadasya bhujākoṭijyayā karma idam kriyate pratimaṇḍalasya madhyam ghanabhū madhyāt  /
translated: It is said: having estimated the past steps of that arc, this operation is performed with the chord and radius of the present step. The center of the circle of the meridian is subtracted from the center of the dense earth.

analyzed: atikrāntam kālakriyā
translated: The time-unit is passed.

original: iti pratimaṇḍalabhūvivaram koṭyām prathamacaturthayoḥ padayoḥ prakṣipyate /
analyzed: iti pratimaṇḍala bhū vivaram koṭyām prathama caturthayoḥ padayoḥ prakṣipyate

analyzed: dvitīya tṛtīyayoḥ apanīyate
translated: In the second and third [quarters], it is subtracted.

original: etat pratipādanārtham samāyāmavanau vṛttakendram nidhāya yāvat tāvat pramāṇaparikalpitavyāsārdhapramāṇena karkaṭakena vṛttam ālikhet /

translated: For the purpose of demonstrating this, having placed the center of the circle on the earth at the meridian, one should draw a circle with a gnomon of the length of the distance calculated.

analyzed: tasya vṛttasya pūrva apara dakṣiṇa uttara lekhe kṛtvā tad vṛtta kendrāt antya phala jyā pramāṇam
translated: Having drawn the east-west and north-south lines of that circle, from the center of that circle, with a string the length of the sine of the final result,

analyzed: sūtram manda ucca abhimukham dakṣiṇena nidhāya tatra kakṣyā maṇḍala vyāsa ardha tulya karkaṭakena vṛttam ālikhet
translated: facing the slow latitude, having placed it to the south, with a gnomon equal to the semi-diameter of the ecliptic circle, one should draw a circle.

analyzed: tat pratimaṇḍalam iti ucyate
translated: That is called the counter-circle.

analyzed: tat prathama caturtha padayoḥ kakṣyā maṇḍalāt upari avatiṣṭhate
translated: In the first and fourth quarters, it remains above the ecliptic circle.

analyzed: dvitīya tṛtīyayoḥ
translated: In the second and third [quarters],

original: adhaḥ / tatra yā koṭijyā sā kakṣyāmaṇḍalotpannā kakṣyāmaṇḍalabhūmyantarālapramāṇā /
analyzed: adhas tatra yā koṭijyā sā kakṣyā maṇḍala utpannā kakṣyā maṇḍala bhūmi antarāla pramāṇā
translated: below. There, the sine of the chord is produced from the ecliptic circle, the distance between the ecliptic circle and the earth.

original: tena pratimaṇḍalabhūvivarāntarālamātreṇa pratimaṇḍalam prathamacaturthayoḥ padayoḥ koṭiḥ na prāpnoti iti prakṣipyate /
analyzed: tena pratimaṇḍala bhū vivara antarāla mātreṇa pratimaṇḍalam prathama caturthayoḥ padayoḥ koṭiḥ na prāpnoti iti prakṣipyate
translated: Therefore, the chord in the first and fourth quarters does not reach the counter-circle by the distance of the space between the counter-circle and the earth, so it is subtracted.

original: dvitīyatṛtīyapadayoḥ tāvatā atītāt pratimaṇḍalāt koṭiḥ iti apanīyate /
analyzed: dvitīya tṛtīya padayoḥ tāvatā atītāt pratimaṇḍalāt koṭiḥ iti apanīyate
translated: In the second and third terms, a koti is subtracted from the previous circle.

original: evam pratimaṇḍalotpannā koṭiḥ bhavati /🔽atha yadi koṭijyātaḥ pratimaṇḍalabhūvivaram na śudhyati /
analyzed: evam prati maṇḍala utpannā koṭiḥ bhavati  atha yadi koṭijyātaḥ pratimaṇḍala bhū vivaram na śudhyati
translated: Thus, the koti is produced from the circle.🔽Now, if the difference between the circle and the earth is not obtained from the koti-sine,

analyzed: tadā pratimaṇḍala bhū vivarāt koṭijyā śodhyate
translated: then the koti-sine is subtracted from the difference between the circle and the earth.

analyzed: tāvatī pratimaṇḍala koṭiḥ bhavati
translated: That much is the koti of the circle.

original: tatra evam niṣpannāyāḥ koṭeḥ bhujajyāyāḥ ca vargasamāsamūlam karṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatra evam niṣpannāyāḥ koṭeḥ bhuja jyāyāḥ ca varga samāsa mūlam karṇaḥ
translated: There, the square root of the sum of the squares of the koti thus obtained and the sine of the side is the hypotenuse.

analyzed: tat sūkṣma arthibhiḥ a viśiṣyate
translated: That is not distinguished by those seeking subtlety.

analyzed: pratimaṇḍala karṇasya vṛddhi hrāsa vaśāt dṛṣṭiḥ bhidyate iti
translated: The sight is distinguished by the increase and decrease of the hypotenuse of the circle.

original: tat yadi vyāsārdhatulyena pratimaṇḍalakarṇena yathā uktam pratimaṇḍalabhūvivaram labhyate tadā tena pratimaṇḍalakarṇena kim iti /
analyzed: tat yadi vyāsa ardha tulyena pratimaṇḍalakarṇena yathā uktam pratimaṇḍala bhū vivaram labhyate tadā tena pratimaṇḍalakarṇena kim iti
translated: If the difference between the circle and the earth is obtained as stated by the hypotenuse of the circle equal to the semi-diameter, then what is the use of that hypotenuse of the circle?

original: labdham pūrvakoṭijyāyām prakṣipyate apanīyate vā /🔽tataḥ tadbhujajyāvargasamāsamūlam karṇaḥ /
analyzed: labdham pūrva koṭijyāyām prakṣipyate apanīyate vā  tatas tad bhuja jyā varga samāsa mūlam karṇaḥ
translated: The obtained is added to or subtracted from the previous koti-sine.🔽Then, the square root of the sum of the squares of that hypotenuse and the sine of the side is the hypotenuse.

original: tena punar pratimaṇḍalabhūvivarānayanam iti yāvat aviśeṣaḥ / tataḥ
analyzed: tena punar prati maṇḍala bhū vivara ānayanam iti yāvat aviśeṣaḥ tatas
translated: Again, the difference between the circle and the earth is obtained by that. Thus, there is no distinction. Therefore,

original: aviśiṣṭakarṇena vyastatrairāśikam kriyate yadi vyāsārdhaviṣkambhasya kakṣyāmaṇḍalasya iyam bhujajyā labhyate /
analyzed: aviśiṣṭa karṇena vyasta trairāśikam kriyate yadi vyāsa ardha viṣkambhasya kakṣyā maṇḍalasya iyam bhuja jyā labhyate
translated: If the arc-chord of the circle of the diameter equal to the semi-diameter is obtained by the method of the unassigned tri-sign, then the sine of the arc-chord is obtained.

original: tadā tena karṇena pratimaṇḍalajena kā iti /
analyzed: tadā tena karṇena pratimaṇḍala jena kā iti
translated: If the sine of the arc of the ecliptic of the semidiameter is obtained by the unextended [sine] of the asunextended [sine] of the arc of the ecliptic of the semidiameter, then what is the sine of the arc of the counter-circle by that extended [sine]?

analyzed: vyasta trairāśika tvāt vyāsa ardham guṇakāraḥ
translated: Because of the unextended [sine] of the arc of the ecliptic of the semidiameter being the multiplier,

analyzed: karṇaḥ bhāgahāraḥ  labdham pratimaṇḍala bhuja jyā
translated: and the extended [sine] being the divisor,🔽the sine of the arc of the counter-circle is obtained.

original: tat kāṣṭham mandocce prakṣipya sphuṭaḥ grahaḥ bhavati /
analyzed: tat kāṣṭham mandocce prakṣipya sphuṭaḥ grahaḥ bhavati
translated: That [sine] is added to the mean [longitude], and the true [longitude] of the planet results.

analyzed: yasya manda uccaka indram prathama pade
translated: For the one whose mean longitude of the node is in the first place,

original: dvitīyapade ṣaḍbhyaḥ rāśibhyaḥ viśodhya bhujā gṛhītā iti ṣaṅbhyaḥ apanīyate /
analyzed: dvitīyapade ṣaḍbhyaḥ rāśibhyaḥ viśodhya bhujā gṛhītā iti ṣaṅbhyaḥ apanīyate
translated: in the second place, the arc is taken by subtracting from six signs.

analyzed: śeṣam manda ucce prakṣipyate
translated: The remainder is added to the mean [longitude of the] node.

original: tṛtīyapade cakrārdhādhikabhujā iti tat cāpam cakrārdhasahitam mandocce prakṣipyate /
analyzed: tṛtīya pade cakra ardha adhika bhujāḥ iti tat cāpam cakra ardha sahitam manda ucce prakṣipyate
translated: And in the third place, the arc plus half a circle. That arc together with half a circle is added to the mean [longitude of the] node.

original: caturthapade dvādaśebhyaḥ viśuddhaśeṣam bhujā iti cakrāt tat kāṣṭham viśodhya śeṣam mandocce prakṣipyate /
analyzed: caturtha pade dvādaśebhyaḥ viśuddha śeṣam bhujāḥ iti cakrāt tat kāṣṭham viśodhya śeṣam manda ucce prakṣipyate
translated: And in the fourth place, the arc is the remainder after subtracting from twelve. That arc is subtracted from a circle, and the remainder is added to the mean [longitude of the] node.

analyzed: evam sphuṭagrahaḥ bhavati
translated: In this way, the true [longitude of the] planet results.

analyzed: yasya śīghra uccam na vidyate
translated: For the one whose [longitude of the] ascending node is not known,

original: yeṣām punar śīghroccam vidyate teṣām karmaviśeṣaḥ ucyate /
analyzed: yeṣām punar śīghra uccam vidyate teṣām karma viśeṣaḥ ucyate
translated: But for those who have a quick orbit, a special calculation is stated.

original: tat yathā paridhicālanāprayogeṇa sphuṭīkṛtaparidhinā vyāsārdham samguṇayya aśītyā bhāgalabdham pratimaṇḍalabhūvivaram mandaśīghroccayoḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā paridhi cālanā prayogeṇa sphuṭīkṛta paridhinā vyāsa ardham samguṇayya aśītyā bhāga labdham prati maṇḍala bhū vivaram manda śīghra uccayoḥ
translated: As follows: By multiplying the semi-diameter by 80, the difference in the circle of the ecliptic between the slow and quick orbits is obtained by the division.

analyzed: tena anantara abhihita manda ucca karmaṇā manda ucca phalam sādhayet
translated: By that, one should calculate the result of the slow orbit according to the previously stated method of calculating the slow orbit.

analyzed: tad sakala saṃskṛtaḥ grahaḥ bhavati
translated: That is the planet corrected for the whole.

analyzed: tat evam niṣpannasya
translated: And that is the case for the completed [planet].

original: madhyamasya grahasya ca yat antarārdham tat madhyamāt mandoccasiddhe adhike madhyamagrahe dhanam / ūne ṛṇam
analyzed: madhyamasya grahasya ca yat antara ardham tat madhyamāt manda ucca siddhe adhike madhyama grahe dhanam ūne ṛṇam
translated: The difference between the mean and the [planet] whose orbit is completed is added to the mean [planet] if it is greater than the mean [planet], and subtracted if it is less.

analyzed: evam manda ucca saṃskaraṇam
translated: This is the correction for the slow orbit.

original: etat eva karma śanigurukujeṣu mande ardham ṛṇadhanam bhavati pūrvam kālakriyā /
analyzed: etat eva karma śani guru kujeṣu mande ardham ṛṇadhanam bhavati pūrvam kālakriyā
translated: This same calculation is for Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars. The slow [orbit] is half the amount of the addition and subtraction, and the time is the same as before.

analyzed: iti anena granthena abhidhīyate
translated: This is stated by this text.

analyzed: katham sani guru kujeṣu
translated: How? For Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars.

original: mandāraguruṣu madhyameṣu madhyamakarmaṇā siddheṣu mandāraguruṣu iti arthaḥ /
analyzed: mandāraguruṣu madhyameṣu madhyama karmaṇā siddheṣu mandāraguruṣu iti arthaḥ
translated: For the slow [orbits] of Jupiter and Saturn, the meaning is that they are completed by the mean calculation.

analyzed: ardham ṛṇadhanam bhavati pūrvam kālakriyā
translated: Half of the debt or credit is the former time of the event.

original: iti kasya ardham ṛṇam dhanam vā bhavati iti atra sampradāyāvicchedāt mandasiddhamadhyamāntaram parigṛhyate /
analyzed: iti kasya ardham ṛṇam dhanam vā bhavati iti atra sampradāya avicchedāt manda siddha madhyama antaram parigṛhyate
translated: Thus, to whom does the debt or credit belong? In this case, the middle value of the slow [motion] is accepted, which is well known due to the uninterrupted tradition.

analyzed: kim tasya ardham madhye grahe
translated: What is its half in the middle of the [celestial] longitude?

original: dhanam ṛṇam vā pūrvasiddhe mandoccakarmaṇi bhavati /
analyzed: dhanam ṛṇam vā pūrva siddhe manda ucca karmaṇi bhavati
translated: The debt or credit is in the previously established operation for the maximum distance of the slow [motion].

original: idam ca karma mandoccaśīghroccayoḥ sāmānyena prasiddham /
analyzed: idam ca karma manda ucca śīghra uccayoḥ sāmānyena prasiddham
translated: And this operation is well known in general for the maximum distance of the slow [motion] and the maximum distance of the fast [motion].

analyzed: kutas viśeṣa anuvādana abhāvāt
translated: Why? Because there is no statement of a specific [rule].

original: tat yathā evam ardhena phalena saṃskṛtam madhyamam graham śīghroccāt grahāt viśodhayet /
analyzed: tat yathā evam ardhena phalena saṃskṛtam madhyamam graham śīghra uccāt grahāt viśodhayet
translated: Just as the middle [celestial] longitude, corrected by half the result, should be subtracted from the [celestial] longitude of the fast [motion].

original: tatra kendrapadavibhāgena bhujākoṭijye gṛhītvā sphuṭīkṛtasvaśīghroccaparidhinā vyāsārdham
analyzed: tatra kendra pada vibhāgena bhujā koṭijye gṛhītvā sphuṭīkṛta sva śīghra ucca paridhinā vyāsa ardham
translated: There, taking the sine of the chord by dividing the center point, multiplying by the semi-diameter corrected by the circumference of the fast [motion],

original: saṃguṇayya aśītyā bhāgalabdhapratimaṇḍalabhūvivareṇa pūrvakarmaṇā eva saṃskṛtāt karṇam ānayet /
analyzed: saṃguṇayya aśītyā bhāga labdha pratimaṇḍala bhū vivareṇa pūrva karmaṇā eva saṃskṛtāt karṇam ānayet
translated: and bringing the hypotenuse by the square of the difference of the previously corrected [value] by the square of the [value] obtained by dividing the result by eighty,

analyzed: atra aviśeṣa abhāvāt
translated: Here, because there is no distinction,

analyzed: a viśeṣa karma na pravartate
translated: the operation without distinction does not proceed.

original: tataḥ bhujajyayā vyāsārdham saṃguṇayya karṇena bhāgalabdhasya kāṣṭham śīghroccakendre prathamapade śīghroccāt apanīyate /
analyzed: tatas bhuja jyayā vyāsa ardham saṃguṇayya karṇena bhāga labdhasya kāṣṭham śīghrocca kendre prathama pade śīghroccāt apanīyate
translated: Then, having multiplied the arc-length by the semimajor axis, the quotient obtained by division by the chord is subtracted from the ascensional difference in the first place.

original: dvitīye pade ṣaḍbhyaḥ viśodhya śeṣam śīghroccāt apanīyate /
analyzed: dvitīye pade ṣaḍbhyaḥ viśodhya śeṣam śīghra uccāt apanīyate
translated: In the second place, having subtracted from six, the remainder is subtracted from the ascensional difference.

analyzed: tṛtīye pade cakra ardha yuktam
translated: In the third place, [the remainder] is added to half a revolution.

analyzed: caturthe pade dvādaśabhyaḥ viśuddha śeṣam
translated: In the fourth place, the remainder after subtracting twelve.

analyzed: śīghrāt pratiloma gāni vṛttāni iti vacanāt
translated: Because it is said that the revolutions are retrograde from the ascensional difference.

analyzed: evam sīghra ucca sakala phala saṃskṛtaḥ grahaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus the planet is refined by the total result of the ascensional difference.

original: tasya mandoccasiddhasya ca pūrvavat eva antarārdham mandoccasiddhe pūrvakalpanayā
analyzed: tasya manda ucca siddhasya ca pūrvavat eva antara ardham manda ucca siddhe pūrva kalpanayā
translated: The difference of the mean anomaly of that [planet] corrected for the true ascensional difference, as before,

original: eva dhanam ṛṇam vā kuryāt /🔽tat mandaśīghrasiddham avinaṣṭam vidhāya tasmāt mandoccam viśodhya pūrvavat eva mandoccam sādhayet /
analyzed: eva dhanam ṛṇam vā kuryāt  tat manda śīghra siddham avinaṣṭam vidhāya tasmāt manda uccam viśodhya pūrvavat eva manda uccam sādhayet
translated: should be made positive or negative according to the previous rule.🔽Having determined that true ascensional difference which is neither lost nor gained, and having subtracted it from the mean ascensional difference, one should determine the mean ascensional difference as before.

original: tasya mandoccasiddhasya dvisaṃskṛtasya avinaṣṭasthāpitasya ca yaḥ viśeṣaḥ tam sakalam eva dvisaṃskṛtahīnamadhyamāt viśodhayet /
analyzed: tasya manda ucca siddhasya dvi saṃskṛtasya avinaṣṭa sthāpitasya ca yaḥ viśeṣaḥ tam sakalam eva dvi saṃskṛta hīna madhyamāt viśodhayet
translated: The difference between that true ascensional difference, which is twice refined and neither lost nor gained, and the mean ascensional difference, which is twice refined and neither lost nor gained, should be subtracted from the mean ascensional difference, which is not twice refined.

analyzed: adhika madhyame prakṣipet
translated: [The difference] should be added to the higher and middling [values].

original: arthāt dvisaṃskṛtamandasiddhe ūne sati viśodhayet anyathā prakṣipet /
analyzed: arthāt dvi saṃskṛta manda siddhe ūne sati viśodhayet anyathā prakṣipet
translated: In other words, if the [value] is less than the [value] obtained by the slow [motion] method twice, it should be corrected; otherwise it should be added.

original: tam evaṃkṛtam śīghroccāt viśodhya śīghroccaprasiddhakarmaṇā saṃsiddhaḥ sphuṭaḥ grahaḥ bhaviṣyati
analyzed: tam evaṃkṛtam śīghra uccāt viśodhya śīghra ucca prasiddha karmaṇā saṃsiddhaḥ sphuṭaḥ grahaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: That [value] thus obtained, corrected from the quick [motion] method, will be the true [value] of the planet, obtained by the operation for the quick [motion] method.

original: iti / etat eva karma saṃkṣepeṇa asmābhiḥ karmanibandhe uktam
analyzed: iti etat eva karma saṃkṣepeṇa asmābhiḥ karmanibandhe uktam
translated: This very operation has been stated by us concisely in the Karmāṇibandha [chapter]:

analyzed: pratimaṇḍala karma api yojyam atra vipaśi citā
translated: The operation for the individual circles should also be applied here, having been well understood.

original: mandocce pūrvavat kuryāt śīghroccāt tat viśodhyate //🔽tat eva kevalam śodhyam cakrārdhāt śodhya tat calāt /
analyzed: manda ucce pūrvavat kuryāt śīghra uccāt tat viśodhyate  tat eva kevalam śodhyam cakrārdhāt śodhya tat calāt
translated: The slow [motion] should be done as before; it is corrected from the quick [motion].🔽That [value] alone should be corrected; it should be corrected from the half-circle; from the movable [value].

original: cakrārdhasaṃyutam cāpam cakrāt śuddham ca śeṣayoḥ //
analyzed: cakra ardha saṃyutam cāpam cakrāt śuddham ca śeṣayoḥ
translated: The arc together with half the circle is the true [value] from the circle; the remainder is for the two [values].

analyzed: sphuṭa vṛtta guṇām trijyām bhaktvā aśītyā sva koṭitaḥ
translated: The co-latitude of the true circle, divided by eighty, is its own cosine.

original: tyaktvā padeṣu yuktvā vā karṇaḥ prāgvat prasādhyate /🔽mandoccasiddhatanmadhyaviśleṣārdhasamanvitaḥ /
analyzed: tyaktvā padeṣu yuktvā vā karṇaḥ prāgvat prasādhyate
translated: Having subtracted it from the degrees, or having added it, the longitude is established as before.🔽The half of the difference between the true [value] and the [value] obtained by the slow [motion] method, together with the [value] obtained by the slow [motion] method,

original: mandasiddhe adhike hīne rahitaḥ madhyamaḥ grahaḥ //
analyzed: manda siddhe adhike hīne rahitaḥ madhyamaḥ grahaḥ
translated: is the middling planet, free from the excess or deficiency [of the true [value] and the [value] obtained by the slow [motion] method].

original: sa śīghroccāt punar sādhyaḥ siddhayoḥ antarālajam /
analyzed: sa śīghra uccāt punar sādhyaḥ siddhayoḥ antarāla jam
translated: That [longitude of the] quickly moving [planet] is again to be corrected, the interval from the [longitude of the] fixed [planet] being added.

analyzed: ardhīkṛtya sakṛt siddhe pūrvavat parikalpayet
translated: Having halved the fixed [planet] once, one should imagine it as before.

analyzed: evaṃkṛtasya bhūyas api manda siddhim samācaret
translated: Having done this, one should again perform the slow correction.

original: mandasiddhasya tasya ayam viśeṣaḥ yaḥ abhidhāsyate //
analyzed: manda siddhasya tasya ayam viśeṣaḥ yaḥ abhidhāsyate
translated: The special feature of that slow correction will be stated.

analyzed: dvi siddha manda siddhasya dvi siddhasya yat antaram
translated: The interval between the double correction and the slow correction, and between the double correction and the fixed [planet],

original: prāgvat tat madhyame kṛtvā śīghrasiddhaḥ sphuṭaḥ grahaḥ //
analyzed: prāgvat tat madhyame kṛtvā śīghra siddhaḥ sphuṭaḥ grahaḥ
translated: having made that the middle [longitude] as before, the quickly moving planet is clearly [to be corrected].

analyzed: mahābhāskarīyam
translated: This is the Great Bhāskara's [method].

analyzed: atra śani guru kuja grahaṇam śīghra ucca vat graha pratipādana artham
translated: Here, the mention of Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars is for the purpose of teaching the planets as if they were quickly moving [planets].

original: tena budhaśukrayoḥ api idam karma kriyate /🔽kakṣyāmaṇḍalalagnasvavṛttamadhye /
analyzed: tena budhaśukrayoḥ api idam karma kriyate
translated: Therefore, this operation is also performed for Mercury and Venus.🔽In the center of the circle of one's own [longitude] at the ascendant of the ecliptic circle.

analyzed: kakṣyā maṇḍale lagnam kakṣyā maṇḍala lagnam
translated: The ascendant of the ecliptic circle is the ascendant of the ecliptic circle.

analyzed: kim tat sva vṛtta madhyam
translated: What is that? The center of one's own [circle].

analyzed: sva vṛtta maṇḍala madhyam
translated: The center of one's own circle.

original: kakṣyāmaṇḍalalagnam ca tat svavṛttamadhyam ca kakṣyāmaṇḍalalagnasvavṛttamadhyam /
analyzed: kakṣyā maṇḍala lagnam ca tat sva vṛtta madhyam ca kakṣyā maṇḍala lagna sva vṛtta madhyam
translated: The ascendant of the ecliptic circle and that center of one's own [circle] are the center of one's own [circle] at the ascendant of the ecliptic circle.

analyzed: tasmin kakṣyā maṇḍala lagna sva vṛtta madhye
translated: In that center of one's own [circle] at the ascendant of the ecliptic circle.

analyzed: grahaḥ madhyaḥ
translated: The planet is the middle [longitude].

original: yaḥ asau madhyaḥ grahaḥ sa kakṣyāmaṇḍalalagnasvavṛttamadhye bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ asau madhyaḥ grahaḥ sa kakṣyā maṇḍala lagna sva vṛtta madhye bhavati
translated: That which is the middle planet is in the middle of the circle of the ecliptic.

original: etat uktam bhavati kakṣyāpratimaṇḍalayoḥ yatra sampātaḥ tatra yaḥ asau madhyamagrahaḥ /
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati kakṣyā pratimaṇḍalayoḥ yatra sampātaḥ tatra yaḥ asau madhyamagrahaḥ
translated: This is what is said: where there is a conjunction of the ecliptic and the circle of the zodiac, there is the middle planet.

analyzed: saḥ eva sphuṭaḥ iti
translated: That very one is the true one.

analyzed: graha sphuṭīkaraṇe anyeṣām mata pradarśanam
translated: The other teachers' opinion on the true planets

analyzed: atha anye anyathā vyākhyānam kurvanti
translated: Now others explain in a different way.

analyzed: anulomam gacchanti iti anulomagāni
translated: They go in the forward direction, so they are forward-moving.

analyzed: kāni vṛttāni
translated: Which ones? The circles.

analyzed: paridhayaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: the circumferences.

analyzed: mandāt
translated: From the slow [motion].

original: mandoccāt prabhṛti yāni mandoccavṛttāni mandoccāt ārabhya anulomam gacchanti /
analyzed: manda uccāt prabhṛti yāni manda ucca vṛttāni manda uccāt ārabhya anulomam gacchanti
translated: The slow-moving circles, starting from the slow-moving [motion], go in the forward direction.

original: yasmāt mandoccakendram ahar ahar upacīyate /🔽śīghrāt pratilomagāni /
analyzed: yasmāt manda uccaka indram ahar ahar upacīyate  śīghrāt pratiloma gāni
translated: Because the center of the slow-moving [motion] increases day by day.🔽The reverse-moving [circles] from the fast [motion].

original: śīghrāt śīghroccāt ārabhya yāni śīghroccavṛttāni tāni pratilomam gacchanti /
analyzed: śīghrāt śīghra uccāt ārabhya yāni śīghra ucca vṛttāni tāni pratilomam gacchanti
translated: The fast-moving circles, starting from the fast-moving [motion], go in the reverse direction.

analyzed: yasmāt śīghra uccaka indram ahar ahar apacīyate
translated: Because the center of the fast-moving [motion] decreases day by day.

original: atra idam praṣṭavyam katham vā mandoccakendram
analyzed: atra idam praṣṭavyam katham vā manda uccaka indram
translated: Here this should be asked: How does the center of the slow-moving [motion]

analyzed: ahar ahar upacīyate
translated: decrease day by day?

original: katham vā śīghroccakendram ahar ahar apacīyate iti /🔽ucyate grahāt patite mandocce mandakendrabhuktayaḥ upacīyante /
analyzed: katham vā śīghra uccaka indram ahar ahar apacīyate iti  ucyate grahāt patite manda ucce mandaka indra bhuktayaḥ upacīyante
translated: Or how does the ascending node of the sun decrease day by day?🔽It is said: When the slow ascending node falls from the planet, the degrees of the slow node are subtracted.

analyzed: grahāt patite śīghra ucce śīghraka indra bhuktayaḥ apacīyante
translated: When the fast ascending node falls from the planet, the degrees of the fast node are subtracted.

original: yadi evam grahāt śīghroccam na patati mahattvāt tarhi maṇḍalam prakṣipya pātyate iti /🔽tatra bhagaṇāḥ bhagaṇebhyaḥ viśodhyāḥ /
analyzed: yadi evam grahāt śīghra uccam na patati mahā tvāt tarhi maṇḍalam prakṣipya pātyate iti  tatra bhagaṇāḥ bhagaṇebhyaḥ viśodhyāḥ
translated: If it is so, then if the fast ascending node does not fall from the planet because of its greatness, it is made to fall by subtracting the circle.🔽There, the [planet's] degrees should be subtracted from the [planet's] degrees.

analyzed: rāśayaḥ rāśibhyaḥ
translated: The signs from the signs.

analyzed: bhāgāḥ bhāgebhyaḥ
translated: The parts from the parts.

analyzed: liptāḥ liptābhyaḥ iti eṣaḥ kramaḥ
translated: The minutes from the minutes. This is the order.

original: tatra grahabhagaṇebhyaḥ śīghroccabhagaṇāḥ eva tāvat na🔽śuddhyanti /
analyzed: tatra graha bhagaṇebhyaḥ śīghra ucca bhagaṇāḥ eva tāvat na  śuddhi anti
translated: There, the degrees of the fast ascending node are not subtracted from the degrees of the planet.

original: kutaḥ asau bhagaṇaḥ yam prakṣipya śīghroccam viśodhyate /
analyzed: kutas asau bhagaṇaḥ yam prakṣipya śīghra uccam viśodhyate
translated: How is that? From which circle is the fast ascending node subtracted?

original: tasmāt gaṇitayuktyā yāni api śīghravṛttāni tāni api anulomagāni eva /
analyzed: tasmāt gaṇita yuktyā yāni api śīghra vṛttāni tāni api anuloma gāni eva
translated: Therefore, even those circles that move fast are only direct.

original: ācāryeṇa tu karaṇalāghavārtham pratilomagāni vṛttāni iti uktam /
analyzed: ācāryeṇa tu karaṇa lāghava artham pratilomagāni vṛttāni iti uktam
translated: But the master [Varāhamihira] said that the circles move retrograde for the sake of simplicity in calculation.

analyzed: kim punar atra karaṇa lāghavam kāmacāraḥ
translated: What, then, is the simplicity in calculation here? It is freedom of action.

original: yadi grahaḥ śīghroccāt patati tadā grahaḥ śīghroccāt viśodhyate /
analyzed: yadi grahaḥ śīghra uccāt patati tadā grahaḥ śīghra uccāt viśodhyate
translated: If the planet falls from the ascensional difference, then the planet is subtracted from the ascensional difference.

original: yadā ca śīghroccam grahāt patati tadā grahāt śīghroccam viśodhyate iti /
analyzed: yadā ca śīghroccam grahāt patati tadā grahāt śīghroccam viśodhyate iti
translated: And when the ascensional difference falls from the planet, then the ascensional difference is subtracted from the planet.

analyzed: satyam eva etat
translated: This is indeed true.

analyzed: kintu jyā paridhi kalpanā vyabhicarati
translated: But the calculation of the sine and circumference is erroneous.

original: yadā grahāt śīghroccam🔽viśodhitam bhavati tadā anyathā jyā anyathā paridhiḥ /
analyzed: yadā grahāt śīghra uccam  viśodhitam bhavati tadā anyathā jyā anyathā paridhiḥ
translated: When the ascensional difference🔽is subtracted from the planet, then the sine is different, the circumference is different.

original: tadānīm eva śīghroccāt viśuddhe grahe anyathā jyā anyathā eva paridhiḥ /
analyzed: tadānīm eva śīghroccāt viśuddhe grahe anyathā jyā anyathā eva paridhiḥ
translated: At that very time, when the planet is purified from the ascensional difference, the sine is different, the circumference is exactly the same.

original: atha manyate śīghroccaviśuddhe grahe yat prathamapadam tat caturthapadam /🔽yat dvitīyapadam tat tṛtīyapadam /
analyzed: atha manyate śīghra ucca viśuddhe grahe yat prathama padam tat caturtha padam  yat dvitīyapadam tat tṛtīyapadam
translated: If it is thought that in the planet purified from the ascensional difference, the first term is the fourth term,🔽the second term is the third term,

analyzed: yat tṛtīyapadam tat dvitīyapadam
translated: the third term is the second term,

original: yat caturthapadam tat prathamapadam iti /🔽evam tarhi yat jyāyasī kalpanā /
analyzed: yat caturtha padam tat prathama padam iti  evam tarhi yat jyāyasī kalpanā
translated: and the fourth term is the first term.🔽If so, then which is the greater calculation?

original: tasmāt mandoccam grahāt viśodhyam /🔽grahaḥ ca śīghroccāt /
analyzed: tasmāt mandoccam grahāt viśodhyam  grahaḥ ca śīghra uccāt
translated: Therefore, the mean longitude should be subtracted from the planet.🔽And the planet from the ascensional difference.

analyzed: manda śīghra vṛttāni krama utkrameṇa eva gacchanti
translated: The motions of the slow and fast [planets] proceed in order and reverse order.

analyzed: kakṣyā maṇḍala lagnaḥ
translated: [It is] the ascendant of the ecliptic circle.

analyzed: kakṣyāyāḥ maṇḍalam kakṣyāmaṇḍalam
translated: The circle of the orbit is the circle of the orbit.

original: athavā kakṣyā ca sā maṇḍalam ca tat kakṣyāmaṇḍalam /
analyzed: athavā kakṣyā ca sā maṇḍalam ca tat kakṣyāmaṇḍalam
translated: Or, it is both an orbit and a circle, so it is the circle of the orbit.

analyzed: tena kakṣyā maṇḍalena lagnaḥ kakṣyā maṇḍala lagnaḥ
translated: The one that is joined to that circle of the orbit is the one joined to the circle of the orbit.

analyzed: kaḥ grahaḥ madhyaḥ
translated: Which one? The middle planet.

analyzed: sva vṛtta madhye
translated: In its own circle.

analyzed: svasya vṛttam svavṛttam
translated: Its own circle is its own circle.

original: tat ca sāmānyena mandavṛttam śīghravṛttam ca parigṛhyate /
analyzed: tat ca sāmānyena mandavṛttam śīghravṛttam ca parigṛhyate
translated: And that is generally taken to be the slow circle and the fast circle.

original: tasya svamandavṛttasya svaśīghravṛttasya ca madhyam svavṛttamadhyam /
analyzed: tasya sva manda vṛttasya sva śīghra vṛttasya ca madhyam sva vṛtta madhyam
translated: The middle of that, its own slow circle and its own fast circle, is the middle of its own circle.

analyzed: tatra grahasya madhyaḥ
translated: The middle of the planet is there.

analyzed: sa ca kakṣyā maṇḍala āsaktaḥ
translated: And that is joined to the circle of the orbit.

analyzed: sva vṛttasya kakṣyā maṇḍale
translated: In the circle of the orbit of its own circle,

original: yathā madhyam bhavati tathā badhnīyāt /🔽tasmin svavṛtte yathā kakṣyāmaṇḍale yathā madhyam bhavati tathā badhnīyāt /
analyzed: yathā madhyam bhavati tathā badhnīyāt  tasmin sva vṛtte yathā kakṣyā maṇḍale yathā madhyam bhavati tathā badhnīyāt
translated: it should be tied as if it were the middle.🔽In that own circle, it should be tied as if it were the middle in the circle of the orbit.

original: tasmin svavṛtte yathā kakṣyāmaṇḍale jyā avitiṣṭhate tathā eva avatiṣṭhamānā draṣṭavyā /
analyzed: tasmin svavṛtte yathā kakṣyāmaṇḍale jyā a vitiṣṭhate tathā eva avatiṣṭhamānā draṣṭavyā
translated: In that own circle, the chord should be placed as if it were in the circle of the orbit.

analyzed: katham yathā kakṣyā maṇḍalasya ṣaṇṇavati aṃśakā kāṣṭha jyā
translated: How? As the chord of the circle of the orbit is 96 units,

original: evam atra api ṣaṇṇavatyaṃśakā kāṣṭhajyā parikalpanīyā /
analyzed: evam atra api ṣaṇṇavati aṃśakā kāṣṭha jyā parikalpanīyā
translated: In the same way, here too, the sine of 90 - 60 = 30 degrees should be assumed to be 1/2.

original: tat yathā uccāt ārabhya bhujajyākoṭijyābhyām trairāśikam yadi ṣaṣṭiśatatrayaparidhau ime bhujajyākoṭijye /
analyzed: tat yathā uccāt ārabhya bhuja jyā koṭijyābhyām trairāśikam yadi ṣaṣṭi śata traya paridhau ime bhuja jyā koṭijye
translated: As follows: starting from the zenith, by the sine of the arc and the sine of the chord, the rule of three: if these are the sine of the arc and the sine of the chord on a circumference of 360 degrees,

analyzed: tadā ucca nīca paridhau
translated: then on a circumference of the zenith and nadir,

original: ke iti / athavā vyāsārdhena ime bhujajyākoṭijye /
analyzed: ke iti athavā vyāsa ardhena ime bhuja jyā koṭijye
translated: what are they? Or, these are the sine of the arc and the sine of the chord by the semi-diameter.

analyzed: tatas antya phala tulyena ucca nīca vṛtta vyāsa ardhena ke iti
translated: Then, by the semi-diameter of the circle of the zenith and nadir, which is equal to the final result, what are they?

analyzed: labdhe ucca nīca vṛttasya bhuja jyā koṭijye
translated: The sine of the arc and the sine of the chord of the circle of the zenith and nadir are obtained.

original: tatra prathamacaturthayoḥ padayoḥ vyāsārdhāt upari koṭisādhanam sthitam iti vyāsārdhe prakṣipyate /
analyzed: tatra prathama caturthayoḥ padayoḥ vyāsārdhāt upari koṭisādhanam sthitam iti vyāsārdhe prakṣipyate
translated: There, in the first and fourth terms, the calculation of the chord is above the semi-diameter, so it is subtracted from the semi-diameter.

original: dvitīyatṛtīyayoḥ padayoḥ vyāsārdhonam pravṛttam iti vyāsārdhāt apanīyate /
analyzed: dvitīya tṛtīyayoḥ padayoḥ vyāsa ardha ūnam pravṛttam iti vyāsa ardhāt apanīyate
translated: In the second and third terms, it is below the semi-diameter, so it is subtracted from the semi-diameter.

analyzed: evam koṭikā niṣpannā bhavati
translated: In this way, the chord is obtained.

analyzed: bhujā koṭi varga samāsa mūlam karṇaḥ
translated: The square root of the sum of the squares of the arc and the chord is the hypotenuse.

analyzed: evam manda śīghrayoḥ karṇa utpattiḥ
translated: In this way, the hypotenuse of the slow and fast [motions] is obtained.
The correction of Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars by the method of the circle of the zenith and nadir

analyzed: grahāṇām ṛṇa dhana pratipādanāya āha
translated: For the purpose of determining the debt and credit of the planets, it is said:

analyzed: kṣaya dhana dhana kṣayāḥ syuḥ manda uccāt vyatyayena śīghra uccāt
translated: [The results] of loss, gain, gain, and loss should be known from the slow culmination, in reverse order, and from the fast culmination.

original: śanigurukujeṣu mandāt ardham ṛṇam dhanam bhavati pūrve // //🔽kṣayadhanadhanakṣayāḥ /
analyzed: śani guru kujeṣu mandāt ardham ṛṇam dhanam bhavati pūrve  / kṣaya dhana dhana kṣayāḥ
translated: In the case of Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars, the debt and the gain are half [of the results from the slow culmination].🔽[The results] of loss, gain, gain, and loss.

original: kṣayaḥ ca dhanaḥ ca dhanaḥ ca kṣayaḥ ca kṣayadhanadhanakṣayāḥ /
analyzed: kṣayaḥ ca dhanaḥ ca dhanaḥ ca kṣayaḥ ca kṣaya dhana dhana kṣayāḥ
translated: Loss, gain, gain, and loss are the results of loss, gain, gain, and loss.

analyzed: ete kṣaya dhana dhana kṣayāḥ yathāsaṅkhyena padeṣu pratyetavyāḥ
translated: These results of loss, gain, gain, and loss should be known in the terms in order.

original: tat yathā prathame pade kṣayaḥ /🔽dvitīye pade dhanam /
analyzed: tat yathā prathame pade kṣayaḥ  dvitīye pade dhanam
translated: That is to say, in the first term there is loss.🔽In the second term there is gain.

analyzed: tṛtīye pade dhanam eva
translated: In the third term there is gain itself.

analyzed: caturthe pade kṣayaḥ iti
translated: In the fourth term there is loss.

analyzed: ayam kṣaya ādi kramaḥ
translated: This is the order of loss and so on.

original: padakramaḥ ca kasmāt parigṛhyate iti āha mandoccāt pravṛttāt grahāt /
analyzed: padakramaḥ ca kasmāt parigṛhyate iti āha manda uccāt pravṛttāt grahāt
translated: And why is the order of the terms accepted? It is said: from the slow culmination, the planet that has started.

original: kutaḥ / ucyate mandoccāt iyam pañcamī maryādābhidhāyinī /
analyzed: kutas ucyate manda uccāt iyam pañcamī maryādā abhidhāyinī
translated: From where? It is said: this fifth [term] is stated as a limit, from the slow culmination.

original: tataḥ mandoccāt iti anena mandoccāt pravṛttaḥ grahaḥ parigṛhyate /
analyzed: tatas mandoccāt iti anena mandoccāt pravṛttaḥ grahaḥ parigṛhyate
translated: From that, from the slow culmination, the planet that has started is accepted by this [expression].

original: sa katham mandoccāt pravṛttaḥ grahaḥ jñeyaḥ /
analyzed: sa katham manda uccāt pravṛttaḥ grahaḥ jñeyaḥ
translated: How should the planet that has started from the slow culmination be known?

original: ucyate na atra kiñcit api jñeyam /
analyzed: ucyate na atra kiñcid api jñeyam
translated: It is said: nothing at all should be known here.

original: yāvadbhiḥ mandoccāt adhikaḥ grahaḥ tavatā asau mandoccāt pravṛttaḥ grahaḥ jñeyaḥ /
analyzed: yāvadbhiḥ mandoccāt adhikaḥ grahaḥ tavatā asau mandoccāt pravṛttaḥ grahaḥ jñeyaḥ
translated: By as many degrees as a planet is above the mean distance, that planet is to be known as having started from the mean distance.

analyzed: tena tad parijñāna artham manda uccam grahāt pātyate
translated: Therefore, in order to know that, the mean distance is subtracted from the planet.

analyzed: tatra śeṣeṇa rāśi ādinā manda uccāt
translated: There, the remainder in signs and so on is

analyzed: pravṛttaḥ asau grahaḥ bhavati
translated: the distance from the mean distance that that planet has traveled.

original: tasmāt prathamapade yā kramajyā tasyāḥ phalam trairāśikena ānīyate /
analyzed: tasmāt prathama pade yā kramajyā tasyāḥ phalam trairāśikena ānīyate
translated: Therefore, the result of the arc sine of the sine of that [distance] in the first step is brought by the rule of three.

analyzed: yadi ṣaṣṭi śata traya paridheḥ iyam jyā
translated: If this is the sine of a circumference increased by three hundred and sixty,

original: tadā iṣṭagrahaparidheḥ kā iti phalam labhyate /
analyzed: tadā iṣṭa graha paridheḥ kā iti phalam labhyate
translated: then what is the result for the circumference of the desired planet? The result is obtained.

analyzed: etat eva trairāśikam
translated: This is the same rule of three.

analyzed: aśītiḥ
translated: The sine multiplied by eighty is the dividend.

analyzed: sva paridhi bhāgānām yathā ukta akṣara saṅkhyā
translated: The number of letters in the parts of one's own circumference is as stated.

analyzed: tena paridhinā guṇitajyāyāḥ aśītiḥ bhāgahāraḥ
translated: The sine multiplied by that circumference is the dividend, eighty.

analyzed: sva paridhi akṣara saṅkhyā guṇa kāraḥ
translated: The number of letters in one's own circumference is the multiplier.

analyzed: labdham phalam ṛṇam eva
translated: The obtained result is negative.

analyzed: dvitīya pade utkrameṇa jyā vyavasthitā iti
translated: In the second step, the sine is arranged in reverse order.

analyzed: utkrama jyā phalam dhanam
translated: The result of the reverse sine is positive.

original: punar tṛtīyapade krameṇa jyā vyavasthitā iti kramajyāphalam dhanam /
analyzed: punar tṛtīya pade krameṇa jyā vyavasthitā iti krama jyā phalam dhanam
translated: Again, in the third place, the sine is established in the order, so the result of the order sine is gain.

original: caturthe pade utkrameṇa jyā vyavasthitā iti utkramajyāphalam kṣayaḥ /
analyzed: caturthe pade utkrameṇa jyā vyavasthitā iti utkramajyā phalam kṣayaḥ
translated: In the fourth place, the sine is established in the reverse order, so the result of the reverse sine is loss.

analyzed: tatra prathama pade eva mandakendram
translated: There, in the first place itself, there is a central point of slow [motion].

original: tat utpannam eva phalam grahamadhye kṣayaḥ /
analyzed: tat utpannam eva phalam graha madhye kṣayaḥ
translated: That very result which arises is loss in the center of the planet.

original: yadā dvitīyapade kendram tadā prathamapadavyāsārdhajyotpannam aśeṣaphalam kṣayaḥ /
analyzed: yadā dvitīya pade kendram tadā prathama pada vyāsa ardha jyā utpannam aśeṣa phalam kṣayaḥ
translated: When there is a central point in the second place, then the entire result produced by the sine of the first place's semi-diameter is loss.

analyzed: dvitīya pada utkrama jyā phalam dhanam
translated: The result of the reverse sine of the second place is gain.

analyzed: prathama dvitīya padābhyām tṛtīya caturtha pade vyākhyāte
translated: The third and fourth places are explained by the first and second places.

original: athavā karaṇalāghavārtham evam kriyate prathamapade yat utpannam krameṇa jyāphalam kṣayaḥ /
analyzed: athavā karaṇa lāghava artham evam kriyate prathama pade yat utpannam krameṇa jyā phalam kṣayaḥ
translated: Or, this is done for the sake of ease of calculation: in the first place, the result of the sine which arises in order is loss.

original: dvitīyapade yat utpannam punar yat gatam rāśyādikam atītam prathamapadasaṃjñitarāśitrayāt
analyzed: dvitīya pade yat utpannam punar yat gatam rāśi ādikam atītam prathama pada saṃjñita rāśi trayāt
translated: In the second place, what arises again, and what has passed, that is, what has gone from the three signs called the first place,

original: kṣayātmakāt dhanātmakam tat dvitīyapadasya yat gatam tat viśodhya śeṣam tatra kṣayaḥ eva avatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: kṣayātmakāt dhanātmakam tat dvitīyapadasya yat gatam tat viśodhya śeṣam tatra kṣayaḥ eva avatiṣṭhate
translated: which is of the nature of loss, is of the nature of gain. What has gone from the second place, subtracting that, the remainder there remains as loss alone.

original: tena tat utpannam phalam madhyamagrahe kṣayaḥ /
analyzed: tena tat utpannam phalam madhyamagrahe kṣayaḥ
translated: Therefore, the result produced by that [is] the loss in the middle [sign].

original: evam dvitīyapadānte kṣayadhanayoḥ tulyatvāt na kiñcit avatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: evam dvitīya pada ante kṣaya dhanayoḥ tulya tvāt na kiñcid avatiṣṭhate
translated: Thus, at the end of the second term, since loss and gain are equal, nothing remains.

analyzed: tasmāt sāmarthyataḥ ayam arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, this meaning is understood by implication:

analyzed: saṃjātaḥ prathama pade gata jyā phalam kṣayaḥ
translated: The loss in the first term is the sine of the traversed [arc].

analyzed: dvitīya pade api āgata jyā phalam kṣayaḥ
translated: In the second term also, the loss is the sine of the traversed [arc].

original: etena mandakendraphalam meṣādike kṣayaḥ /🔽tat etat prathamapade gatam bhujāsaṃjñitam dvitīyapade anāgatam /
analyzed: etena mandaka indra phalam meṣa ādike kṣayaḥ  tat etat prathama pade gatam bhujāsaṃjñitam dvitīya pade anāgatam
translated: By this, the loss in Aries and so on is the slow central result.🔽That [loss] is traversed in the first term, called the sine, and not traversed in the second term.

analyzed: koṭi saṃjñitam prathama pade anāgatam dvitīya pade gatam
translated: That [gain] is traversed in the first term and not traversed in the second term.

analyzed: tṛtīya caturthayoḥ ca
translated: And in the third and fourth [terms].

analyzed: tṛtīya pade krama jyā phalam dhanam
translated: In the third term, the gain is the sine of the traversed [arc].

original: caturthapade tṛtīyapadarāśitrayāt dhanāt dhanasaṃjñitāt caturthapadarāśyādigatakṣayasaṃjñitam viśodhyate /
analyzed: caturtha pade tṛtīya pada rāśi trayāt dhanāt dhana saṃjñitāt caturtha pada rāśi ādi gata kṣaya saṃjñitam viśodhyate
translated: In the fourth term, the gain called the sine, which is the sum of the third term, is subtracted from the loss called the sine, which is in the fourth term and so on.

analyzed: śeṣam dhanam eva avatiṣṭhate evam
translated: The remainder is gain alone that remains.

original: caturthapadānte dhanakṣayayoḥ tulyatvāt na kiṃcit avaśiṣyate /
analyzed: caturthapadānte dhana kṣayayoḥ tulya tvāt na kiṃcid avaśiṣyate
translated: And thus, at the end of the fourth term, since gain and loss are equal, nothing remains.

original: tasmāt atra api sa eva arthaḥ tulādikendre bhujāphalam dhanam iti /
analyzed: tasmāt atra api sa eva arthaḥ tulādikendre bhujāphalam dhanam iti
translated: Therefore, here also the same meaning is to be understood: the result of the arm in the center of the scale, etc. is wealth.

analyzed: suṣṭhu khalu etat avagamyate
translated: This is indeed well understood.

original: yadi padeṣu sarveṣu tulyāḥ paridhayaḥ tadā evam syāt /
analyzed: yadi padeṣu sarveṣu tulyāḥ paridhayaḥ tadā evam syāt
translated: If the circumferences were the same in all the terms, then it would be so.

analyzed: na ca tulyāḥ paridhayaḥ paṭhyante
translated: But the circumferences are not read as the same.

original: atulyeṣu ca paridhiṣu pratimaṇḍalasya ca api avasthā virudhyate /
analyzed: atulyeṣu ca paridhiṣu pratimaṇḍalasya ca api avasthā virudhyate
translated: And in the case of unequal circumferences, the position of the gnomon is also contradicted.

analyzed: kutas prathama pade śukrasya catuṣkaḥ paridhiḥ
translated: Why? In the first term, the circumference of the sun is four.

analyzed: tatra dvitīya pada prāptau eva dvikaḥ paridhiḥ
translated: There, when it reaches the second term, the circumference is two.

analyzed: tatra ardhapahalam parihīyate
translated: There, half a hasta is lost.

analyzed: grahaḥ tu gacchan krameṇa gacchati
translated: But the planet moves in sequence as it moves.

analyzed: na hariṇa plutena
translated: Not by the leap of a deer.

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

analyzed: tulyāḥ paridhayaḥ
translated: The circumferences are the same.

original: nanu ca uktam na ca tulyāḥ paridhayaḥ paṭhyante
analyzed: nanu ca uktam na ca tulyāḥ paridhayaḥ paṭhyante
translated: But was it not said that the circumferences are not read as the same?

analyzed: iti na etat asti
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: evam vijñāyate ete paridhayaḥ upacaya apacaya ātmakāḥ
translated: It is understood in this way: these circumferences have the nature of increase and decrease.

analyzed: yatas tena tulya upacaya apacaya ātmaka tvāt krama utkrama vyavasthāyāḥ
translated: Because of that, they are said to be the same, because of the nature of equal increase and decrease, of the arrangement in sequence and out of sequence.

analyzed: yatas te eva bhavanti iti
translated: Because they are just those.

analyzed: tena tulyāḥ ucyante
translated: By that, they are said to be the same.

original: tat yathā prathamapade kramajyām paridhyantareṇa hatvā vyāsārdhena labdham ūne viṣamapadaparidhau prakṣipyate /🔽adhike apanīyate /
analyzed: tat yathā prathama pade krama jyām paridhi antareṇa hatvā vyāsa ardhena labdham ūne viṣama pada paridhau prakṣipyate  adhike apanīyate
translated: For example, the arc sine of the chord of the first interval multiplied by the semi-diameter and divided by the unequal interval of the chord is subtracted if it is less, and added if it is greater.

analyzed: prathama dvitīya padābhyām tṛtīya caturtha pade vyākhyāte
translated: The third and fourth intervals are explained by the first and second intervals.

analyzed: vyatyayena śīghra uccāt
translated: [The result] is reversed from the ascending node.

analyzed: śīghra uccaka indrāt pada vaśāt krama utkrama jyā phalam viparītam
translated: The product of the arc sine of the chord of the ascending node and the interval, reversed, is the [result].

analyzed: prathama caturthayoḥ padayoḥ dhanam
translated: In the first and fourth intervals, there is gain.

analyzed: dvitīya tṛtīyayoḥ kṣayaḥ iti viparyayaḥ
translated: In the second and third intervals, there is loss. This is the reverse.

original: athavā bhujāphalam śīghrakrameṇa ānītam meṣādau dhanam /
analyzed: athavā bhujāphalam śīghrakrameṇa ānītam meṣa ādau dhanam
translated: Or, the product of the semi-diameter and the sine of the ascending node, brought to Aries, is gain.

analyzed: tulādāvṛṇam
translated: In Libra, it is loss.

analyzed: paridhi cālana ādi aśeṣam pūrvavat eva
translated: The rest, such as the motion of the circle, is exactly the same as before.

original: atra śīghraphalam vyāsārdhena saṃguṇayya tat utpannakrarṇena bhāgalabdham phalam dhanam ṛṇam vā /
analyzed: atra śīghra phalam vyāsa ardhena saṃguṇayya tat bhāga labdham phalam dhanam ṛṇam vā
translated: Here, the product of the result of the sine [of the arc] and the semi-diameter, divided by the sine [of the arc] thus produced, is the result, gain or loss.

original: etat ca karma trairāśikam yadi vyāsārdhamaṇḍale idam phalam
analyzed: etat ca karma trairāśikam yadi vyāsa ardha maṇḍale idam phalam
translated: And this operation is a triple proportion: if this result is obtained in the circle of the semi-diameter,

original: labhyate / tadā śīghroccakarṇamaṇḍale kiyat iti vyastatrairāśikena vyāsārdham guṇakāraḥ /
analyzed: labhyate tadā śīghra ucca karṇa maṇḍale kiyat iti vyasta trairāśikena vyāsa ardham guṇakāraḥ
translated: then in the circle of the sine of the ascending node, what is it? By the reverse triple proportion, the semi-diameter is the multiplier.

analyzed: karṇaḥ bhāgahāraḥ
translated: The [great] arc is the dividend.

analyzed: atra kim iti vyasta trairāśikam
translated: Here, why is the [great] arc the dividend in the reverse [triplet] ?

original: ucyate alpe hi maṇḍale alpāḥ mahati mahāntaḥ ca rāśayaḥ jñeyāḥ kālakriyā / iti anena /
analyzed: ucyate alpe hi maṇḍale alpāḥ mahati mahāntaḥ ca rāśayaḥ jñeyāḥ kālakriyā iti anena
translated: It is said: because it is to be known that in a small circle the [great] arcs are small, and in a large circle they are large.

original: atha mandoccaphalam evam kasmāt na kriyate /
analyzed: atha manda ucca phalam evam kasmāt na kriyate
translated: Then, why is the result of the mean anomaly not done in the same way?

original: ucyate kriyamāṇe api tāvat eva tat phalam bhavati iti na kriyate /
analyzed: ucyate kriyamāṇe api tāvat eva tat phalam bhavati iti na kriyate
translated: It is said: even if it is done, that result is the same, so it is not done.

original: kutaḥ / mandoccakarṇaḥ aviśiṣyate /🔽tatra ca aviśeṣitena phalena vyāsārdham saṃguṇayya karṇena bhāge hṛte pūrvam
analyzed: kutas manda ucca karṇaḥ a viśiṣyate  tatra ca aviśeṣitena phalena vyāsa ardham saṃguṇayya karṇena bhāge hṛte pūrvam
translated: Why? Because the mean anomaly is not distinguished.

analyzed: ānītam eva phalam bhavati iti
translated: And there, the result, which is not distinguished, is multiplied by the semi-diameter, and when divided by the [great] arc, it becomes the same result as before.

original: atha kim iti śīghroccakarṇaḥ na aviśiṣyate /
analyzed: atha kim iti śīghra ucca karṇaḥ na a viśiṣyate
translated: Then, why is the [great] arc of the true anomaly not distinguished?

analyzed: abhāvāt a viśeṣa karmaṇaḥ
translated: Because there is no operation of distinction.

original: atha atra idam praṣṭavyam kakṣyāmaṇḍalasya yathā svayojanakarṇaḥ vyāsārdhaḥ /
analyzed: atha atra idam praṣṭavyam kakṣyāmaṇḍalasya yathā sva yojana karṇaḥ vyāsa ardhaḥ
translated: Now, this should be asked here: just as the semi-diameter is the [great] arc of the ecliptic circle,

analyzed: tat ca sva liptābhiḥ mīyamānaḥ vasu agni vedarāmāḥ
translated: and that, being measured by its own degrees, is 360,

original: pratimaṇḍalasya api etat eva vyāsārdham iti etat /
analyzed: pratimaṇḍalasya api etat eva vyāsārdham iti etat
translated: the same is the semi-diameter of the [true] anomaly circle.

analyzed: kakṣyā maṇḍala utpanna jyā phala liptābhiḥ trairāśika abhāvaḥ
translated: The absence of the triplet is by the degrees of the result of the sine of the ecliptic circle.

analyzed: kakṣyā pratimaṇḍalayoḥ tulya vyāsa ardha tvāt
translated: Because the circumference and the reflected circle have the same radius.

analyzed: atha manyate tad kāla utpanna bhujā koṭi niṣpanna karṇaḥ vyāsa ardham prati maṇḍalasya
translated: If it is thought that the radius of the reflected circle is obtained by multiplying the radius at that time by the sine,

analyzed: tena trairāśikā upapattiḥ
translated: then the method of the triple proportion is justified.

analyzed: evam tarhi na kakṣyā maṇḍala tulyam pratimaṇḍalam
translated: If so, then the reflected circle is not equal to the ecliptic circle.

original: iti / atra ucyate caturthapadādau kakṣyāpratimaṇḍale tulye /
analyzed: iti atra ucyate caturtha pada ādau kakṣyā pratimaṇḍale tulye
translated: To this it is said that at the beginning of the fourth part, the ecliptic and the reflected circle are equal.

analyzed: tena kakṣyā pratimaṇḍalayoḥ tulyam vyāsa ardham
translated: Therefore, the ecliptic and the reflected circle have the same radius.

analyzed: tatas prabhṛti pratimaṇḍala vyāsa ardham krameṇa upacīyate
translated: From then on, the radius of the reflected circle decreases gradually.

original: evam krameṇa upacīyamānam uccatulyagrahe svoccavṛttaviṣkambhārdham upacitam bhavati /
analyzed: evam krameṇa upacīyamānam ucca tulya grahe sva ucca vṛtta viṣkambha ardham upacitam bhavati
translated: In this way, when it decreases gradually, the radius of the exaltation circle is increased to the same as the radius of the ecliptic circle.

original: tat eva prathamapadādau prabhṛti utkrameṇa apacīyamānam prathamapadānte vyāsārdham eva bhavati /
analyzed: tat eva prathama pada ādau prabhṛti utkrameṇa apacīyamānam prathama pada ante vyāsārdham eva bhavati
translated: That same [radius] decreases gradually from the beginning of the first part, and at the end of the first part it becomes the same as the radius.

original: evam krameṇa apacīyamānam dvitīyapadānte uccavṛttaviṣkambhārdham apacitam bhavati / tṛtīye
analyzed: evam krameṇa apacīyamānam dvitīya pada ante ucca vṛtta viṣkambha ardham apacitam bhavati tṛtīye
translated: In this way, when it decreases gradually, at the end of the second part it becomes the same as the radius of the exaltation circle. At the end of the third part,

original: padānte ca utkrameṇa upacīyamānam iti etat kakṣyāmaṇḍalavyāsārdham eva /
analyzed: pada ante ca utkrameṇa upacīyamānam iti etat kakṣyā maṇḍala vyāsa ardham eva
translated: it increases gradually, and this is the same as the radius of the ecliptic circle.

original: grahasya uccanīcagatikramāt upacayāpacayātmakam bhavati iti ataḥ pratimaṇḍalasya upadeśaḥ /
analyzed: grahasya ucca nīca gati kramāt upacaya apacaya ātmakam bhavati iti atas pratimaṇḍalasya upadeśaḥ
translated: Because the increase and decrease of a planet occurs from the sequence of its high and low motions, therefore the sub-orbs are taught.

original: ghanabhūmadhyāt eva grahasya uccanīcaparijñānam iti ataḥ vyāsārdham eva koṭiphalena upacīyate apacīyate vā /
analyzed: ghana bhū madhyāt eva grahasya ucca nīca parijñānam iti atas vyāsārdham eva koṭi phalena upacīyate apacīyate vā
translated: The knowledge of a planet's high and low points is from the center of the dense earth itself, therefore the semi-diameter is added to or subtracted from the result of the apex.

original: atha yadi pratimaṇḍalamadhyāt vyāsārdhasya vṛddhihrāsau syātām /
analyzed: atha yadi prati maṇḍala madhyāt vyāsa ardhasya vṛddhi hrāsau syātām
translated: Now, if the semi-diameter would have increase and decrease from the center of the sub-orb,

analyzed: tadā tṛtīyam maṇḍalam parikalpayitavyam syāt
translated: then a third orb would have to be imagined.

analyzed: ghana bhū madhyāt karṇasya upacaya apacayau
translated: The increase and decrease of the hypotenuse is from the center of the dense earth.

analyzed: tena tad karṇena
translated: By that hypotenuse,

analyzed: vyasta trairāśika upapattiḥ iti
translated: the proof by the reverse-triplet is obtained.

analyzed: etat gaṇita nyāya siddham eva  śani guru kujeṣu
translated: This is established by the principles of mathematics.🔽Among Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars.

original: śaniḥ ca guruḥ ca kujaḥ ca śanigurukujāḥ /
analyzed: śaniḥ ca guruḥ ca kujaḥ ca śani guru kujāḥ
translated: Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars are Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars.

original: ataḥ teṣu śanigurukujeṣu mandāt mandoccāt prabhṛti yat phalam upapadyate tat ardham ṛṇam dhanam vā bhavati /
analyzed: atas teṣu śani guru kujeṣu mandāt manda uccāt prabhṛti yat phalam upapadyate tat ardham ṛṇam dhanam vā bhavati
translated: Therefore, among those Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars, the result that occurs from the slow motion, from the slow apogee, is half the debt or wealth.

analyzed: pūrve pūrva karmaṇi
translated: In the previous action.

analyzed: mandāt prabhṛti iti
translated: From the slow motion.

original: śīghrāt api ca yat phalam tat teṣu ardham kriyate prathame śīghrakarmaṇi /
analyzed: śīghrāt api ca yat phalam tat teṣu ardham kriyate prathame śīghrakarmaṇi
translated: And the result of the [longitude of the] sun is made half of that in the first swift [longitude].

original: anyatra dvitīyakarmaṇi mandaśīghrayoḥ sakalaphalam iti arthāt avasīyate /
analyzed: anyatra dvitīya karmaṇi manda śīghrayoḥ sakala phalam iti arthāt avasīyate
translated: It is understood that in the other [longitude], the second [longitude], the result of the slow and swift [longitudes] is the full result.

original: mandaśīghraphalāni kāṣṭhāni ṛṇam dhanam vā parikalpyate /🔽yataḥ kāṣṭhena grahaḥ
analyzed: mandaśīghraphalāni kāṣṭhāni ṛṇam dhanam vā parikalpyate  yatas kāṣṭhena grahaḥ
translated: The results of the slow and swift [longitudes] are considered to be debt or wealth.

original: bhramati / tat phalam kva ṛṇam kva vā dhanam iti śanigurukujeṣu /
analyzed: bhramati tat phalam kva ṛṇam kva vā dhanam iti śani guru kujeṣu
translated: Because the planet moves by the [longitude of the] sun, where is the result, where is the debt, and where is the wealth in Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars?

analyzed: atra śani guru kujāḥ madhyamāḥ eva parigṛhyante
translated: Here, Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars are taken to be only the mean [longitudes].

analyzed: kutas madhyamasya sphuṭīkaraṇa upāya tvāt
translated: Why? Because the mean [longitude] is a means of clarification.

analyzed: tadā hi ete sphuṭībhavanti
translated: For then they become clear.

original: yadi etat karma śanigurukujeṣu madhyameṣu kriyate /
analyzed: yadi etat karma śani guru kujeṣu madhyameṣu kriyate
translated: If this [longitude of the] sun is made in Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars, which are the mean [longitudes],

original: mandoccaphalārdhena madhyame ṛṇadhane kṛte tasya ṛṇadhanīkṛtasya madhyamatvam hīyate /
analyzed: manda ucca phala ardhena madhyame ṛṇa dhane kṛte tasya ṛṇa dhanīkṛtasya madhyama tvam hīyate
translated: when debt and wealth are made in the mean [longitude] by half the result of the highest point of the slow [longitude], the meanness of that debt and wealth that have been made is lost.

analyzed: atas śīghra ucca phala cāpa ardhasya avikṛta madhyame dhana ṛṇe prāpnutaḥ
translated: Therefore, the debt and wealth in the mean [longitude], which is not modified by half the arc of the result of the highest point of the swift [longitude], should be obtained.

analyzed: na etat asti
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: eva bhaviṣyati
translated: It will be made into debt and wealth by half the arc of the result of the highest point of the slow [longitude].

original: kutaḥ / ekadeśavikṛtam ananyavat bhavati iti aṣṭādhyāyī /
analyzed: kutas eka deśa vikṛtam ananyavat bhavati iti aṣṭādhyāyī
translated: Why? Because a modification of a part is like something else, as stated in the Aṣṭādhyāyī.
The Pātañjala Mahābhāṣya says that even a modification of a part is only in the middle.

original: yathā devakattaḥ svalaṅkṛtaḥ api svam ākhyānam
analyzed: yathā devakattaḥ su alaṅkṛtaḥ api svam ākhyānam
translated: Just as a god-made [image] is not abandoned even by the cutting off of the ears and nose, although well-adorned.

original: na jahāti / na ca karṇanāsāvacchedena api /
analyzed: na jahāti na ca karṇa nāsā avacchedena api
translated: And not even by the cutting off of the ears and nose.

analyzed: evam atra api
translated: So it is here also.

original: dve karmaṇī tatra tatra eva madhyame kriyete /
analyzed: dve karmaṇī tatra tatra eva madhyame kriyete
translated: The two actions are performed there and there in the middle.

original: athavā prathamamadhyamāt mandoccāyātam phalārdham madhyamotpannatvāt madhyame kriyate /
analyzed: athavā prathama madhyamāt manda ucca āyātam phala ardham madhyama utpanna tvāt madhyame kriyate
translated: Or, the half-result coming from the slow-rising [planet] from the first and middle [planets] is made in the middle because it is produced from the middle.

original: yat punar śīghroccāyātam sakṛtsaṃskṛtāt phalārdham tat sakṛtsaṃskṛtāyātam eva iti kṛtvā sakṛtsaṃskṛtaḥ eva kriyate /
analyzed: yat punar śīghra ucca āyātam sakṛt saṃskṛtāt phala ardham tat sakṛt saṃskṛta āyātam eva iti kṛtvā sakṛt saṃskṛtaḥ eva kriyate
translated: And that half-result coming from the quick-rising [planet] from the once-modified [planet] is made in the once-modified [planet] itself, considering that it comes from the once-modified [planet] itself.

original: tasmāt dvikarmasaṃsiddhāt mandoccaphalam tat sakalam eva madhyame grahe kriyate /
analyzed: tasmāt dvi karma saṃsiddhāt manda ucca phalam tat sakalam eva madhyame grahe kriyate
translated: Therefore, the entire result of the slow-rising [planet] from the one accomplished by the two actions is made in the middle planet.

analyzed: sa sphuṭa madhyamaḥ bhavati
translated: That is the true middle [planet].

original: atha idam praṣṭavyam yat etat dvikarmasiddhamandoccāyātam tat dvikarmasaṃsiddhe eva kasmāt na kriyate /
analyzed: atha idam praṣṭavyam yat etat dvi karma siddha manda uccāyātam tat dvi karma saṃsiddhe eva kasmāt na kriyate
translated: Now this should be asked: Why is that which comes from the slow-rising [planet] accomplished by the two actions not made in the one accomplished by the two actions itself?

analyzed: ucyate manda uccāt sphuṭa madhyāḥ kālakriyā
translated: It is said: The true [longitude] is made from the mean [longitude] of the slow [motion].

analyzed: iti madhyame kriyate
translated: Thus, it is made in the mean [longitude].

original: nanu ca dvikarmasiddhaḥ api madhyamaḥ eva /
analyzed: nanu ca dvi karma siddhaḥ api madhyamaḥ eva
translated: But is not the mean [longitude] also established by the two [methods]?

original: kutaḥ / ekadeśavikṛtam ananyavat bhavati iti vacanāt /
analyzed: kutas eka deśa vikṛtam ananyavat bhavati iti vacanāt
translated: Because of the statement a part modified is as if not modified.

analyzed: evam tarhi siddhe
translated: If so, then it is established.

original: punar sphuṭamadhyamagrahaṇam kurvan ācāryaḥ jñāpayati avikṛtamadhyaḥ iti /
analyzed: punar sphuṭa madhyama grahaṇam kurvan ācāryaḥ jñāpayati avikṛta madhyaḥ iti
translated: The teacher, by again making the statement true mean [longitude], indicates that it is unmodified.

analyzed: anyathā hi sphuṭa madhyama grahaṇam atiricyate
translated: Otherwise, the statement true mean [longitude] would be redundant.

analyzed: tasmāt dvitīya phalam
translated: Therefore, the result of the second [method],

original: mandoccāyātam tat sakalam eva madhyame grahe kriyate /
analyzed: manda ucca āyātam tat sakalam eva madhyame grahe kriyate
translated: which comes from the slow [motion], is made entirely in the mean [longitude].

analyzed: śīghra uccāt ca sphuṭāḥ jñeyāḥ iti
translated: And the true [longitude] should be known from the fast [motion].

original: sa evaṃkṛte sphuṭamadhyamaḥ śīghroccakarmaṇā sphuṭaḥ bhavati iti sphuṭamadhyame śīghroccaphaladhanuḥ sakalam kriyate /
analyzed: saḥ evaṃkṛte sphuṭamadhyamaḥ śīghra ucca karmaṇā sphuṭaḥ bhavati iti sphuṭamadhyame śīghra ucca phaladhanuḥ sakalam kriyate
translated: When it is made in this way, that true mean [longitude] becomes true by the operation of the fast [motion]. Therefore, the arc of the result of the fast [motion] in the true mean [longitude] is made entirely.

analyzed: sphuṭaḥ bhavati
translated: It becomes true.

original: ṛṇadhanayuktipradarśanārtham vyāsārdhatulyena karkaṭakena samāyāmavanau samavṛttamaṇḍalam ālikhya mātṛpitṛrekhām kuryāt /
analyzed: ṛṇa dhana yukti pradarśana artham vyāsa ardha tulyena karkaṭakena samāyām avanau sama vṛtta maṇḍalam ālikhya mātṛ pitṛ rekhām kuryāt
translated: In order to show the method of debt and credit, one should draw a circle on the ground with a diameter equal to the semimajor axis, and make the lines of the mother and father.

analyzed: tat kakṣyā maṇḍalam rāśi jyā rekhā viracitam
translated: That is the circle of the zodiac, constructed with the ecliptic and the zodiacal signs.

original: tanmaṇḍalakendrāt yāvatyaḥ abhīṣṭagrahāntyaphalaliptāḥ tāvati antare ca dakṣiṇena kendram kṛtvā vyāsārdhatulyena eva karkaṭakena tathā eva
analyzed: tad maṇḍala kendrāt yāvatyaḥ abhīṣṭa graha antya phala liptāḥ tāvati antare ca dakṣiṇena kendram kṛtvā vyāsa ardha tulyena eva karkaṭakena tathā eva
translated: From the center of that circle, as many degrees as there are in the final result of the desired planet, to that extent on the south side, making the center, with a gnomon equal to the semi-diameter, in the same way

analyzed: sama vṛtta maṇḍalam ālikhet
translated: one should draw a circle with an equal circumference.

analyzed: tat pratimaṇḍalam
translated: That is the counter-circle.

original: kakṣyāmaṇḍalāt yāvadbhiḥ pratimaṇḍalam niṣkrāntam tāvatā vyāsārdhena
analyzed: kakṣyāmaṇḍalāt yāvadbhiḥ pratimaṇḍalam niṣkrāntam tāvatā vyāsārdhena
translated: As far as the counter-circle has emerged from the circle of the zodiac, with that semi-diameter,

original: kakṣyāmaṇḍaladakṣiṇottararekhāsaṃpāte kendram kṛtvā ubhayatra vṛttadvayam ālikhyate /
analyzed: kakṣyā maṇḍala dakṣiṇa uttara rekhā saṃpāte kendram kṛtvā ubhayatra vṛtta dvayam ālikhyate
translated: making the center at the intersection of the south and north lines of the circle of the zodiac, two circles are drawn on both sides.

analyzed: te nīca ucca vṛtte
translated: Those are the lower and upper circles.

original: tayoḥ yathā kakṣyāmaṇḍale rāśijyāvikalpaḥ tathā karaṇīyam /
analyzed: tayoḥ yathā kakṣyā maṇḍale rāśi jyā vikalpaḥ tathā karaṇīyam
translated: The calculation of the signs and chords on the circle of the zodiac should be done in the same way.

original: prathamacaturthayoḥ padayoḥ kakṣyāmaṇḍalāt uparisthitatvāt pratimaṇḍalasya vyāsārdhe koṭisādhanam prakṣipya karṇaḥ kṛtaḥ /

analyzed: tāvat pramāṇam sūtram pratimaṇḍala paridhim yatra spṛśati tatra sthāne sphuṭaḥ grahaḥ
