translated: The gods, situated to the north of Meru, see the northern half of the celestial sphere, clockwise, in a clockwise motion.

original: dvitīyam ardham dakṣiṇam jyotiścakrasya apasavyam apradakṣiṇagatim baḍavāmukhasthitāḥ pretāḥ paśyanti /
analyzed: dvitīyam ardham dakṣiṇam jyotiścakrasya apasavyam apradakṣiṇagatim baḍavāmukha sthitāḥ pretāḥ paśyanti
translated: The second half of the southern celestial sphere is seen by the ghosts situated in the mouth of the mare in an anticlockwise direction, i.e., in a clockwise direction.

analyzed: sthala jala sandhau sthitvā etat ācāryaḥ pratipādayati
translated: The teacher explains this by standing at the junction of land and water.

analyzed: tad apekṣayā hi merubaḍavāmukhayoḥ uttaradakṣiṇa tvam
translated: For in relation to that, Meru and the mouth of the mare are in the north and south.

analyzed: na meru baḍavāmukha sthānām diś niyamaḥ asti
translated: There is no restriction of direction for those situated at Meru and the mouth of the mare.

analyzed: sūrya gati apekṣayā prācya ādi vyavahāraḥ
translated: The convention of east, etc., is based on the motion of the sun.

analyzed: yatra vivasvān udeti sā prācī
translated: Where the sun rises, that is the east.

analyzed: yatra astam eti sā pratīcī
translated: Where it sets, that is the west.

analyzed: na tathā meru baḍavāmukha sthānām api
translated: Not so for those situated at Meru and the mouth of the mare.

analyzed: paritas sarvatra raveḥ udaya astamaya sambhavāt
translated: Because the sun rises and sets everywhere around.

analyzed: deśa antara vyavadhānāt anyathā bha cakra ardha darśanam bhavati
translated: The appearance of half the celestial sphere is different due to being obstructed by other lands.

original: kaścit puruṣaḥ uttareṇa gataḥ deśāntaram eti tathātve dhruvam upari ārohitam paśyati /
analyzed: kaścid puruṣaḥ uttareṇa gataḥ deśāntaram eti tathātve dhruvam upari ārohitam paśyati
translated: A certain person, having gone north, goes to another land. In that case, he sees the pole star above.

original: krameṇa merum prāptasya upari dhruvaḥ bhavati /
analyzed: krameṇa merum prāptasya upari dhruvaḥ bhavati
translated: Gradually, when he reaches Meru, the pole star is above him.

analyzed: meroḥ uttareṇa dakṣiṇena dhruvaḥ avalambate
translated: The pole star rests to the north and south of Meru.

original: etat uttarāyaḥśalākāgrasvastikam upari nidhāya dakṣiṇāyaḥśalākāgrasvastikam ca adhomukham nidhāya darśayet /
analyzed: etat uttara ayaḥśalākā agrasvastikam upari nidhāya dakṣiṇa ayaḥśalākā agrasvastikam ca adhomukham nidhāya darśayet
translated: Having placed the upper right-angled cross-piece on the northern side, and the lower right-angled cross-piece on the southern side facing downwards, he should show [the cross-piece].

original: tathā laṅkāsthasya yaḥ viṣuvat mārgapradeśaḥ pūrvāparaḥ pratibhāsate sa merusthānām kṣitijāsaktaḥ
analyzed: tathā laṅkā sthasya yaḥ viṣuvat mārga pradeśaḥ pūrvāparaḥ pratibhāsate sa merusthānām kṣitija āsaktaḥ
translated: In the same way, the region of the equinoctial path that appears to be east and west to one in Lanka is on the horizon for those on Meru.

original: evam baḍavāmukhasthānām api cakravat bhāskaraḥ pratibhāsate // //
analyzed: evam baḍavāmukha sthānām api cakra vat bhāskaraḥ pratibhāsate  /
translated: In the same way, the sun appears to those on the mouth of the mare as if it were a wheel.

analyzed: deva asura pitṛ narāṇām dina pramāṇam
translated: The measure of the day for gods, demons, ancestors, and humans.

original: merubaḍavāmukhasthāḥ kiyantam kālam ravim paśyanti iti āha 🔽ravivarṣārdham devāḥ paśyanti uditam ravim tathā pretāḥ /
analyzed: merubaḍavāmukha sthāḥ kiyantam kālam ravim paśyanti iti āha  ravivarṣārdham devāḥ paśyanti uditam ravim tathā pretāḥ
translated: How long do those dwelling on Meru and the mouth of the mare see the sun? It is said:🔽The gods see the risen sun for half a solar year, and likewise the pretas.

analyzed: śaśi māsa ardham pitaraḥ śaśi gāḥ
translated: The ancestors who are in the moon [see it] for half a lunar month.

analyzed: ku dina ardham iha manujāḥ
translated: For half a human month here on earth.

original: devāḥ merunivāsinaḥ meṣādiṣu ṣaṭsu rāśiṣu samudgatam sūryam ravivarṣārdham paśyanti ṣaṇmāsān yāvat iti arthaḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ meru nivāsinaḥ meṣa ādiṣu ṣaṭsu rāśiṣu samudgatam sūryam ravi varṣārdham paśyanti ṣaṣ māsān yāvat iti arthaḥ
translated: The gods dwelling on Meru see the sun rising in the six signs beginning with Aries for half a solar year, meaning for six months.

original: pradakṣiṇam cakravat bhramantam kṣitijāsaktam krameṇa caturviṃśatikrāntibhāgān yāvat parityaktakṣitijam paśyanti /
analyzed: pradakṣiṇam cakra vat bhramantam kṣitija āsaktam krameṇa caturviṃśati krānti bhāgān yāvat parityakta kṣitijam paśyanti
translated: They see the sun, which moves like a wheel, turning to the right, gradually abandoning the ecliptic, until it has passed through twenty-four signs.

original: evam pretāḥ api ravivarṣārdham eva sakṛt udgatam sūryam paśyanti dakṣiṇagole ṣaṭsu rāśiṣu /
analyzed: evam pretāḥ api ravi varṣārdham eva sakṛt udgatam sūryam paśyanti dakṣiṇagole ṣaṭsu rāśiṣu
translated: In the same way, the departed spirits see the sun, which has risen once, for half a year, in the southern hemisphere, in six signs.

analyzed: śaśi māsa ardham pitaraḥ śaśi gāḥ
translated: The ancestors, who are in the moon, for half a lunar month.

analyzed: śaśinam gacchanti iti śaśigāḥ
translated: They go to the moon, therefore they are in the moon.

original: candralokanivāsinaḥ pitaraḥ śaśinaḥ māsārdham pañcadaśatithayaḥ etāvantam kālam paśyanti /
analyzed: candra loka nivāsinaḥ pitaraḥ śaśinaḥ māsa ardham pañcadaśa tithayaḥ etāvantam kālam paśyanti
translated: The ancestors, who dwell in the lunar sphere, see the moon for half a lunar month, for fifteen lunar days.

analyzed: pitṝṇām amāvāsyāyām upari savitā bhavati
translated: For the ancestors, the sun is above at new moon.

analyzed: tat teṣām ahar madhyam
translated: That is their midday.

original: tataḥ yathā yathā savitā pratipadādiṣu parataḥ avalambate tathā tathā pitṝṇām madhyāhnottarabhāgaḥ /
analyzed: tatas yathā yathā savitā pratipad ādiṣu paratas avalambate tathā tathā pitṝṇām madhyāhna uttara bhāgaḥ
translated: Then, as the sun moves further and further to the west from the first lunar day and so on, so the afternoon of the ancestors increases.

analyzed: rāśi traya antaritaḥ astam eti
translated: It sets, separated by three signs.

analyzed: astamitaḥ pakṣeṇa rāśi ṣaṣ antaritaḥ prācyām udeti
translated: Having set, it rises in the east, separated by six signs in a fortnight.

analyzed: ataḥ teṣām pakṣaḥ ahaḥ
translated: Therefore, a fortnight is a day for them.

analyzed: pakṣaḥ rātriḥ iti
translated: A fortnight is a night.

analyzed: ku dina ardham iha manujāḥ
translated: For humans here, half a ku-day.

analyzed: ku dinam bhū dinam ravi udayāt ravi udayam yāvat
translated: A bad day is a day of the earth, from sunrise to sunrise.

analyzed: tad ardham iha manujāḥ paśyanti
translated: Here, humans see half of that.

original: sarvam yathāvat sthitam gole pradarśayet iti // //
analyzed: sarvam yathāvat sthitam gole pradarśayet iti
translated: One should display everything as it is on the globe.

analyzed: kha gole kṣitija maṇḍalam
translated: The horizon circle on the celestial globe

analyzed: kha gole kṣitija maṇḍala pradarśanāya āha
translated: To show the horizon circle on the celestial globe, it is said:

original: pūrvāparam adhaūrdhvam maṇḍalam atha dakṣiṇottaram ca eva /
analyzed: pūrva aparam adhaūrdhvam maṇḍalam atha dakṣiṇa uttaram ca eva
translated: East, west, below, above, and also south and north,

analyzed: kṣitijam samapārśvastham bhānām yatra udaya astamayau  /
translated: The horizon is where the rising and setting of the luminaries occur.

analyzed: pūrva apara maṇḍalam tat iha kha gola pramāṇam
translated: That is the east-west circle here, the measure of the celestial globe.

analyzed: saḥ eva ūrdhvam upari adhas vagāhi sarva bha pañjarāṇām
translated: It itself, penetrating upwards and downwards, is the cage of all the luminaries.

analyzed: tathā dakṣiṇa uttaram anyat maṇḍalam tāvat pramāṇam
translated: Similarly, there is another circle, of the same measure, south and north.

original: dakṣiṇottarāvagāhi yāmya uttaramaṇḍalam upari adhaḥ ca janitasvastikam /
analyzed: dakṣiṇa uttara avagāhi yāmya uttara maṇḍalam upari adhas ca janita svastikam
translated: The south-north circle, penetrating south and north, generates a svastika above and below.

original: kṣitijam samapārśvastham tathā anyat maṇḍalam tāvat eva /
analyzed: kṣitijam samapārśvastham tathā anyat maṇḍalam tāvat eva
translated: The horizon is another circle of the same size, with equal sides.

original: samapārśvāvagāhi parikaravat dikcatuṣṭayajanitasvastikam kṣitija iti ucyate /
analyzed: sama pārśva avagāhi parikaravat diś catuṣṭaya janita svastikam kṣitijaḥ iti ucyate
translated: Penetrating the equal sides, like a girdle, generating a svastika in the four directions, is called the horizon.

analyzed: bhānām yatra udaya astamayau
translated: Where the rising and setting of the luminaries occur.

original: yatra maṇḍale bhānām udayāstamayau lakṣyete / harijam
analyzed: yatra maṇḍale bhānām udaya astamayau lakṣyete harijam
translated: Where the rising and setting of the luminaries are observed in the circle.

analyzed: iti kaiścid ucyate
translated: Some say it is the golden [circle].

analyzed: ayam khagolaḥ sarva bhapañjarāṇām bahis avatiṣṭhate  /
translated: This celestial sphere rests outside all the celestial globes.

analyzed: unmaṇḍalam
translated: The ecliptic circle

analyzed: unmaṇḍala pradarśanāya āha
translated: To show the ecliptic circle, it is said:

original: pūrvāparadiglagnam kṣitijāt akṣāgrayoḥ ca lagnam yat /
translated: The ascendant in the east and west directions, and the ascendant between the earth and the pole,

original: unmaṇḍalam bhavet tat kṣayavṛddhī yatra divasaniśoḥ // //
analyzed: unmaṇḍalam bhavet tat kṣaya vṛddhī yatra divasa niśoḥ
translated: That is the ecliptic circle, where the decrease and increase of day and night occur.

original: dakṣiṇottarakṣitijasvastikāt yāmya uttaramaṇḍale svadeśākṣabhāgatulye antare vedhe kṛtvā lohaśalākāgre praveśya golam nidadhyāt /
translated: From the southern and northern earth-cross, in the southern and northern hemispheres, at a distance equal to the degrees of one's own country, one should insert a metal rod at the tip and place the celestial globe.

original: tataḥ unmaṇḍalam darśayet /🔽pūrvāparadiglagnam pūrvāparayoḥ diśoḥ lagnam /
analyzed: tatas unmaṇḍalam darśayet  pūrva apara diś lagnam pūrva aparayoḥ diśoḥ lagnam
translated: Then one should show the ecliptic circle.🔽The ascendant in the east and west directions is the ascendant in the east and west directions.

analyzed: kṣitijāt akṣa agrayoḥ ca lagnam yat
translated: And the ascendant between the earth and the pole is the ascendant between the earth and the pole.

original: dakṣiṇottarakṣitijasvastikayoḥ upari adhaḥ svadeśākṣabhāgatulye antare lagnam kārayet /
analyzed: dakṣiṇa uttara kṣitija svastikayoḥ upari adhas sva deśa akṣa bhāga tulye antare lagnam kārayet
translated: Above and below the southern and northern earth-cross, at a distance equal to the degrees of one's own country, one should make the ascendant.

analyzed: tat unmaṇḍalam
translated: That is the ecliptic circle.

analyzed: udaya maṇḍalam unmaṇḍalam
translated: The rising circle is the ecliptic circle.

original: yatra maṇḍale divasasya rātreḥ ca kṣayavṛddhī lakṣyete /
analyzed: yatra maṇḍale divasasya rātreḥ ca kṣaya vṛddhī lakṣyete
translated: In which circle the decrease and increase of day and night are observed.

original: viṣuvati unmaṇḍalakṣitijayoḥ ekatvāt divasaniśoḥ kṣayavṛddhī na staḥ /
analyzed: viṣuvati unmaṇḍala kṣitijayoḥ ekatvāt divasa niśoḥ kṣaya vṛddhī na staḥ
translated: At the solstices, because the ecliptic and the horizon are the same, there is no increase or decrease of day and night.

original: viṣuvataḥ uttareṇa unmaṇḍalam upari kṣitijam adhaḥ avatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: viṣuvataḥ uttareṇa unmaṇḍalam upari kṣitijam adhas avatiṣṭhate
translated: North of the solstices, the ecliptic is above, the horizon is below.

original: tasmāt uttaragole aprāpte eva unmaṇḍalam savitā caradalaghaṭikāpramāṇena udeti /
analyzed: tasmāt uttara gole aprāpte eva unmaṇḍalam savitā cara dala ghaṭikā pramāṇena udeti
translated: Therefore, in the northern hemisphere, the sun rises by the amount of the daily motion in degrees, minutes, and parts, before it reaches the ecliptic.

analyzed: paścāt unmaṇḍalam atikrāntaḥ astam eti
translated: Then, having passed the ecliptic, it sets.

analyzed: atas divasaḥ uttaragole vardhate
translated: Therefore, in the northern hemisphere, the day increases.

analyzed: dakṣiṇagole unmaṇḍalam atikrāntaḥ kṣitijāt udeti
translated: In the southern hemisphere, the sun rises from the horizon having passed the ecliptic.

analyzed: aprāptaḥ eva astameti
translated: It sets before it reaches the ecliptic.

analyzed: atas dakṣiṇagole rātriḥ upacīyate
translated: Therefore, in the southern hemisphere, the night decreases.

analyzed: atas tad tulyā divasa niśoḥ kṣaya vṛddhī tad artham
translated: Therefore, the increase and decrease of day and night are equal to that. For that purpose,

analyzed: trairāśikam yadi ṣaṣṭyā graha bhuktiḥ labhyate
translated: there is a rule of three: if the planet's motion is obtained by sixty,

analyzed: tadā cara dala ghaṭikābhiḥ kiyatī iti
translated: then by the daily motion in degrees, minutes, and parts, what is it?

analyzed: labdham uttaragole ravau udaye viśodhayet
translated: The result is to be subtracted from the sun at sunrise in the northern hemisphere.

analyzed: yāmye viparītam
translated: In the south, the opposite.

original: evam uttaradiśi vyavasthitānām krameṇa divasaniśoḥ mahatyau kṣayavṛddhī bhavataḥ /
analyzed: evam uttara diśi vyavasthitānām krameṇa divasa niśoḥ mahatyau kṣaya vṛddhī bhavataḥ
translated: Thus, for those situated in the northern direction, the increase and decrease of day and night are great in order.

original: yatra deśe raviḥ mithunāntasthaḥ na astam eti /
analyzed: yatra deśe raviḥ mithuna anta sthaḥ na astam eti
translated: In the place where the sun, located in Gemini, does not set.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭiḥ nāḍyaḥ divasaḥ
translated: Sixty nāḍīs are a day.

analyzed: tatra triṃśat ghaṭikāḥ caram
translated: There, thirty ghaṭikās are the moving [part of the day].

analyzed: pañcadaśa ghaṭikāḥ cara ardham
translated: Fifteen ghaṭikās are half the moving [part of the day].

analyzed: tasya kāṣṭhasya jyā carajyā
translated: The sine of that arc is the moving sine.

original: tayā viparītakarmaṇā kṣitijyā ānīyate yadi vyāsārdhasya iyam vyāsārdhatulyā🔽carajyā tadā mithunāntasvāhorātrārdhasya kā iti mithunāntasvāhorātrārdhatulyā kṣitijyā labhyate /
analyzed: tayā viparīta karmaṇā kṣiti jyā ānīyate yadi vyāsārdhasya iyam vyāsārdha tulyā  cara jyā tadā mithuna anta sva ahar rātra ardhasya kā iti mithuna anta sva ahar rātra ardha tulyā kṣiti jyā labhyate
translated: If, by the opposite operation, the sine of the earth is brought, and if this moving sine is equal to half the diameter,🔽then the sine of the earth equal to half the day and night of Gemini is obtained.

original: tasyāḥ kṣitijyāyāḥ mithunāntāpakramajyāyāḥ ca vargayuteḥ mūlam arkāgrā trijyātulyā /
analyzed: tasyāḥ kṣiti jyāyāḥ mithuna anta apakrama jyāyāḥ ca varga yuteḥ mūlam arka agrā trijyā tulyā
translated: The square root of the sum of the squares of that sine of the earth and the sine of the distance from Gemini is equal to the sine of the arc of the meridian.

original: tena tatra deśe yāmya uttare kṣitijāt upari krameṇa samamaṇḍalam avagāhya khamadhyāt
analyzed: tena tatra deśe yāmya uttare kṣitijāt upari krameṇa sama maṇḍalam avagāhya kha madhyāt
translated: By that, in that place, the ecliptic gradually descends below the earth's equator, and

original: dakṣiṇena dvicatvāriṃśadbhāge yāmya uttaram atikramya tataḥ prathamodaye punar
analyzed: dakṣiṇena dvicatvāriṃśat bhāge yāmye uttaram atikramya tatas prathama udaye punar
translated: south of forty-two degrees from the center of the sky, it passes beyond the south of the meridian, and then at the first rising,

analyzed: kṣitijam āpnoti ca eva
translated: it again reaches the earth's equator.

analyzed: tatra ṣaṣtiḥ nāḍyaḥ divasaḥ upalakṣyate
translated: There, sixty nāḍīs are observed as a day.

analyzed: sva arka agrataḥ kṣiti jyā
translated: The sine of the earth is from one's own sine of the meridian.

analyzed: tad artham trairāśikam
translated: For that purpose, a triple proportion:

original: arkāgrayā iṣṭatulyayā kṣitijyā labhyate vyāsārdhena kim iti /
analyzed: arka agrayā iṣṭa tulyayā kṣiti jyā labhyate vyāsa ardhena kim iti
translated: By what is the arc of the earth obtained, which is equal to the desired arc of the sun, by the semi-diameter?

original: guṇakabhājakayoḥ tulyatvāt naṣṭayoḥ kṣitijyāpramāṇā akṣajyā bhavati /
analyzed: guṇaka bhājakayoḥ tulya tvāt naṣṭayoḥ kṣiti jyā pramāṇā akṣa jyā bhavati
translated: Because the multiplier and the divisor are equal, the arc of the horizon, which is lost, becomes the arc of the meridian, the measure of the arc of the earth.

analyzed: tat katham akṣaḥ ṣaṭṣaṣṭi bhāgāḥ
translated: How is that? The meridian is sixty parts.

analyzed: tatra deśe vyabhicārāt graha gatiḥ
translated: There, due to the deviation in that place, there is the motion of the planets.

original: uttareṇa tasmāt iyam vyavasthā na asti iti // //
analyzed: uttareṇa tasmāt iyam vyavasthā na asti iti  /
translated: Therefore, this arrangement does not exist to the north.

analyzed: kha gola apekṣayā draṣṭuḥ sthitiḥ
translated: The position of the observer relative to the celestial globe

analyzed: āha
translated: In order to explain the arrangement of east and so on, it is said:

original: pūrvāparadigrekhā adhaḥ ca ūrdhvā dakṣiṇottarasthā ca /
analyzed: pūrva apara diś rekhā adhas ca ūrdhvā dakṣiṇa uttara sthā ca
translated: The east-west line, and the vertical and horizontal lines, and the south-north line.

original: etāsām sampātaḥ draṣṭā yasmin bhavet deśe // //
analyzed: etāsām sampātaḥ draṣṭā yasmin bhavet deśe  /
translated: The meeting point of these, where the observer would be,

original: pūrvāpararekhā /🔽adhaḥ ca ūrdhvā ca yā rekhā /
analyzed: pūrva apara rekhā  adhas ca ūrdhvā ca yā rekhā
translated: The east-west line.🔽And the vertical and horizontal line.

analyzed: dakṣiṇa uttara sthā ca
translated: And the south-north line.

analyzed: cakāraḥ samuccaye
translated: The word and is for inclusion.

analyzed: etāsām rekhāṇām sampātaḥ ekatra yogaḥ
translated: The meeting point of these lines is their coming together in one place.

original: yasmin deśe draṣṭā tatra tatra tāsām sampātaḥ /
analyzed: yasmin deśe draṣṭā tatra tatra tāsām sampātaḥ
translated: Where the observer is, there is the meeting point of these.

analyzed: tasmāt draṣṭṛ vaśāt diś vyavasthā
translated: Therefore, the arrangement of directions is due to the observer.

original: yatra draṣṭā ravim udgacchan paśyati sā prācī /
analyzed: yatra draṣṭā ravim udgacchan paśyati sā prācī
translated: Where the observer sees the sun rising, that is the east.

original: yatra raviḥ madhyāhnam karoti sā dakṣiṇā /
analyzed: yatra raviḥ madhyāhnam karoti sā dakṣiṇā
translated: Where the sun makes midday, that is the south.

analyzed: yatra astam eti sā parā
translated: Where it sets, that is the west.

analyzed: yatra ardharātram karoti sā uttarā
translated: Where it makes midnight, that is the north.

analyzed: sarveṣām uttaraḥ meruḥ
translated: Meru is north of all.

original: laṅkānivāsinām yadā madhyāhne raviḥ bhavati romakanivāsinām udeti /
analyzed: laṅkā nivāsinām yadā madhyāhne raviḥ bhavati romaka nivāsinām udeti
translated: When it is midday for the inhabitants of Lanka, it rises for the inhabitants of Romak.

analyzed: tatra laṅkā pradeśe teṣām prācī
translated: There, in the region of Lanka, that is their east.

analyzed: tad apekṣayā sva sthānāt uttaraḥ meruḥ pratibhāsate
translated: In relation to that, Meru appears to be north of their own place.

original: yadā romake madhyāhnaḥ tadā siddhapuranivāsinām udayaḥ tatra romakapradeśe
analyzed: yadā romake madhyāhnaḥ tadā siddha pura nivāsinām udayaḥ tatra romaka pradeśe
translated: When it is midday in Romak, then it rises for the inhabitants of Siddhapura. There, in the region of Romak,

analyzed: teṣām prācī
translated: that is their east.

analyzed: tad apekṣayā teṣām sva sthānāt uttaraḥ meruḥ
translated: In relation to that, Meru appears to be north of their own place.

analyzed: evam yamakoṭyām api
translated: The same applies for Yamakoti.

original: bhūmau yāvattāvatpramāṇam vṛttam ālikhya pūrvāhṇe aparāhṇe ca chāyām lakṣayet /
analyzed: bhūmau yāvat tāvat pramāṇam vṛttam ālikhya pūrvāhṇe aparāhṇe ca chāyām lakṣayet

original: yatra pradeśe śaṅkucchāyā vṛttam praviśati sā paścimā /
analyzed: yatra pradeśe śaṅkucchāyā vṛttam praviśati sā paścimā
translated: In the region where the shadow of the gnomon enters the circle, that is the west.

analyzed: yatra niryāti sā prācī
translated: Where it emerges, that is the east.

analyzed: tad agrayoḥ matsyam utpādya tad mukha puccha spṛś sūtram prasārayet
translated: Having produced a fish at its tip, one should extend a thread touching its mouth and tail.

analyzed: sā dakṣiṇa uttarā diś bhavati
translated: That becomes the south and north direction.

analyzed: athavā tri chāyā agra matsya dvaya mukha puccha spṛś sūtra dvaya sampātaḥ uttarā dakṣiṇā ca
translated: Or else, the intersection of two lines, one of which passes through the tips of the shadows of the two fishes facing each other, and the other through their tails, is the north and south.

analyzed: athavā diś prasādhanīyā citrā svātyoḥ
translated: Or else, the directions should be determined by the Pleiades and the constellation Svāti.

analyzed: dṛś maṇḍalam dṛś kṣepa maṇḍalam ca
translated: The circle of vision and the circle of the projection of vision.
The nature of the circle of vision and the circle of the projection of vision is stated.

original: ūrdhvam adhastāt draṣṭuḥ jñeyam dṛṅmaṇḍalam grahābhimukham /
analyzed: ūrdhvam adhastāt draṣṭuḥ jñeyam dṛś maṇḍalam graha abhimukham
translated: The circle of vision should be known above and below the observer, facing the planets.

analyzed: dṛś kṣepa maṇḍalam api prāc lagnam syāt tri rāśi ūnam
translated: The circle of the projection of vision would also be the ascendant in the east, less three signs.

original: dṛṅmaṇḍalam draṣṭuḥ ūrdhvam adhastāt grahābhimukham bhavati /
analyzed: dṛś maṇḍalam draṣṭuḥ ūrdhvam adhastāt graha abhimukham bhavati
translated: The circle of vision is above and below the observer, facing the planets.

original: yatra draṣṭā bhavati tatra asya madhyam /
analyzed: yatra draṣṭā bhavati tatra asya madhyam
translated: Where the observer is, there is its center.

original: yatra grahaḥ tatra asya paridhiḥ /🔽yāvān dṛggrahayoḥ antaram tāvatā viṣkambhārdhena dṛṅmaṇḍalam pradṛśyam /
analyzed: yatra grahaḥ tatra asya paridhiḥ  yāvān dṛś grahayoḥ antaram tāvatā viṣkambha ardhena dṛś maṇḍalam pradṛśyam
translated: Where the planet is, there is its circumference.🔽The circle of vision should be seen with a distance of half the diameter equal to the distance between the observer and the planet.

original: tat eva madhyāhnasthite grahe dṛkkṣepamaṇḍalam bhavati /
analyzed: tat eva madhyāhna sthite grahe dṛś kṣepa maṇḍalam bhavati
translated: That same circle of vision becomes the circle of the projection of vision when the planet is at midday.

analyzed: dṛś kṣepa maṇḍalam api
translated: The circle of the projection of vision also.

original: samamaṇḍalamadhyāt dakṣiṇena uttareṇa vā yatra grahābhimukham dṛṣṭeḥ kṣepaḥ tatra yaḥ mahāpramāṇakakṣyaḥ grahaḥ sa stokataram kṣipyate /
analyzed: sama maṇḍala madhyāt dakṣiṇena uttareṇa vā yatra graha abhimukham dṛṣṭeḥ kṣepaḥ tatra yaḥ mahāpramāṇakakṣyaḥ grahaḥ sa stokataram kṣipyate
translated: From the center of the great circle, to the south or north, where the projection of the sight is facing the planet, the planet with the greatest distance from the center is projected less.

analyzed: alpa pramāṇa kakṣyaḥ bahutaram kṣipyate iti
translated: The planet with the smallest distance from the center is projected more.

analyzed: etat madhyāhne dṛś jyā pramāṇa vyāsa ardhena sama maṇḍala madhyāt badhnīyāt
translated: This should be tied from the center of the great circle with the measure of the arc of the sight at midday.

analyzed: asya ānayana upāyaḥ prāglagnam syāt trirāśi ūnam
translated: The method of determining this is: the previous ascendant would be three signs less.

original: parvakālaghaṭikāḥ pūrvāhṇe dinārdhāt śodhayet /🔽śeṣaprāṇān trairāśikānītaravibhuktalaṅkodayaprāṇaiḥ ūnīkuryāt /
analyzed: śodhayet  śeṣa prāṇān ūnīkuryāt
translated: The hours of the junction time should be subtracted from the forenoon, half the day.🔽The remaining breaths should be reduced by the breaths of the rising of Lanka divided by the other breaths.

original: śeṣebhyaḥ yāvat laṅkodayaprāṇāḥ śudhyanti tāvat śodhyāḥ /
analyzed: śeṣebhyaḥ yāvat laṅkā udaya prāṇāḥ śudhyanti tāvat śodhyāḥ
translated: The remaining breaths should be subtracted as many times as the breaths of the rising of Lanka are purified.

analyzed: tānvantaḥ eva rāśayaḥ viśodhyante
translated: The remaining signs are purified.

analyzed: śeṣa prāṇān triṃśatā guṇayet
translated: The remaining breaths should be multiplied by thirty.

analyzed: aśuddha laṅkā udayena vibhajet
translated: They should be divided by the unpurified rising of Lanka.

analyzed: labdham bhāga ādi
translated: The result is the parts and so on.

analyzed: pūrva viśodhitaiḥ eva śodhayet
translated: They should be subtracted by the previously purified ones.

analyzed: pūrvāhṇe madhya lagnam bhavati
translated: In the forenoon, the middle ascendant occurs.

original: aparāhṇe adhikatvāt raveḥ yāvantaḥ laṅkodayāḥ viśudhyanti tāvantaḥ prakṣipya lagnam kriyate /
analyzed: aparāhṇe adhika tvāt raveḥ yāvantaḥ laṅkodayāḥ viśudhyanti tāvantaḥ prakṣipya lagnam kriyate
translated: In the afternoon, as many ascendants as there are by the excess of the sun are purified, and the ascendant is made by adding them.

original: ācāryeṇa sthūlaprakṛtyā iṣṭaghaṭikābhiḥ pūrvalagnam lagnavidhinā kṛtvā trirāśyūnam kriyate /
analyzed: ācāryeṇa sthūla prakṛtyā iṣṭa ghaṭikābhiḥ pūrva lagnam lagna vidhinā kṛtvā trirāśi ūnam kriyate
translated: The teacher, considering the gross nature [of the calculation], makes the previous ascendant by the method of ascendant with desired ghatis, and makes it three signs less.

analyzed: madhyalagnam bhavati iti
translated: It becomes the middle ascendant.

original: rāśayaḥ laṅkodayaiḥ madhyam avagāhante iti laṅkodayaiḥ yat madhyalagnam tat sūkṣmam iti /🔽tasya apakramakāṣṭham svadeśākṣabhāgayutam samadiśoḥ bhinnadiśoḥ viśuddham
analyzed: rāśayaḥ laṅkā udayaiḥ madhyam avagāhante iti laṅkā udayaiḥ yat madhya lagnam tat sūkṣmam iti  tasya apakrama kāṣṭham sva deśa akṣa bhāga yutam sama diśoḥ bhinna diśoḥ viśuddham
translated: The signs enter the middle by the ascendants. Therefore, the middle ascendant by the ascendants is subtle.

analyzed: kha madhya ravi kakṣyā antarālam bhavati
translated: The arc of the mean sun in the meridian is the arc of the mean sun plus the arc of the meridian.

original: tasya jīvā madhyajyā iti ucyate /🔽candrasya apakramakāṣṭham vikṣepayutam viyutam kriyate /
analyzed: tasya jīvā madhyajyā iti ucyate  candrasya apakrama kāṣṭham vikṣepa yutam viyutam kriyate
translated: The sine of the middle [longitude] is called the sine of the middle [longitude].🔽The arc of the mean sun plus the arc of the meridian is the arc of the mean sun in the meridian.🔽The sine of the arc of the mean sun in the meridian is the sine of the middle [longitude].🔽The arc of the mean moon plus or minus the arc of the meridian is the arc of the mean moon in the meridian.

original: yataḥ vimaṇḍale candraḥ tataḥ akṣabhāgayutaviyutasya jyā candramadhyajyā bhavati /
analyzed: yatas vimaṇḍale candraḥ tatas akṣa bhāga yuta viyutasya jyā candra madhya jyā bhavati
translated: The sine of the arc of the mean moon in the meridian is the sine of the middle [longitude] of the moon.

analyzed: anayā atra madhya jyā vyākhyātā
translated: By this, the sine of the middle [longitude] is explained here.

analyzed: svayaṃvaha golayantram

analyzed: svayaṃvaha golayantra pratipādanāya āha
translated: To explain the self-moving globe machine, it is said:

analyzed: samavṛttam

analyzed: sarveṣu pradeśeṣu samam

analyzed: na hīna adhikam iti  sama gurum

analyzed: samantataḥ samā guru tā kāryā

analyzed: pārata taila jalaiḥ iti

translated: As long as water flows from the vessel, by its weight

analyzed: prathamam tāmrakīlake pāśakasūtrasya ekam agram badhvā golayantram adhastāt prabhṛti pariveṣṭya tatra eva pradeśe sūtram prāpayet iti kramaḥ

analyzed: sva ahar rātra ardha viṣkambhaḥ
translated: The semi-meridian of one's own day and night

translated: By the true anomaly and so on, he states the calculation of the radius and so on.🔽The square root of the true anomaly squared minus the semi-diameter squared,🔽is the semi-meridian of one's own day and night north and south of the equinoctial.[1]

original: sūryasya iṣṭāpakramajyāyāḥ candrasya iṣṭāpakramajyāyāḥ ca yaḥ vargaḥ sa iṣṭāpakramavargaḥ /

translated: Having subtracted the co-latitude from the arc of the equator, the square root of the remainder is the distance of the sun north or south of the celestial equator for that day or night.

analyzed: krānti jyāḥ bhujā  vyāsa ardham karṇaḥ

analyzed: dakṣiṇa gole dakṣiṇena pradarśayet  /

analyzed: navatiḥ bhāgāḥ yasmin kāṣṭhe tasya ante bhavam yat svahorātrārdham tat eva iṣṭajyābhiḥ guṇitam svahorātrārdhahṛtam svakīya svakīya ahorātrārdhahṛtam  /

original: viṣuvajjyayā akṣajīvayā guṇitaḥ lambakena bhaktaḥ astodayasūtrāt dakṣiṇataḥ sūryaśaṅkvagram bhavati /

translated: Multiplied by the sine of the vernal equinox, the meridian sine, and divided by its own chord, the tip of the gnomon of the sun is to the south of the meridian line of setting and rising.

original: śaṅkoḥ agram antarālam śaṅkumūlāt samottarāvagāhisūtram yāvat astamayodayasūtram iti /🔽kṣitijamaṇḍale prāksvastikāt dakṣiṇam uttaram vā arkāgrākāṣṭhatulyāntare sūtrasya ekam agram badhvā /

translated: The distance from the tip of the gnomon to the point where the string that reaches the same distance above the root of the gnomon meets the string of setting and rising is the distance.🔽On the equator, fix one end of the string at a distance equal to the length of the gnomon's shadow to the south or north of the eastern sign.

original: dvitīyam agram tāvat arkāgrākāṣṭhatulyāntare eva aparabhāge badhnīyāt /

analyzed: śaṅkumūlāt bhūmadhyam yāvat sūtram dṛgjyā
translated: The string from the root of the gnomon to the center of the earth is the arc of the observer.

analyzed: bhū madhyāt upari śaṅku mastaka prāpi yat sūtram karṇaḥ vyāsa ardham iti  /

analyzed: arka agrā

analyzed: arka agra ānayanāya āha

analyzed: parama apakrama jīvām iṣṭa jyā ardha āhatām tatas vibhajet
translated: Then, the arc of the maximum declination multiplied by half the sine of the desired arc should be divided.

analyzed: jyā lambakena labdhā arka agrā pūrva apare kṣitije  /
translated: The gnomon's shadow is obtained by dividing by the sine of the arc on the equator in the east and west.

analyzed: parama apakrama jyā caturviṃśati bhāga jyā
translated: And the arc of the maximum declination is the arc of 24 parts.

original: tām iṣṭasya raveḥ bhujajyayā guṇitām kṛtvā lambakena vibhajet /

translated: When the arc of the [longitude of the] sun is less than the arc of the ecliptic,

analyzed: badhvā arka ākrānta rāśi bhāga pradeśaḥ sama pūrva apara maṇḍale yatra lagnam prāc bindutaḥ

analyzed: bhavati

original: arkāgrāgre savitā uditaḥ tadvṛttānusāreṇa samamaṇḍalam avagāhya dakṣiṇena natajyātulye antare madhyāhnam kṛtvā krameṇa aparabhāge samamaṇḍalāt
analyzed: arka agra agre savitā uditaḥ tad vṛtta anusāreṇa sama maṇḍalam avagāhya dakṣiṇena nata jyā tulye antare madhyāhnam kṛtvā krameṇa apara bhāge sama maṇḍalāt

analyzed: madhyāhna śaṅkucchāyayoḥ ānayanāya āha
translated: To bring the gnomon and shadow at midday, he says:

translated: The shadow of that greatest gnomon is the chord of the inclined parts from the center.🔽At the desired midday, the parts of the sun's parallax should be applied to the parts of the meridian in the southern hemisphere.

analyzed: uttare gole viyojayet

analyzed: te natabhāgāḥ bhavanti

analyzed: candrasya vikṣepa yuta viyutāḥ nata bhāgāḥ bhavanti

analyzed: śeṣam unnata bhāgāḥ teṣām jyā
translated: The remainder are the elevated parts. The chord of those

translated: is the chord of the elevated parts.

original: athavā taddinasvāhorātrārdham kṣitijyayā svayā udagyāmye viyutayutaṃvyāsārdhaguṇam svāhorātrārdhabhaktam dvādaśaguṇam viṣuvatkarṇahṛtam mahāśaṅkuḥ
analyzed: athavā tad dina sva ahorātra ardham kṣitijyayā svayā udak yāmye viyuta yutam vyāsa ardha guṇam sva ahorātra ardha bhaktam dvādaśaguṇam viṣuvat karṇa hṛtam mahāśaṅkuḥ  /
translated: Or, the half of the day and night of that day, added to the latitude of the earth, multiplied by the semi-diameter, divided by the half of the day and night, multiplied by twelve, and subtracted from the hypotenuse of the vernal equinox, is the great arc.

analyzed: tad unnata jyā bhavati
translated: That is the sine of the altitude.

analyzed: dṛś kṣepa jyā
translated: Sine of the parallactic constant

analyzed: dṛkkṣepa pratipādanāya āha  madhya jyā udaya jīvā saṃvarge vyāsadala hṛte yat syāt
translated: To explain the parallactic constant, it is said:🔽The square root of the product of the sine of the mean geocentric distance and the sine of the ascensional difference, divided by the semi-diameter,

analyzed: tat madhya jyā kṛtyoḥ viśeṣa mūlam sva dṛkkṣepaḥ
translated: is the parallactic constant of one's own [planet], which is the square root of the difference between the sine of the mean [distance] and the sine of the [ascensional] difference.

analyzed: madhya jyā ca udaya jīvā ca madhya udaya jīve
translated: The sine of the mean [distance] and the sine of the ascensional difference are the sine of the mean ascensional difference.

original: tayoḥ saṃvargaḥ parasparaguṇanam vyāsadalahṛtam yat bhavati tasya madhyajyāyāḥ ca kṛtyoḥ viśeṣamūlam svakīyaḥ dṛkkṣepaḥ /
analyzed: tayoḥ saṃvargaḥ paraspara guṇanam vyāsadalahṛtam yat bhavati tasya madhyajyāyāḥ ca kṛtyoḥ viśeṣamūlam svakīyaḥ dṛkkṣepaḥ
translated: The product of those two, divided by the semi-diameter, is the square root of the difference between the sine of the mean [distance] and the sine of the [ascensional] difference, which is one's own parallactic constant.

analyzed: sva grahaṇena tu ravi candra kakṣyayoḥ bhinnaḥ dṛkkṣepaḥ
translated: However, by the word one's own, the parallactic constant of the orbits of the sun and moon is different.

analyzed: dṛś gati jyā
translated: Sine of the apparent motion

analyzed: āha  mūlam sva dṛś gatiḥ ku vaśāt
translated: To calculate the sine of the apparent motion, it is said:🔽The square root of the product of the sine of the parallactic constant and the sine of the difference, multiplied by the sine of the mean [distance], is one's own apparent motion, due to the power of the sine.

analyzed: kṣitije svā dṛś chāyā bhū vyāsa ardham nabhaḥ madhyāt
translated: On the horizon, one's own shadow is the semi-diameter of the earth, from the center of the sky.

original: dṛgjyādṛkkṣepakṛtyoḥ vivarasya mūlam svakīyā dṛggatiḥ bhavati /
analyzed: dṛś jyā dṛś kṣepa kṛtyoḥ vivarasya mūlam svakīyā dṛggatiḥ bhavati
translated: The square root of the difference of the squares of the arc of the meridian and the arc of the meridian of parallax is one's own arc of vision.

analyzed: kuvaśāt bhūvaśāt iyam bhavati
translated: This is due to the obliquity of the ecliptic.

original: madhyajyodayajīvayoḥ saṃvarge vyāsadalahṛte yat tat madhyajyākṛtyoḥ viśeṣāt mūlam dṛkkṣepaḥ hi bhavati /
analyzed: madhya jyā udaya jīvayoḥ saṃvarge vyāsa dala hṛte yat tat madhya jyā ākṛtyoḥ viśeṣāt mūlam dṛkkṣepaḥ hi bhavati
translated: The difference of the squares of the arc of the meridian and the arc of the meridian of parallax divided by the sum of the arc of the meridian and the arc of the meridian of parallax is the arc of parallax.

original: evam bhūvaśāt utpannatrijyāśaṅkuvargaviśeṣāt mūlam dṛgjyā bhavati /🔽ataḥ bhūvaśāt utpannadṛgjyādṛkkṣepaniṣpannatvāt kuvaśāt iti ucyate /
analyzed: evam bhū vaśāt utpanna trijyā śaṅku varga viśeṣāt mūlam dṛgjyā bhavati  atas bhū vaśāt utpanna dṛś jyā dṛś kṣepa niṣpanna tvāt ku vaśāt iti ucyate
translated: In the same way, the square root of the difference of the squares of the sine of latitude and the sine of the altitude is the sine of the arc of vision.🔽Therefore, since the sine of the arc of vision produced by the obliquity of the ecliptic and the arc of parallax are produced, it is said to be due to the obliquity of the ecliptic.

original: kṣitije svā dṛkchāyā iti atra tu svā iti anena svakīyadṛkkṣepadṛggatī abhidhīyete /
analyzed: kṣitije svāḥ dṛś chāyāḥ iti atra tu svāḥ iti anena svakīya dṛś kṣepa dṛś gatī abhidhīyete
translated: But here, in one's own shadow on the horizon, by one's own, one's own arc of parallax and arc of vision are indicated.

analyzed: bhū vyāsa ardham
translated: Half the diameter of the earth🔽Why is one's own shadow on the celestial globe produced?

analyzed: kṣitija maṇḍale svā dṛkchāyā kasmāt utpannā  nabhaḥ madhyāt
translated: From the center of the sky.

original: vyāsārdhatulyam etat bhavati /🔽tat yataḥ kudṛṣṭivaśāt samamaṇḍalamadhyāt pūrvāparayoḥ diśoḥ dṛggatiḥ lambanam ṛṇam dhanam vā iti /
analyzed: vyāsa ardha tulyam etat bhavati  tat yatas kudṛṣṭi vaśāt sama maṇḍala madhyāt pūrva aparayoḥ diśoḥ dṛggatiḥ lambanam ṛṇam dhanam vā iti
translated: This is equal to half the diameter.🔽From that, due to the obliquity of the ecliptic, the arc of vision in the east and west directions from the center of the equinoctial circle is the longitude, positive or negative.

original: tathā eva bhagolamadhyāt dakṣiṇottaradiśoḥ dṛkkṣepasya grahaṇena natiḥ vā syāt /
analyzed: tathā eva bha gola madhyāt dakṣiṇa uttara diśoḥ dṛkkṣepasya grahaṇena natiḥ vā syāt
translated: In the same way, the arc of parallax in the south and north directions from the center of the celestial globe would be the obliquity, by taking it.

analyzed: jyānām viśeṣa utpattim darśayati
translated: It shows the special arising of the chords.

original: bhūmeḥ golākāratvāt bhūvyāsārdhatulyam antaram kṣitije sūryakakṣyāyām candrakakṣāyām ca bhavati /🔽sūryakakṣyotpannamadhyajyām sūryakakṣyodayajyayā saṃguṇya trijyayā bhāgalabdhasya vargam madhyajyāvargāt viśodhya mūlam ravikakṣyāyām dṛkkṣepaḥ /
analyzed: bhūmeḥ gola ākāra tvāt bhū vyāsa ardha tulyam antaram kṣitije sūryakakṣyāyām candrakakṣāyām ca bhavati  sūrya kakṣyā utpanna madhya jyām sūrya kakṣyā udaya jyayā saṃguṇya trijyayā bhāga labdhasya vargam madhya jyā vargāt viśodhya mūlam ravi kakṣyāyām dṛś kṣepaḥ
translated: Because the earth is spherical, the distance between the earth's equator and the orbits of the sun and moon is equal to half the earth's diameter.🔽The apparent parallax in the sun's orbit is the square root of the difference between the square of the mean chord produced by the sun's orbit and the square of the chord obtained by dividing the product of the mean chord produced by the sun's orbit and the sun's rising chord by the triple chord.

original: tathā candrakakṣyotpannamadhyajyām svodayajyayā saṃguṇya trijyayā bhāgalabdhasya vargam svamadhyajyāvargāt viśodhya mūlam candrakakṣyāyām dṛkkṣepaḥ🔽sūryasvāhorātrādibhiḥ sādhitadṛgjyāvargāt sūryadṛkkṣepavargam viśodhya mūlam sūryakakṣyāyām dṛggatijyā /
analyzed: tathā candra kakṣyā utpanna madhya jyām sva udaya jyayā saṃguṇya trijyayā bhāga labdhasya vargam sva madhya jyā vargāt viśodhya mūlam candra kakṣyāyām dṛkkṣepaḥ  sūrya sva ahorātra ādibhiḥ sādhita dṛś jyā vargāt sūrya dṛś kṣepa vargam viśodhya mūlam sūrya kakṣyāyām dṛś gati jyā
translated: Similarly, the apparent parallax in the moon's orbit is the square root of the difference between the square of the mean chord produced by the moon's orbit and the square of the chord obtained by dividing the product of the mean chord produced by the moon's orbit and the moon's rising chord by the triple chord.🔽The apparent motion chord in the sun's orbit is the square root of the difference between the square of the apparent chord produced by the sun's own hours, days, etc. and the square of the sun's apparent parallax, in the sun's orbit.

original: candrasvāhorātrādibhiḥ sādhitadṛgjyāvargāt candradṛkkṣepavargam viśodhya mūlam candrakakṣyāyām dṛggatijyā bhavati /
analyzed: candra sva ahorātra ādibhiḥ sādhita dṛś jyā vargāt candra dṛś kṣepa vargam viśodhya mūlam candra kakṣyāyām dṛś gati jyā bhavati
translated: The apparent motion chord in the moon's orbit is the square root of the difference between the square of the apparent chord produced by the moon's own hours, days, etc. and the square of the moon's apparent parallax, in the moon's orbit.

original: evam anyeṣām api grahāṇām samamaṇḍalamadhyāt dṛggateḥ bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: evam anyeṣām api grahāṇām sama maṇḍala madhyāt dṛś gateḥ bhāvaḥ
translated: In this way, the existence of the apparent motion of the other planets is also [explained] from the center of the equal circle.

original: udaye sūryagrahaṇe candrasya tāvadadhaḥsthitatvāt candrakakṣyāyām sūryabimbakendrasūtrāt pūrveṇa candrabimbam natam lakṣyate /
analyzed: udaye sūrya grahaṇe candrasya tāvat adhas sthita tvāt candra kakṣyāyām sūryabimbakendra sūtrāt pūrveṇa candra bimbam natam lakṣyate
translated: At sunrise and a solar eclipse, since the moon is below [the sun], the moon's disk is seen to the east of the line connecting the center of the sun's disk in the moon's orbit.

analyzed: astamaye tu tathā eva
translated: But at sunset, it is seen in the same way

original: aparataḥ / samabhūpradeśe sthitasya draṣṭuḥ vyāsārdhatulyayā dṛggatijyayā bhūvyāsārdhatulyam dṛggatyantaram lambanam /
analyzed: aparatas sama bhū pradeśe sthitasya draṣṭuḥ vyāsa ardha tulyayā dṛś gati jyayā bhū vyāsa ardha tulyam dṛś gati antaram lambanam
translated: to the west. For an observer standing on the plane of the equator, the difference in the apparent motion of the moon, equal to the semi-diameter of the earth, is the parallax.

analyzed: evam eva dakṣiṇa uttara kapālayoḥ dṛkkṣepa antaram natiḥ
translated: In the same way, the difference in the declination of the northern and southern hemispheres is the nutation.

original: tatra idam trairāśikam yadi vyāsārdhatulyayā dṛggatijyayā bhūvyāsārdhayojanatulyam dṛggatyantaram lambanam tadā iṣṭakālotpannadṛggatijyayā
analyzed: tatra idam trairāśikam yadi vyāsa ardha tulyayā dṛggati jyayā bhū vyāsa ardha yojana tulyam dṛggati antaram lambanam tadā iṣṭa kāla utpanna dṛggati jyayā
translated: Here is the triple computation: If the difference in the apparent motion, equal to the semi-diameter of the earth, is the parallax, with the semi-diameter of the apparent motion,

analyzed: kiyat iti
translated: then with the apparent motion produced at the desired time, how much [is it]?

original: punar ca trairāśikam yadi sphuṭayojanakarṇena trijyātulyāḥ kalāḥ labhyante /
analyzed: punar ca trairāśikam yadi sphuṭa yojana karṇena trijyā tulyāḥ kalāḥ labhyante
translated: And again, the triple computation: If the minutes are obtained equal to the sine of 90 degrees with the hypotenuse in yojanas,

analyzed: tadā lambana yojanaiḥ kiyatyaḥ
translated: then with the yojanas of the apparent motion and parallax, how many [are they]?

original: iti / atra prathame trairāśike trijyā bhāgahāraḥ dvitīye guṇakāraḥ tulyatvāt nāśe kṛte ravicandrayoḥ dṛggateḥ bhūvyāsārdham guṇakāraḥ sphuṭayojanakarṇaḥ
analyzed: iti atra prathame trairāśike trijyā bhāgahāraḥ dvitīye guṇakāraḥ tulya tvāt nāśe kṛte ravi candrayoḥ dṛś gateḥ bhū vyāsa ardham guṇakāraḥ sphuṭa yojana karṇaḥ
translated: Here, in the first trairāśika, the sine of the arc is the divisor; in the second, it is the multiplier. Since [the sine of the arc] is the same, when the [sine of the arc] of the sun and moon is subtracted, the radius of the earth is the multiplier, and the true [meridional] distance in yojanas is

analyzed: phalam liptāḥ
translated: the result in ghatis.

original: sūryaliptāḥ candraliptābhyaḥ viśodhya trairāśikam yadi dinasphuṭabhuktyantareṇa ṣaṣṭiḥ nāḍyaḥ labhyante /
translated: The ghatis of the sun are subtracted from the ghatis of the moon. If 60 nāḍīs are obtained by the trairāśika with the difference in the true [meridional] distances,

analyzed: tadā ābhiḥ liptābhiḥ kiyatyaḥ iti
translated: then by how many ghatis are they [obtained]?

analyzed: labdham nāḍyaḥ bhavanti
translated: The result is the nāḍīs.

analyzed: tāḥ dṛś gati lambana ghaṭikāḥ
translated: Those are the ghatis of the true [meridional] distance.

analyzed: pūrvakapāle pūrvatas grahaḥ kakṣyāyām nataḥ
translated: In the eastern hemisphere, the planet is inclined towards the ecliptic to the east.

analyzed: tasmāt prāk yogaḥ atas  grahe apanīyante
translated: Therefore, there is an addition to the east.🔽Therefore, [the ghatis] are subtracted from the planet.

original: aparakapāle parataḥ natatvāt lambanaghaṭikātulyakālena yogaḥ bhaviṣyati iti ataḥ prakṣipyante /
analyzed: apara kapāle paratas nata tvāt lambana ghaṭikā tulya kālena yogaḥ bhaviṣyati iti atas prakṣipyante
translated: In the western hemisphere, because [the planet] is inclined to the west, there will be an addition after the same amount of time as the ghatis of the [meridional] distance. Therefore, [the ghatis] are added.

original: evam etat karma tāvat kriyate yāvat aviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: evam etat karma tāvat kriyate yāvat aviśeṣaḥ
translated: This operation is performed until there is no difference.

original: evam ravicandrayoḥ dṛkkṣepaliptāḥ prāgvat trairāśikena jñātāḥ /
analyzed: evam ravi candrayoḥ dṛkkṣepa liptāḥ prāgvat trairāśikena jñātāḥ
translated: In this way, the ghatis of the true [meridional] distance of the sun and moon are known by the trairāśika as before.

original: yadi ravicandrayoḥ madhyajye samadiksthe bhavataḥ tadā ravicandrayoḥ natiliptānām viśeṣaḥ anyathā yogaḥ /
analyzed: yadi ravi candrayoḥ madhya jye samadiksthe bhavataḥ tadā ravi candrayoḥ nati liptānām viśeṣaḥ anyathā yogaḥ
translated: If the mid-meridian and the sun and moon are in the same direction, then the difference of the declinations of the sun and moon is the sum. Otherwise, it is the sum.

analyzed: tatas avanatiḥ bhavati
translated: Then the declination occurs.

original: tataḥ madhyagrahaṇacandrāt pātam viśodhya śeṣasya dakṣiṇottarabhujajyā ardhapañcamena guṇitā trijyābhaktā vikṣepaḥ /🔽avanativikṣepayoḥ samadiśi yogaḥ /🔽bhinnadiśi viyogaḥ sphuṭavikṣepaḥ /
analyzed: tatas madhya grahaṇa candrāt pātam viśodhya śeṣasya dakṣiṇa uttara bhuja jyā ardhapañcamena guṇitā trijyā bhaktā vikṣepaḥ  avanati vikṣepayoḥ sama diśi yogaḥ  bhinna diśi viyogaḥ sphuṭa vikṣepaḥ
translated: Then, subtracting the fall of the moon from the mid-eclipse, the sine of the remainder's southern or northern arc, multiplied by half-five and divided by the sine of three, is the parallax.🔽The sum of the declination and parallax in the same direction is the parallax.🔽The difference in different directions is the true parallax.

analyzed: sphuṭa vikṣepaḥ avanatiḥ iti paryāyaḥ
translated: True parallax and declination are synonyms.

analyzed: tayā ca avanatyā sthiti ardham
translated: And by that declination, taking half the duration,

analyzed: ānīya madhyatitheḥ viśodhya śeṣaḥ sparśa kālaḥ
translated: subtracting from the mid-eclipse, the remainder is the time of contact.

analyzed: tena prāgvat lambana vidhiḥ
translated: By that, the method of latitude is as before.

original: sparśamadhyalambanaghaṭikāntareṇa sthityardham upacīyate /🔽tat punar madhyakālāt viśodhya asakṛt sthityardham utpādayet yāvat sthiram bhavati /
analyzed: sparśa madhya lambana ghaṭikā antareṇa sthiti ardham upacīyate  tat punar madhya kālāt viśodhya asakṛt sthiti ardham utpādayet yāvat sthiram bhavati
translated: Half the duration is added to the difference in ghatis between the contact and mid-eclipse latitude.🔽That, again, subtracting from the mid-time, should repeatedly produce half the duration until it becomes constant.

analyzed: mokṣe punar prathama ānīta sthiti ardham madhyatithau prakṣipet
translated: At liberation, the half-duration first brought should be added to the mid-eclipse.
As before, the half-period of the eclipse is added in minutes of arc by the difference between the meridian altitude and the mean altitude.

original: tat punar madhyatithau prakṣipya pūrvavat lambanaghaṭikāḥ utpādya tanmadhyalambanāntareṇa
analyzed: tat punar madhya tithau prakṣipya pūrvavat lambana ghaṭikāḥ utpādya tad madhya lambana antareṇa
translated: Then, inserting that [sum] in the middle of the day, as before, the minutes of arc of the meridian altitude are produced, and the half-period of the eclipse is added in minutes of arc by the difference between the meridian altitude and the mean altitude.

original: sthityardham upacitam kṛtvā tat eva karma punar kriyate yāvat sthiram bhavati /
analyzed: sthiti ardham upacitam kṛtvā tat eva karma punar kriyate yāvat sthiram bhavati
translated: That same operation is performed again until it becomes stable.

original: evam sthirīkṛtasthityardhasambandhinam sūryendugatikalābhogam madhyagrahaṇasūryendoḥ sparśe viśodhayet mokṣe kṣipet /
analyzed: evam sthirīkṛta sthiti ardha sambandhinam sūrya indu gati kalā bhogam madhya grahaṇa sūrya indoḥ sparśe viśodhayet mokṣe kṣipet
translated: In this way, the sine of the motion of the sun and moon, related to the half-period of the eclipse that has been stabilized, should be corrected at the contact of the sun and moon in the middle eclipse and added in liberation.

analyzed: sparśa mokṣa kālikau bhavataḥ
translated: The times of contact and liberation are obtained.

original: atha prāgaparakapāladvaye api lambanayoḥ tayoḥ yogena yutam sthityardham sphuṭam bhavati /
analyzed: atha prāc apara kapāla dvaye api lambanayoḥ tayoḥ yogena yutam sthiti ardham sphuṭam bhavati
translated: Now, in the two halves of the east and west, the half-period of the eclipse, added by the sum of the two meridian altitudes, becomes true.🔽Having drawn a circle on the level ground with a string the length of the semidiameter, and marked the directions,

original: samāyāmavanau vyāsārdhapramāṇena sūtreṇa vṛttam ālikhya dikcihnitam kṛtvā maṇḍalapūrvabhāge
analyzed: samāyām avanau vyāsa ardha pramāṇena sūtreṇa vṛttam ālikhya diś cihnitam kṛtvā maṇḍala pūrva bhāge
translated: on the eastern part of the circle,

original: prāgapararekhāyāḥ uttareṇa dakṣiṇena vā udayajyākāṣṭhatulye antare bindū kṛtvā bindudvayaśiraspṛksūtram
analyzed: prāc apara rekhāyāḥ uttareṇa dakṣiṇena vā udaya jyā kāṣṭha tulye antare bindū kṛtvā bindu dvaya śira spṛś sūtram
translated: to the north or south of the east-west line, two points are made at a distance equal to the chord of the ascensional difference,

analyzed: prasārya rekhā kuryāt udaya jyā bhavati
translated: Stretching out a line, it becomes the sine of the ascensional difference.

original: punar madhyam maṇḍalakendram kṛtvā madhyajyātulyasūtreṇa vṛttam bhrāmayet /
analyzed: punar madhyam maṇḍalakendram kṛtvā madhya jyā tulya sūtreṇa vṛttam bhrāmayet
translated: Again, taking the center of the middle circle as the center, one should rotate a circle with a string equal to the sine of the middle [distance].

analyzed: tat madhya jyā maṇḍalam
translated: That is the circle of the sine of the middle [distance].

original: trijyāmaṇḍalaparidhibindudvayāt sūtradvayam madhyakendram ānīya rekhādvayam kuryāt
translated: From two points on the circumference of the circle of the sine of three [signs], one should bring two strings to the center of the middle [circle] and make two lines.

original: tat antarajyārdham madhyajyāmaṇḍale tathā eva pūrvāparataḥ uttareṇa dakṣiṇena vā vyavasthāpyate /
analyzed: tat antarajyā ardham madhyajyā maṇḍale tathā eva pūrvāparataḥ uttareṇa dakṣiṇena vā vyavasthāpyate
translated: The sine of the interval, half of that, is established in the circle of the sine of the middle [distance] in the same way, to the east and west, or to the north and south.

original: tat madhyajyāvargaviśeṣamūlam dṛkkṣepajyākoṭiḥ madhyajyāmaṇḍale bhavati /🔽trijyāmaṇḍale pūrvāparayoḥ udayajyākāṣṭhatulye antare bindū kṛtvā vṛttakendrāt🔽madhyāhnanatajyātulye antare dṛkkṣepabinduḥ dakṣiṇena prakalpya bindutrayeṇa matsyam
analyzed: tat madhya jyā varga viśeṣa mūlam dṛś kṣepa jyā koṭiḥ madhya jyā maṇḍale bhavati  trijyā maṇḍale pūrva aparayoḥ udaya jyā kāṣṭha tulye antare bindū kṛtvā vṛttakendrāt  madhyāhna nata jyā tulye antare dṛś kṣepa binduḥ dakṣiṇena prakalpya bindu trayeṇa matsyam
translated: The square root of the difference of the squares of the sine of the middle [distance] is the hypotenuse of the sine of the declination, and it lies in the circle of the sine of the middle [distance].🔽In the circle of the sine of three [signs], having made two points equal to the maximum sine of the ascensional difference to the east and west,🔽from the center of the circle, having imagined the point of the sine of the declination to the south at an interval equal to the sine of the noon declination, one should produce a fish with three points.

analyzed: utpādya tad mukha puccha spṛś sūtra sampātāt bindu traya spṛś vṛttam bhramayet
translated: Having rotated a circle touching the mouth and tail of that [fish] and touching the three points,

analyzed: udaya astamayayoḥ vikṣepa vaśāt ṛṇa dhana tva pratipādanāya āha
translated: In order to show the positive and negative values due to the deviation at sunrise and sunset, it is said:

analyzed: akṣa jyā vikṣepa guṇāḥ lambaka bhaktā phalam liptāḥ  uttara vikṣepe udaya sthita candre ṛṇam  astamaye dhanam
translated: The ecliptic latitude multiplied by the deviation, divided by the co-latitude, is the result in ghatis.🔽If the deviation is north and the moon is at the ascendant, it is negative.🔽At sunset, it is positive.

analyzed: yāmye vikṣepe udaya sthe candre dhanam

analyzed: astamaye ṛṇam iti

analyzed: udakṛṇadhanam udagayane dakṣiṇage dhanam ṛṇam yāmye  /

analyzed: vikṣepaḥ ca apakramaḥ ca vikṣepa apakramau

analyzed: vikṣepa apakramau guṇau yasya tat vikṣepa apakrama guṇam
translated: That which has vikṣepa and apākrama as its qualities is vikṣepāpakramaguṇa.

analyzed: vikṣepaḥ tātkālikaḥ gṛhyate
translated: The vikṣepa is taken as instantaneous.

analyzed: apakramaḥ ca parama apakramaḥ
translated: And the apākrama is the maximum apākrama.

analyzed: utkramaṇam utkrama jyām
translated: The utkramaṇa is the utkramaṇa arc.

analyzed: rāśi traya yuta candrasya utkrama jyām guṇayet
translated: One should multiply the utkramaṇa arc of the moon increased by three signs.
And divide by the product of the diameter and half the arc. The result

original: liptāḥ udagvikṣipte uttarāyaṇe ṛṇam dakṣiṇe dhanam /
analyzed: liptāḥ udagvikṣipte uttarāyaṇe ṛṇam dakṣiṇe dhanam
translated: is the minutes. In the northern projection in the northern ayana, it is a debt. In the southern ayana, it is a credit.

original: tat eva phalam dakṣiṇe ayane uttaravikṣipte dhanam /

analyzed: candrasya api svaccha tanu tvāt aṣṭamabhāgaḥ bimbasya channaḥ api anādeśyaḥ iti  grāhya bimbasya aṣṭama bhāgaḥ māna aikya ardhāt viśodhya śeṣaḥ iṣṭa grāsakarṇaḥ
translated: And because the moon is also clear and thin, even if one-eighth of the disc is obscured, it is not to be declared.🔽The remaining part after subtracting one-eighth of the grasped disc from one-half of the unit of measure is the desired eclipse chord.

analyzed: tad vargāt sphuṭa vikṣepa varga ūnāt mūlam iṣṭa ūna sthiti dala liptāḥ
translated: The square root of the desired eclipse chord squared minus the square of the true parallax is the desired true semi-diameter in minutes and seconds.

original: tāḥ ṣaṣṭiguṇāḥ gatyantarahṛtāḥ ghaṭikāḥ /🔽tāḥ sparśe tithyante
analyzed: tāḥ ṣaṣṭiguṇāḥ gati antara hṛtāḥ ghaṭikāḥ  tāḥ sparśe tithi ante
translated: Those [minutes and seconds] multiplied by sixty are the hours subtracted from the motion.

analyzed: viśodhayet  mokṣe api tithi ante yojayet
translated: At the time of contact, they are subtracted from the end of the lunar day.🔽At the time of release, they are added to the end of the lunar day.

analyzed: tau sparśa mokṣa kālau bhavataḥ
translated: Those are the times of contact and release.
The method of calculating the planets

analyzed: graha sādhana upāya pradarśana artham āha
translated: To show the method of calculating the planets, it is said:

original: kṣitiḥ aviyogāt dinakṛt ravīnduyogāt prasādhayet ca indum /
analyzed: kṣitiḥ aviyogāt dinakṛt ravi indu yogāt prasādhayet ca indum
translated: The earth should be calculated from the absence of conjunction, the sun from the conjunction of the sun and moon, and the moon should be calculated.

analyzed: śaśi tārā graha yogāt tathā eva tārā grahāḥ sarve
translated: In the same way, all the stars and planets should be calculated from the conjunction of the moon, stars, and planets.

analyzed: kṣitiḥ ca raviḥ ca
translated: The earth and the sun.

analyzed: tayoḥ yogaḥ kṣitiḥ aviyogaḥ
translated: The conjunction of those two is the conjunction of the sun and moon.

analyzed: tasmāt ravim sādhayet
translated: Therefore, one should accomplish the sun.
From the conjunction of the sun and moon, one should accomplish the moon.

original: śaśitārāgrahayogāt ca sarve tārāgrahāḥ ca sādhanīyāḥ /
analyzed: śaśi tārāgraha yogāt ca sarve tārāgrahāḥ ca sādhanīyāḥ
translated: And from the conjunction of the moon, stars, and planets, all the stars and planets should be accomplished.

analyzed: dṛś ucchritam salila samīkṛta bhū pradeśa maṇḍalakam cakra bhāga aṅkita vṛtta paridhim diś catuṣṭaya cihnitam kārayet
translated: One should have a circular area of the ground leveled with water, with a circumference marked with the parts of the circle, and marked with the four directions.

original: tasya aparabhāge sthitaḥ sāṃvatsaraḥ prākparidhau āsaktam udgacchantam sūryam lakṣayet /
analyzed: tasya aparabhāge sthitaḥ sāṃvatsaraḥ prākparidhau āsaktam udgacchantam sūryam lakṣayet
translated: The astronomer standing in the western part of that, should observe the rising sun attached to the eastern circumference.

original: tataḥ tatpradeśe cihnam kṛtvā tiṣṭhet yāvat anyodayam /
analyzed: tatas tad pradeśe cihnam kṛtvā tiṣṭhet yāvat anya udayam
translated: Then, having made a mark in that place, he should wait until another rising.

original: tatra api yatra paridhipradeśe sūryaḥ uditaḥ lakṣyate tatra cihnam nidadhyāt /
analyzed: tatra api yatra paridhi pradeśe sūryaḥ uditaḥ lakṣyate tatra cihnam nidadhyāt
translated: There also, where the sun is seen to rise in the region of the circumference, a mark should be placed there.

original: evam udayatrayeṇa catuṣkeṇa vā antaraghaṭikāḥ yantrādinā lakṣayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: evam udaya trayeṇa catuṣkeṇa vā antara ghaṭikāḥ yantra ādinā lakṣayitavyāḥ
translated: In this way, the interval ghatikas should be observed by three or four risings using a machine etc.

analyzed: tāḥ ravi bhuktayaḥ ravi udaya antarāle bhavanti
translated: Those are the solar transits that occur during the interval between sunrise and sunset.

analyzed: tāḥ eva sphuṭa ravi bhukti liptāḥ
translated: Those are the exact solar transit degrees.

analyzed: ānayet
translated: By the method of the sine etc. of the intersection of the midday shadow, one should bring the two suns.

analyzed: tayoḥ antaram vā
translated: The difference between them is the clear solar longitude.

original: atha meṣādau pravṛtte savitari sūryodayāḥ gaṇyante yāvat meṣādim praviśati /
analyzed: atha meṣādau pravṛtte savitari sūrya udayāḥ gaṇyante yāvat meṣādim praviśati

analyzed: te ravibhūyogāḥ jāyante
translated: Those solar ascensions are produced.

original: evam samyak upalakṣyamāṇāḥ ravibhagaṇabhoge śatatrayam pañcaṣaṣṭyā adhikam dinam bhavati /
analyzed: evam samyak upalakṣyamāṇāḥ ravi bhagaṇa bhoge śata trayam pañcaṣaṣṭyā adhikam dinam bhavati  /

translated: Fifteen ghaṭikās.🔽Thirty-one viṣamas.

analyzed: prāṇāḥ sārdha ekāḥ
translated: One and a half prāṇas.

original: tāḥ krameṇa savarṇitāḥ upari bhāgāḥ / chedaḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ krameṇa savarṇitāḥ upari bhāgāḥ chedaḥ

analyzed: evam etaiḥ aṃśaiḥ ṣaṣṭa sapta pañca chedaiḥ ekaḥ arka bhagaṇaḥ
translated: In this way, with these parts, sixty-seven and a quarter, is one solar degree.

analyzed: etaiḥ yak ādi mānam kriyate

analyzed: ravi indu yoga prasādhanāya sūrya adhikrānta candram upalakṣayet
translated: In order to establish the conjunction of the sun and moon, one should observe the moon traversed by the sun.

original: punar dvitīyam evam varṣam prati jāgareṇa dvādaśa ravīnduyogāḥ /
analyzed: punar dvitīyam evam varṣam prati jāgareṇa dvādaśa ravi indu yogāḥ

analyzed: catvāraḥ rāśayaḥ

analyzed: dvādaśa bhāgāḥ

analyzed: ṣaṭcatvāriṃśat liptāḥ

analyzed: catvāriṃśat viliptāḥ

analyzed: aṣṭacatvāriṃśat tad parāḥ

analyzed: ekena ravi bhagaṇena yutāḥ ete savarṇitāḥ

original: yugagatacandrabhagaṇāḥ trairāśikena yadi ekena ravibhagaṇabhogena etāvantaḥ
analyzed: yuga gata candra bhagaṇāḥ trairāśikena yadi ekena ravi bhagaṇa bhogena etāvantaḥ

analyzed: labdham yuge candra bhagaṇāḥ

analyzed: savarṇitāḥ

original: etaiḥ trairāśikam yadi ekasmin ravibhagaṇabhoge etāvantaḥ candrodayāḥ bhavanti /
analyzed: etaiḥ trairāśikam yadi ekasmin ravi bhagaṇa bhoge etāvantaḥ candra udayāḥ bhavanti
translated: If so many moonrises occur in one solar mansion,

analyzed: tadā yuga ravi bhagaṇa bhoge kiyantaḥ
translated: then how many in the solar mansions of the yuga?

analyzed: prāgvat yuge candra udayāḥ jātāḥ  kṣiti bhagaṇebhyaḥ śuddhāḥ yuga candra bhagaṇāḥ
translated: As before, the moonrises of the yuga are obtained.🔽The lunar mansions of the yuga subtracted from the terrestrial mansions.

analyzed: śaśi tārā graha yogān śaśi bhagaṇebhyaḥ viśodhya śeṣam iṣṭa grahasya bhagaṇāḥ
translated: The mansions of the desired planet are the remainder when the lunar mansions are subtracted from the lunar mansions and asterisms of the moon.

analyzed: varṣam prati jāgareṇa candra bṛhaspati yogāḥ bhagaṇāḥ  rāśayaḥ
translated: The lunar mansions of the moon and Jupiter are the mansions for each year in the Jāgara.🔽Signs.

analyzed: bhāgāḥ

analyzed: liptāḥ

analyzed: viliptāḥ tad parāḥ
translated: smeared with, intent on that.

analyzed: ete krameṇa savarṇitāḥ jātāḥ  yadi ekasmin ravi bhagaṇe etāvantaḥ

translated: Jupiter-Moon conjunctions are obtained in one solar revolution,

analyzed: tadā yuga ra vi bhagaṇe

translated: The Jupiter-Moon conjunctions in a yuga year are obtained. Subtracting from the lunar revolutions, the remainder are the Jupiter revolutions in a yuga.

original: evam bhaumādīnām api ravibhagaṇabhogam yāvat candreṇa saha yogān prasādhya grahabhagaṇasādhanam kartavyam /
analyzed: evam bhauma ādīnām api ravi bhagaṇa bhogam yāvat candreṇa saha yogān prasādhya graha bhagaṇa sādhanam kartavyam

analyzed: mārga darśanam eva etat asmat ādīnām aviṣayaḥ
translated: This is merely a demonstration of the path, not within the scope of us and others.
The quick calculation for Mercury and Venus:

original: prācyām astamitaḥ paścāt yāvadbhiḥ dinaiḥ uditaḥ tāvatām dinānām ardham udayadinebhyaḥ pātayet astamitadineṣu kṣipet /
analyzed: prācyām astamitaḥ paścāt yāvadbhiḥ dinaiḥ uditaḥ tāvatām dinānām ardham udayadinebhyaḥ pātayet astamita dineṣu kṣipet
translated: When set in the east, after how many days it rises in the west, subtracting half of those days from the days of rising, adding to the days of setting.

original: punar prācyām yadā astamayaḥ pratīcyām udayaḥ tadā anena eva vidhinā niraṃśadinasiddhiḥ kāryā /
analyzed: punar prācyām yadā astamayaḥ pratīcyām udayaḥ tadā anena eva vidhinā niraṃśa dina siddhiḥ kāryā
translated: Again, when there is setting in the east and rising in the west, then by this very method, the calculation of the partless days should be done.

analyzed: tayoḥ ādi anta niraṃśayoḥ madhye śīghra kendra bhagaṇaḥ bhavati
translated: In the middle of those first and last partless [days], there is the revolution of the quick center.

analyzed: budhasya śīghrakendra bhagaṇa dināni āsannāni śukrasya
translated: The longitudes of the ascendant in degrees of Mercury, Venus,

analyzed: etaiḥ bhūdinebhyaḥ bhāgam da tvā labdham
translated: having divided by these [degrees] the days elapsed, the remainder

analyzed: budha śukra śīghraka indra bhagaṇāḥ bhavanti
translated: are the longitudes of the ascendant of Mercury and Venus.

analyzed: ravi ucca paridhi sādhanam
translated: The calculation of the apogee of the sun:

original: madhyāhnacchāyayā ravim prasādhya taddinamadhyamaraviṇā viśeṣya madhyame adhike ṛṇam / dhanamūle /
analyzed: madhyāhna chāyayā ravim prasādhya tad dina madhyama raviṇā viśeṣya madhyame adhike ṛṇam dhana mūle
translated: Having determined the sun by the midday shadow, the difference with the mean sun of that day is added if the mean [sun] is greater, [and] subtracted if less.

original: evam pratidinam upalabhya yāvat vardhamānam raviphalam sthirībhavati /
analyzed: evam pratidinam upalabhya yāvat vardhamānam raviphalam sthirībhavati
translated: Having thus observed [the sun] every day, as long as the increasing result of the sun becomes constant,

analyzed: tad phalam parama phalam
translated: that result is the maximum result.

analyzed: tatas param hrāsam eṣyati
translated: After that, it will decrease.

original: paramaphaladine madhyame arke ṛṇaphalopalakṣite rāśitrayam śodhayet /
analyzed: parama phala dine madhyame arke ṛṇa phala upalakṣite rāśi trayam śodhayet
translated: On the day of the maximum result, if the mean sun is characterized by a negative result, one should subtract three signs.

analyzed: śeṣam ravi manda uccam
translated: The remainder is the mean apogee of the sun.

analyzed: dhana phala upalakṣite rāśi trayam kṣipet
translated: If it is characterized by a positive result, one should add three signs.

analyzed: manda uccam bhavati
translated: The apogee becomes [the sum].

analyzed: parama phala jyā cakra aṃśa hatā trijyā hṛtā  raveḥ paridhiḥ bhavati
translated: The maximum result sine, multiplied by the arc of the circle, divided by the sine of three [signs],🔽is the apogee of the sun.
The calculation of the apogee of the moon:

original: sūryāstamayāt kṛṣṇe pakṣe yāvatībhiḥ ghaṭikābhiḥ candrodayaḥ bhavati ghaṭikāyantrasādhitābhiḥ tābhiḥ ṣaḍrāśiyutāt arkāt lagnam svodayaiḥ tripraśnoktavidhinā 🔽kartavyam /
analyzed: sūrya astamayāt kṛṣṇe pakṣe yāvatībhiḥ ghaṭikābhiḥ candra udayaḥ bhavati ghaṭikāyantra sādhitābhiḥ tābhiḥ ṣaṣ rāśi yutāt arkāt lagnam sva udayaiḥ tri praśna ukta vidhinā  / kartavyam
translated: From sunset in the dark fortnight, the moonrise occurs after so many ghatis, as determined by the ghatikā yantra. From the sun with those [ghatis] added to six signs, the ascendant should be determined by the method stated in the Triprakāśa.

analyzed: sa sphuṭa candraḥ
translated: That is the true moon.

original: tat tātkālikamadhyamacandraviśleṣaśeṣam māndaphalam dhanum ṛṇam vā /
analyzed: tat tātkālika madhyama candra viśleṣa śeṣam mānda phalam dhanum ṛṇam vā
translated: The remainder of the separation of the moon from the mean moon at that time is the true longitude, in signs, degrees, and so on.

original: evam pratyaham upalakṣayet pūrvavat yāvat vardhamānaphalam sthirībhavati /🔽tataḥ ravivat uccaparidhisādhanam /
analyzed: evam pratyaham upalakṣayet pūrvavat yāvat vardhamāna phalam sthirībhavati  tatas ravi vat ucca paridhi sādhanam
translated: In the same way, one should observe it daily as before until the increasing true longitude becomes stable.🔽Then, like the sun, the determination of the highest declination is done.

analyzed: evam pratidinam kuryāt yāvat madhyama sphuṭayoḥ
translated: In this way, one should do it daily until

analyzed: na kiñcid antaram syāt
translated: there is no difference at all between the mean and true [declinations].

analyzed: saḥ eva candraḥ tad uccam bhavati
translated: That very moon is its highest declination.

original: taddinaparamaphalapātadinoccayoḥ antaram kṛtvā taddinaparamaphalārkayoḥ antaram kāryam /
analyzed: tad dina parama phala pāta dina uccayoḥ antaram kṛtvā tad dina parama phala arkayoḥ antaram kāryam
translated: Having subtracted the difference between the highest declination on that day and the declination on the day of the true perigee, one should make the difference between the sun and the true perigee on that day.

original: tataḥ trairāśikam yadi anena gatyantareṇa etat uccāntaram /🔽tadā sūryabhagaṇaiḥ kim iti androccabhagaṇasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: tatas trairāśikam yadi anena gati antareṇa etat ucca antaram  tadā sūrya bhagaṇaiḥ kim iti andra ucca bhagaṇa siddhiḥ
translated: Then, the tripartite calculation: if with this difference in motion, this is the difference in declination,🔽then with the sun's bhaganas, what is it? Thus, the true declination of the moon in bhaganas is determined.
The determination of the moon's perigee bhaganas.

original: candragrahaṇe sparśakālāt madhyagrahaṇam yāvat sthityardhaghaṭikāḥ candragrahaṇakālotpannāḥ tāḥ sphuṭasūryaśaśibhuktyantareṇa guṇayet /
analyzed: candra grahaṇe sparśa kālāt madhya grahaṇam yāvat sthiti ardha ghaṭikāḥ candra grahaṇa kāla utpannāḥ tāḥ sphuṭa sūrya śaśi bhukti antareṇa guṇayet
translated: From the time of contact in the lunar eclipse up to the middle of the eclipse, the half-period of the eclipse is multiplied by the difference between the true longitudes of the sun and moon.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭyā vibhajet  sthiti ardha liptāḥ syuḥ
translated: It is divided by 60.🔽The half-period of the eclipse will be in minutes.

original: tadvargam samparkārdhavargāt viśodhya śeṣasya mūlam candravikṣepaḥ /
analyzed: tad vargam samparka ardha vargāt viśodhya śeṣasya mūlam candra vikṣepaḥ
translated: The square of that, subtracted from the square of the semi-arc, the square root of the remainder is the lunar equation.

analyzed: sa trijyā hataḥ khāga akṣi bhaktaḥ kāṣṭhitaḥ bhuja cāpam
translated: That, multiplied by the co-latitude, divided by 900, is the arc of the chord.

original: evam mokṣam api sthityardham madhyagrahaṇāt jānīyāt /🔽yadi prathamasthityardham mahat ojapade
analyzed: evam mokṣam api sthiti ardham madhya grahaṇāt jānīyāt  yadi prathama sthiti ardham mahat oja pade
translated: In the same way, one should know the release, which is half the period of the eclipse, from the middle of the eclipse.

analyzed: grahaḥ bhavati
translated: If the first half of the period of the eclipse is great, the planet will be in the foot of the zodiac.

analyzed: anyathā yugma pade syāt
translated: Otherwise, it will be in the middle of the zodiac.

analyzed: yadi uttara vikṣepaḥ viṣama pade bhuja cāpam sphuṭam
translated: If the northern equation is in an odd sign, the arc of the chord is true.

original: yugmapade cakrārdhāt viśodhya bhavati /🔽dakṣiṇavikṣepe viṣamapade cakrārdham kṣipet /
analyzed: yugma pade cakra ardhāt viśodhya bhavati  dakṣiṇa vikṣepe viṣama pade cakra ardham kṣipet
translated: In an even sign, it is obtained by subtracting from half a circle.🔽In a southern equation, in an odd sign, one should add half a circle.

analyzed: yugmapade cakrāt viśodhayet
translated: In an even sign, one should subtract from a circle.

analyzed: sa bāhuḥ syāt
translated: That will be the arm.

analyzed: evam svadhiyā śeṣam ca
translated: In the same way, the rest by one's own intelligence.

analyzed: evam anyat grahaṇa kālikam bāhum utpādayet
translated: In this way, one should produce the arm for the time of the eclipse in other cases.

analyzed: ubhayoḥ antaram sādhayet
translated: One should determine the difference between the two.🔽The declination of the moon at the time between the two observations.

analyzed: tatas candra pāta bhagaṇa siddhiḥ
translated: From that, the determination of the true longitude of the moon.

original: athavā candrasya dinārdhacchāyayā krāntim uktavat prasādhayet /
analyzed: athavā candrasya dina ardha chāyayā krāntim ukta vat prasādhayet
translated: Or, one should determine the true motion of the moon by half of its daily shadow, as stated.

analyzed: tasyāḥ tad dina candra krānti antaram vikṣepaḥ
translated: The difference between that and the true motion of the moon for that day is the equation.

analyzed: śeṣam prāgvat iti
translated: The remainder is as before.

original: budhasitayoḥ yāvatā rātrigatakālena astamayaḥ jāyate tāvatā lagnam ṣaḍrāśiyutam sphuṭaḥ budhaḥ śukraḥ ca /
analyzed: budha sitayoḥ yāvatā rātri gata kālena astamayaḥ jāyate tāvatā lagnam ṣaṣ rāśi yutam sphuṭaḥ budhaḥ śukraḥ ca
translated: For Mercury and Venus, the ascendant added to six signs by the amount of time elapsed during the night is the true Mercury and Venus.

analyzed: śeṣāṇām candravat ānayanam rātrigate kāle
translated: For the others, the method is the same as for the moon, for the time elapsed during the night.

analyzed: madhya sphuṭayoḥ antaram manda phala yuta viyutam śīghra phalam
translated: The difference between the mean and true [positions] added to or subtracted from the slow equation is the fast equation.

analyzed: punar pañcabhiḥ ahobhiḥ phalasādhanam kartavyam
translated: Again, the equation should be calculated for five days.

analyzed: prāc phalena saha viśleṣayet

analyzed: evam sva dhiyā abhyūhya śīghra ucca paridhi sādhanam
translated: In this way, one should infer by one's own intelligence the method of calculating the fast-moving latitude.

analyzed: tārā graha yoga antarāt
translated: From the difference between the true longitudes of the stars and planets,

analyzed: graha vikṣepa sādhanam kartavyam
translated: the equation of the planets should be calculated.
The calculation of the swift zodiacal signs should be done by the curved and straight paths of rising and setting.

original: athavā graham yaṣṭyādiyantreṇa viditvā dvitīye api dine tāvati eva kāle viddhyāt /

translated: Or else, having determined the planet by means of a staff instrument etc., on the second day also, one should know it at that very time.

analyzed: tad antaram sphuṭa bhuktiḥ
translated: That difference is the true declination.

original: sā madhyamabhukteḥ yadā ūnā syāt tadā kakṣyāmaṇḍalāt upari grahaḥ /
analyzed: sā madhyamabhukteḥ yadā ūnā syāt tadā kakṣyāmaṇḍalāt upari grahaḥ

analyzed: adhikā ced tadā adhas vartate
translated: And if it is greater, then it is below.

analyzed: tad bhū madhya antaram karṇaḥ
translated: That difference between the true and mean declinations is the sine.

original: tadvaśāt paramālpatām paramādhikatām ca bhukteḥ lakṣayet iti bhagaṇabhogam yāvat /🔽bhagaṇabhogaḥ madhyamagatyā

translated: By its power, one should know the maximum smallness and maximum excess of the declination, as far as the zodiacal sign declination.

analyzed: eva bhavati
translated: The zodiacal sign declination occurs only by the mean motion.

original: evam mandaphalasya paramādhikatām lakṣayitvā paramamandakarṇavyāsārdhāntaram paramaphalam māndam bhavati // //
